analyzed: ngan song gsum gyi g-yang sar ltung ba la gcig tu gzhol ba /

original: bde 'gro gnyis las phyir phyogs pa /
analyzed: bde 'gro gnyis las phyir phyogs pa /
translated: One turns away from the two happy realms.

original: zhi ba'i rgyun gyi gnas skabs thag bsrings pa dang ji ltar bris pa'i bstan bcos gcig tsam rtogs pas bstan bcos thams cad khong du chud pas 'dres par dam bca' ba /

translated: One distances oneself from the state of the continuum of peace, and one makes the mixed claim that by understanding just one treatise, as it is written, one understands all treatises.

original: bdag nyid bstod pa'i nyes pa ma mthong ba /
analyzed: bdag nyid bstod pa'i nyes pa ma mthong ba /

original: 'dul ba la sogs pa'i bstan bcos rtogs pas blo gsal ba /
analyzed: 'dul ba la sogs pa'i bstan bcos rtogs pas blo gsal ba /

original: rno ba dri ma med pa /
analyzed: rno ba dri ma med pa /

analyzed: rnam par dag par 'gyur ba spong bar byed pa'i ched du 'di brtsams so zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: This was composed for the purpose of abandoning that.

original: de la brnyas pa ni ma gus pa'am smod pa'o //
analyzed: de la brnyas pa ni ma gus pa'am smod pa'o //
translated: There, contempt is disrespect or disparagement.

original: de la rig pa zhes bya ba ni 'dul ba shes pa ste 'dul ba 'dzin pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de la rig pa zhes bya ba ni 'dul ba shes pa ste 'dul ba 'dzin pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: There, knowledge is the knowledge of the Vinaya, which means the same as “one who upholds the Vinaya.”

original: rnam smod ni rnam par smod pa'o //
analyzed: rnam smod ni rnam par smod pa'o //
translated: Disparagement is disparaging.

original: snyems pa ni dregs pa'am nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: snyems pa ni dregs pa'am nga rgyal lo //
translated: Conceit is arrogance or pride.

original: 'chang ba ni bsrel ba'o //
analyzed: 'chang ba ni bsrel ba'o //
translated: To uphold is to maintain.

original: de'i ched du zhes bya ba ni 'dul ba 'dzin pa la rnam par smod pa'i ched du'o //
analyzed: de'i ched du zhes bya ba ni 'dul ba 'dzin pa la rnam par smod pa'i ched du'o //
translated: For the sake of that is for the sake of disparaging those who uphold the Vinaya.

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni 'dul ba'i dri ba bsdus pa sems la gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni 'dul ba'i dri ba bsdus pa sems la gzhag pa'o //
translated: This is the summary of questions on the Vinaya that is placed in the mind.

original: brjod do zhes bya ba ni bsnyad pa ste /
analyzed: brjod do zhes bya ba ni bsnyad pa ste /
translated: It is said means it is explained.

original: phyi rol du ston to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: phyi rol du ston to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means it is shown externally.

original: kha cig zhe sdang gis 'dul ba shes pa kho na la rnam par smod par byed kyi /
analyzed: kha cig zhe sdang gis 'dul ba shes pa kho na la rnam par smod par byed kyi /
translated: Some disparage only the knowledge of the Vinaya out of hatred,

original: 'dul ba la ni ma yin pas 'dul ba las zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: 'dul ba la ni ma yin pas 'dul ba las zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: but not the Vinaya itself, so “from the Vinaya” is stated.

original: la la ni 'di gnyis la smod par byed kyi nga rgyal gyis khong gang ba'i sems kyis bdag nyid khongs pa ma yin pas de'i phyir yang zhes bya ba'i sgras de la yod pa'i snyems pa bsdu'o //
analyzed: la la ni 'di gnyis la smod par byed kyi nga rgyal gyis khong gang ba'i sems kyis bdag nyid khongs pa ma yin pas de'i phyir yang zhes bya ba'i sgras de la yod pa'i snyems pa bsdu'o //
translated: Some disparage these two, but not because their minds are filled with pride, since they do not exalt themselves. Therefore, the word “also” includes the conceit that exists in them.

original: dri ba kun las btus pa bshad do zhes dam bcas pa gang gi don du 'di brtsams pa de brjod dgos pas /
analyzed: dri ba kun las btus pa bshad do zhes dam bcas pa gang gi don du 'di brtsams pa de brjod dgos pas /
translated: The question is asked: “The Compendium of Questions is explained,” and it is necessary to state the purpose for which this was composed.

original: sems can mi'i 'gro ba yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sems can mi'i 'gro ba yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said: “Sentient beings are human beings,” and so on.

original: sems can gyi sems pa phun sum tshogs pa'i phyir sems dang sems las byung ba'i rgyud ma nyams pa ste /
analyzed: sems can gyi sems pa phun sum tshogs pa'i phyir sems dang sems las byung ba'i rgyud ma nyams pa ste /
translated: Because the minds of sentient beings are perfect, the continuum of mind and mental factors is unbroken.

original: tha snyad pa'i blo ma nyams pa zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽sems @76a * //
analyzed: tha snyad pa'i blo ma nyams pa zhes bya ba'i don to // sems @76a * //
translated: The meaning is that conventional cognition is unbroken.

original: can zhes smos pas ni smyon pa la sogs pa bkag go //
analyzed: can zhes smos pas ni smyon pa la sogs pa bkag go //
translated: By mentioning “sentient beings,” those who are insane and so on are excluded.

original: mi'i 'gro ba ni mi'i 'gro bar skyes pa ste /
analyzed: mi'i 'gro ba ni mi'i 'gro bar skyes pa ste /
translated: “Human beings” means born in the human realm.

original: mi'i 'gro ba zhes smos pas ni mi'i 'gro ba ma yin pa bsal to //
analyzed: mi'i 'gro ba zhes smos pas ni mi'i 'gro ba ma yin pa bsal to //
translated: By mentioning “human beings,” those who are not human beings are excluded.

analyzed: bar chad rnams kyang bsal ba la zhes bya ba ni ma bsad pa dang pha bsad pa nyid la sogs pa sdom pa skye ba'i gegs byed pa rnams med pa'o //
translated: And the obstacles are removed means that the obstacles to the arising of the vow, such as the killing of one's mother and father, are absent.

original: sdom pa ni dge tshul la sogs pa'i ngo bo ste /
analyzed: sdom pa ni dge tshul la sogs pa'i ngo bo ste /
translated: The vow is the essence of the novice monk and so forth.

original: 'chal ba'i tshul khrims kyi rgyun 'gog par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'chal ba'i tshul khrims kyi rgyun 'gog par byed pa'o //
translated: It is the cessation of the stream of immorality.

original: mi 'chags pa ni mi skye ba'o //
analyzed: mi 'chags pa ni mi skye ba'o //
translated: Non-arising is non-production.

original: gsungs pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyi 'dul ba las so //
analyzed: gsungs pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyi 'dul ba las so //
translated: It is stated in the Vinaya of the Bhagavān.

original: ji lta bu yin zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gang gis so ;
analyzed: ji lta bu yin zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gang gis so ;
translated: What kind? By what kind of aspect.

original: / bsgrims te zhes bya ba ni 'bod de zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: / bsgrims te zhes bya ba ni 'bod de zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Attentively means calling out.

original: de bzhin du 'og ma dag la yang shes par bya'o //🔽'di la 'dri ba'i bsam pa ni mi'i 'gro ba yang yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'og ma dag la yang shes par bya'o // 'di la 'dri ba'i bsam pa ni mi'i 'gro ba yang yin la /
translated: The same should be understood for the following.🔽The intention of the question here is: There is no doubt that the vow arises for one who is a human being,

original: smyon pa la sogs pa bar chad kyi chos dang yang bral ba gang yin pa de la sdom pa skye ba ko the tshom yang med pa kho na yin na /
analyzed: smyon pa la sogs pa bar chad kyi chos dang yang bral ba gang yin pa de la sdom pa skye ba ko the tshom yang med pa kho na yin na /

original: 'on kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis kha cig las 'di la sdom pa skye ba med pa nyid du gsungs pa de 'di la sdom pa skye ba'i gegs ji lta bu zhig yod par gsungs pa khyod kyis 'bod de kho bo la smros shig ces bya ba 'di yin
analyzed: 'on kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis kha cig las 'di la sdom pa skye ba med pa nyid du gsungs pa de 'di la sdom pa skye ba'i gegs ji lta bu zhig yod par gsungs pa khyod kyis 'bod de kho bo la smros shig ces bya ba 'di yin
translated: You must call out to me and tell me what kind of obstacle to the arising of vows he taught.

original: no // 'di la lan ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: no // 'di la lan ni 'di yin te /

analyzed: byang gi sgra mi snyan pa'i mi'i dbang du mdzad nas de skad gsungs pa yin no //

original: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Similarly, here the text says:

analyzed: nye ba 'khor bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa'o zhes bya ba yin no //

analyzed: gal te byang gi sgra mi snyan pa yang bar chad yin no zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If it is said that even Kuru in the north is an obstacle, that is not so.

original: bkol ba chad pa yan chad yin no //
analyzed: bkol ba chad pa yan chad yin no //
translated: It is an obstacle if one is a slave or a criminal.

original: 'di la skye ba'i chos nyid med par 'dra'o //
analyzed: 'di la skye ba'i chos nyid med par 'dra'o //
translated: It is the same for the one who is not a monk, for he does not have the nature of being born.

original: de lta bu'i rtags can ni bsnyil bar bya ba 'dir bar chad kyi chos kyi nang du ma bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rtags can ni bsnyil bar bya ba 'dir bar chad kyi chos kyi nang du ma bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The one who has such a sign is to be expelled, because he is not mentioned in the Dharma of obstacles.

original: de bzhin du 'og ma dag la'ang ci rigs par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'og ma dag la'ang ci rigs par shes par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, one should understand the others as appropriate.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na mkhan po dge slong ma yin pa nyid du shes pa la dgongs nas de skad gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na mkhan po dge slong ma yin pa nyid du shes pa la dgongs nas de skad gsungs pa yin te /
translated: In one interpretation, the Buddha spoke with the intention that the preceptor is not a monk.

original: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: In the same way, here is the text:

original: mkhan po rku thabs su gnas pa zhig gis bsnyen par rdzogs par 'tshal bar bsnyen par rdzogs par bgyid @76b na bsnyen bar rdzogs pa zhes bgyi'am bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa zhes bgyi /
analyzed: mkhan po rku thabs su gnas pa zhig gis bsnyen par rdzogs par 'tshal bar bsnyen par rdzogs par bgyid @76b na bsnyen bar rdzogs pa zhes bgyi'am bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa zhes bgyi /
translated: “A monk who is a preceptor wishes to give full ordination to someone who is living by theft. Should he give full ordination to him? Is he fully ordained or not?”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: gal te bdag gi mkhan po rku thabs su gnas pa yin no zhes bya bar shes na bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gal te bdag gi mkhan po rku thabs su gnas pa yin no zhes bya bar shes na bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: “If he knows that his preceptor is living by theft, he is not fully ordained.”

original: gal te mi shes na bsnyen par rdzogs ba zhes bya'o zhes bya ba yin no /
analyzed: gal te mi shes na bsnyen par rdzogs ba zhes bya'o zhes bya ba yin no /
translated: If he does not know, he is called fully ordained.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na mkhan po spong ba la dgongs nas de skad gsungs te /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na mkhan po spong ba la dgongs nas de skad gsungs te /
translated: Alternatively, the statement is made with the intention of abandoning the preceptor.

original: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Similarly, the text here states:

original: bsnyen par rdzogs par bgyid pa'i tshe mkhan po spong bar bgyid na bsnyen par rdzogs pa zhes bgyi'am /
analyzed: bsnyen par rdzogs par bgyid pa'i tshe mkhan po spong bar bgyid na bsnyen par rdzogs pa zhes bgyi'am /
translated: “If, at the time of full ordination, one abandons the preceptor, is that called full ordination?”

original: bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa zhes bgyi /
analyzed: bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa zhes bgyi /
translated: “Is it called not full ordination?”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: He replied:

original: bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: “It is called not full ordination.”

original: rnam pa gcig tu na bsnyen par rdzogs par bya ba dang mkhan po dag gi ming ma smos pa la dgongs nas de skad gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na bsnyen par rdzogs par bya ba dang mkhan po dag gi ming ma smos pa la dgongs nas de skad gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Alternatively, the statement is made with the intention of not mentioning the names of the one who is fully ordained and the preceptor.

original: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Similarly, the text here states:

original: gang zag gsum ni bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa yin te /
analyzed: gang zag gsum ni bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa yin te /
translated: “Three persons are not fully ordained:

original: bdag gi ming nas mi brjod pa dang / mkhan po'i ming nas mi brjod pa dang / bsnyen par rdzogs bar mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gi ming nas mi brjod pa dang / mkhan po'i ming nas mi brjod pa dang / bsnyen par rdzogs bar mi shes pa'o //
translated: one who does not recite his own name, one who does not recite the name of the preceptor and one who does not know full ordination.”

original: de bzhin du las byed pas mkhan po dang bsnyen par rdzogs par 'dod pa dang / dge 'dun te gsum gyi ming mi sgrogs na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du las byed pas mkhan po dang bsnyen par rdzogs par 'dod pa dang / dge 'dun te gsum gyi ming mi sgrogs na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: So too, the text should be interpreted as referring to a monk who does not proclaim the names of the three—the preceptor, the aspirant, and the saṅgha—when he is the officiating monk and the aspirant is desirous of full ordination.

original: yang na 'di ni khyim pa'am mu stegs can gyi rgyal mtshan 'chang ba'am gcer bu pa'am 'khrug pa la dgongs nas gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: yang na 'di ni khyim pa'am mu stegs can gyi rgyal mtshan 'chang ba'am gcer bu pa'am 'khrug pa la dgongs nas gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Or this refers to one who holds the banner of a householder or a tīrthika, or one who is naked or quarrelsome.

original: 'di la bdag gi lung gi khungs ni ma rnyed do //
analyzed: 'di la bdag gi lung gi khungs ni ma rnyed do //
translated: I have not found the scriptural source for this.

original: mdo byed pa la brten nas smras pa yin par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: mdo byed pa la brten nas smras pa yin par blta bar bya ste /
translated: It should be regarded as a statement based on a treatise.

original: de bzhin du 'di la mdo byed pas bshad pa ni khyim pa dang mu stegs can gyi rgyal mtshan can la'ang mi skye'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'di la mdo byed pas bshad pa ni khyim pa dang mu stegs can gyi rgyal mtshan can la'ang mi skye'o //
translated: So too, the author of the treatise states: “It does not arise for one who holds the banner of a householder or a tīrthika.

original: sgren mo dang 'khrug pa dang mtshan dug ma dag la yang mi skye'o zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: sgren mo dang 'khrug pa dang mtshan dug ma dag la yang mi skye'o zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: It also does not arise for one who is naked or quarrelsome or has a defective organ.”

original: snga ma la yang mdo byed pas bshad pa ni mi ma yin pa'i 'gro ba pa dang byang gi sgra mi snyan pa gnyis ni sdom pa'i zhing nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: snga ma la yang mdo byed pas bshad pa ni mi ma yin pa'i 'gro ba pa dang byang gi sgra mi snyan pa gnyis ni sdom pa'i zhing nyid ma yin no //
translated: Nonhuman reincarnating beings and those of the northern continent of Kuru are not fields of karmic maturation for the vows.

original: de dge slong nyid ma yin par shes na mi skye'o //
analyzed: de dge slong nyid ma yin par shes na mi skye'o //
translated: If one knows that they are not fully ordained monks, the vows do not arise.

original: de'i phyir spong ba la yang mi skye'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir spong ba la yang mi skye'o //
translated: Therefore, even if one renounces them, the vows do not arise.

original: de gnyis kyi ming ma brjod na yang mi skye'o //
analyzed: de gnyis kyi ming ma brjod na yang mi skye'o //
translated: Even if one does not mention their names, the vows do not arise.

original: dge 'dun gyi na yang de'i skye gnas kyi mi skye'o zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi na yang de'i skye gnas kyi mi skye'o zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Even if one is a member of the saṅgha, the vows do not arise in that reincarnating being.

original: pha dang ma ni pha ma'o //
analyzed: pha dang ma ni pha ma'o //
translated: Father and mother are one’s own parents.

original: ched du bsams pa ni blo sngon du btang ba'o //
analyzed: ched du bsams pa ni blo sngon du btang ba'o //
translated: Deliberate means with prior intention.

original: ched du bsams pa zhes smos pa @77a * //
analyzed: ched du bsams pa zhes smos pa @77a * //
translated: The term deliberate

original: ni ched du bsams pa ma yin pa de dgag pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ni ched du bsams pa ma yin pa de dgag pa'i phyir te /
translated: is stated because it is a negation of nondeliberate.

original: 'di ltar ched du ma bsams par grub pa ni byed pa po nyid ma yin no zhes 'byung bas ched du bsams pa ma yin par de dag bsad pa la mtshams med pa ldang bar ma gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar ched du ma bsams par grub pa ni byed pa po nyid ma yin no zhes 'byung bas ched du bsams pa ma yin par de dag bsad pa la mtshams med pa ldang bar ma gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since it is said that one is not the agent of that which is accomplished without deliberation, it is said that the heinous act of killing them without deliberation does not arise.

original: gsod pa ni gsod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gsod pa ni gsod par byed pa'o //
translated: Killing is the act of killing.🔽A bhikshu is one who is expelled.

original: dge slong ma ni sun phyung dang // zhes bya ba ni dge slong ma ma rung bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong ma ni sun phyung dang // zhes bya ba ni dge slong ma ma rung bar byed pa'o //
translated: A bhikshu is one who is corrupted.

original: dge 'dun dbyen byed pa ni dge 'dun ston pa dang lam gzhan la 'dod pa skyed pa'i sgo nas rnam gnyis su byed pa'i phyir te /🔽ston dang lam gzhan la bzod pa //
analyzed: dge 'dun dbyen byed pa ni dge 'dun ston pa dang lam gzhan la 'dod pa skyed pa'i sgo nas rnam gnyis su byed pa'i phyir te / ston dang lam gzhan la bzod pa //
translated: A schism in the Sangha is a division of the Sangha into two factions through generating desire for a different teacher and path.

original: dbye ba'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbye ba'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is a schism because it is said, “One who accepts a different teacher and path.”

original: sdom pa'i ched du zhes bya ba ni sdom pa skye ba'i snod nyid du'o //
analyzed: sdom pa'i ched du zhes bya ba ni sdom pa skye ba'i snod nyid du'o //
translated: The purpose of the vow is to be a vessel for the arising of the vow.

original: 'di la 'dri ba'i bsam pa ni ma gsod pa dang / pha gsod pa dang / dge slong ma sun dbyung ba dang / dge 'dun gyi dbyen byed pa ni 'di ltar mtshams med pa la sogs pa byed pa yin pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis sdom pa skye ba 'byung bar mi rung ba nyid du gsungs la /
analyzed: 'di la 'dri ba'i bsam pa ni ma gsod pa dang / pha gsod pa dang / dge slong ma sun dbyung ba dang / dge 'dun gyi dbyen byed pa ni 'di ltar mtshams med pa la sogs pa byed pa yin pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis sdom pa skye ba 'byung bar mi rung ba nyid du gsungs la /
translated: The intention of the questioner is this: The Bhagavan has said that it is not suitable for one who has committed heinous acts such as killing one’s mother, killing one’s father, killing an arhat, and creating a schism in the Sangha to generate the vow.

original: 'on kyang rnam pa gzhan 'ga' zhig gis sdom pa skye bar 'os ba nyid du yang gsungs pas de lta bu yin pa kho bo la smros shig bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang rnam pa gzhan 'ga' zhig gis sdom pa skye bar 'os ba nyid du yang gsungs pas de lta bu yin pa kho bo la smros shig bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: But others say that it is proper to generate the vows in other ways, so tell me if you are like that.

original: ma bsad pa dang / pha bsad pa dang / dge slong ma sun phyung ba dang / dge 'dun gyi dbyen byed pa 'di dag ni dgra bcom pa bsad pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa la ngan sems kyis khrag 'byin ba dag gi dpe tsam du zad do //
analyzed: ma bsad pa dang / pha bsad pa dang / dge slong ma sun phyung ba dang / dge 'dun gyi dbyen byed pa 'di dag ni dgra bcom pa bsad pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa la ngan sems kyis khrag 'byin ba dag gi dpe tsam du zad do //
translated: Killing one's mother, killing one's father, killing an arhat, causing a Buddha to bleed through evil intent, and creating a schism in the saṅgha are merely examples.

original: 'di la lan ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'di la lan ni 'di yin te /
translated: The answer to this is as follows.

original: gzhan gyi 'du shes kyis bsad pa la sogs pa la dgongs nas de skad gsungs pa yin no ;
analyzed: gzhan gyi 'du shes kyis bsad pa la sogs pa la dgongs nas de skad gsungs pa yin no ;
translated: It was stated with the intention of killing and so on through the perception of others.

original: / de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: / de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Similarly, the text here states:

original: btsun pa re zhig dge slong rnams kyis ma bkums pa'i gang zag gcig bsnyen par rdzogs par bgyid na bsnyen par rdzogs pa zhes bgyi'am /
analyzed: btsun pa re zhig dge slong rnams kyis ma bkums pa'i gang zag gcig bsnyen par rdzogs par bgyid na bsnyen par rdzogs pa zhes bgyi'am /
translated: “Lord, if a monk fully ordained a single person who is not bound by the vows, is it called full ordination?”

original: bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa zhes bgyi /
analyzed: bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa zhes bgyi /
translated: “Is it not called full ordination?”

original: nye ba 'khor kha cig ni bsnyen par rdzogs pa zhes bya la /
analyzed: nye ba 'khor kha cig ni bsnyen par rdzogs pa zhes bya la /
translated: Upali, some are called fully ordained,

original: kha cig ni bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: kha cig ni bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa zhes bya ste /
translated: and some are called not fully ordained.

original: gang zhig gis gzhan gyi 'du shes sam /
analyzed: gang zhig gis gzhan gyi 'du shes sam /
translated: If someone kills another person without the perception of another person,

original: gzhan gyis sbyor bas ma bsad na 'di ni bsnyen par rdzogs pa zhes bya bas bsnyen par rdzogs nas kyang bsnyil bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis sbyor bas ma bsad na 'di ni bsnyen par rdzogs pa zhes bya bas bsnyen par rdzogs nas kyang bsnyil bar mi bya'o //
translated: or if another person kills him, he is called fully ordained, and he should not be expelled even though he is fully ordained.

original: gang zhig gis ched du bsams te ma bsad par gyur na 'di ni bsnyen par ma rdzogs @77b pa zhes bya bas bsnyen par rdzogs nas kyang bsnyil bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang zhig gis ched du bsams te ma bsad par gyur na 'di ni bsnyen par ma rdzogs @77b pa zhes bya bas bsnyen par rdzogs nas kyang bsnyil bar bya'o //
translated: If someone kills another person without intending to, he is called not fully ordained, and he should be expelled even though he is fully ordained.

original: ma bsad pa ji lta bar pha bsad pa dang / dgra bcom pa bsad pa yang de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: ma bsad pa ji lta bar pha bsad pa dang / dgra bcom pa bsad pa yang de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Just as with killing one’s mother, so it is with killing one’s father and killing an arhat.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na pha dang ma dud 'gro'i skye gnas su gtogs pa la dgongs nas de skad gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na pha dang ma dud 'gro'i skye gnas su gtogs pa la dgongs nas de skad gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Or, in one interpretation, the Buddha spoke with reference to parents who are animals.

original: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: In the same way, the text here🔽says,

original: btsun pa dge slong gis pha dang ma dag bkums la mthar yang mi 'gyur /
analyzed: btsun pa dge slong gis pha dang ma dag bkums la mthar yang mi 'gyur /
translated: Venerable, if a fully ordained monk kills his father and mother, he does not become one who has committed a heinous act.

original: mtshams ma mchis pa'i kha na ma tho bas reg par yang mi 'gyur ba lta mchis sam /🔽yod de / gang gi pha dang ma dud 'gro'i skye gnas su gtogs pa dag yin na'o zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: mtshams ma mchis pa'i kha na ma tho bas reg par yang mi 'gyur ba lta mchis sam / yod de / gang gi pha dang ma dud 'gro'i skye gnas su gtogs pa dag yin na'o zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Venerable, is it possible for a fully ordained monk to kill his father and mother and not commit an extreme offense?🔽Yes, if his father and mother are animals.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na skyed par byed pha ma yin pa'i pha dang ma la dgongs nas de skad gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na skyed par byed pha ma yin pa'i pha dang ma la dgongs nas de skad gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Or, it is said that the Buddha spoke with the intention that the father and mother who give birth are the father and mother.

original: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Similarly, here the text says:

original: btsun pa re zhig mas ni bskyed la gzhan gyis ni gsos pas gang zhig bkums pas mthar 'gyur zhing mtshams ma mchis pa'i kha na ma tho bas kyang reg par 'gyur ba lags /
analyzed: btsun pa re zhig mas ni bskyed la gzhan gyis ni gsos pas gang zhig bkums pas mthar 'gyur zhing mtshams ma mchis pa'i kha na ma tho bas kyang reg par 'gyur ba lags /
translated: Venerable, if a mother gives birth and another woman raises the child, who would become an extreme offender and commit an extreme offense if he killed that child?

original: gang gis bskyed pa'o zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gang gis bskyed pa'o zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The one who gave birth to him.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mdo byed pas mi ma yin pa'i 'gro ba pa gnyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mdo byed pas mi ma yin pa'i 'gro ba pa gnyis ni ma yin no //
translated: For that very reason, the author of the sutra does not mention two types of nonhuman reincarnations.

original: de gnyis las mtshams med par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de gnyis las mtshams med par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But it is not a heinous act with regard to the other two.

original: de ni skyed par byed pa gnyis las de yin no //
analyzed: de ni skyed par byed pa gnyis las de yin no //
translated: This is the case when the mother is killed by two people.

original: ma bsad pa la sogs pa de byas pa de nyid gtso bo zhes bshad do //
analyzed: ma bsad pa la sogs pa de byas pa de nyid gtso bo zhes bshad do //
translated: But if the mother is killed by the person who is born later, it is the principal mother who is killed.

original: rnam pa gcig tu nam la yod pa'i nur nur po zags pa de gzhan gyi mngal du blugs pa las skyes pa'i ma bsad pa la dgongs nas de skad gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu nam la yod pa'i nur nur po zags pa de gzhan gyi mngal du blugs pa las skyes pa'i ma bsad pa la dgongs nas de skad gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Or else, the mother is the one who is killed when the embryo falls out of the womb of the mother who is carrying it and enters the womb of another woman.

original: de bzhin du gang las khrag ni byung ba ma zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de bzhin du gang las khrag ni byung ba ma zhes bshad do //
translated: In the same way, the mother is the one from whose blood one is born.

original: yang na zag pa dang bcas pa'i las kyi srid pa dang sred pa bsad pa la dgongs nas de skad gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: yang na zag pa dang bcas pa'i las kyi srid pa dang sred pa bsad pa la dgongs nas de skad gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Or else, the mother is the one who is killed when one destroys the existence and craving of the contaminated action.

original: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni /🔽btsun pa dge slong gis pha bkums la mthar yang mi 'gyur /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni / btsun pa dge slong gis pha bkums la mthar yang mi 'gyur /
translated: In the same way, the text says here:

original: mtshams ma mchis pa'i kha na ma tho bas reg par mi 'gyur ba lta mchis lags sam /
analyzed: mtshams ma mchis pa'i kha na ma tho bas reg par mi 'gyur ba lta mchis lags sam /
translated: “Venerable! Is it possible for a bhikṣu to kill his mother and not commit a heinous offense?🔽”

original: yod de / zag pa dang bcas pa'i las kyi srid pa bsad na'o //
analyzed: yod de / zag pa dang bcas pa'i las kyi srid pa bsad na'o //
translated: “Yes, if he kills his mother who is contaminated by action and existence.”

original: nye ba 'khor zag pa dang bcas pa'i las kyi srid pa ni mngon par sgrub pa'i don gyis pha zhes bya'o //🔽btsun pa dge slong gis ma bkums la mthar yang mi 'gyur /
analyzed: nye ba 'khor zag pa dang bcas pa'i las kyi srid pa ni mngon par sgrub pa'i don gyis pha zhes bya'o // btsun pa dge slong gis ma bkums la mthar yang mi 'gyur /
translated: Upali, father means the existence of karma with outflows, in the sense of establishing.

original: mtshams ma mchis pa'i kha na ma tho bas reg par yang mi 'gyur ba lta mchis lags sam /
analyzed: mtshams ma mchis pa'i kha na ma tho bas reg par yang mi 'gyur ba lta mchis lags sam /
translated: Venerable, is it possible for a monk not to be defiled, and not to be touched by the sin of immediate retribution?

original: yod de / gal te sred pa @78a * //
analyzed: yod de / gal te sred pa @78a * //
translated: If craving is killed.

original: bsad na'o // nye ba 'khor sred pa ni skyed pa'i don gyis ma zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: bsad na'o // nye ba 'khor sred pa ni skyed pa'i don gyis ma zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Upali, mother means craving, in the sense of giving birth.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For this very reason, it is said:

original: mi ni sred pas skyed par byed //
analyzed: mi ni sred pas skyed par byed //
translated: Man is born from craving.

original: 'di yi sems ni rnam par rgyug / sems can 'khor bar gtogs pa ste //
analyzed: 'di yi sems ni rnam par rgyug / sems can 'khor bar gtogs pa ste //
translated: His mind runs around, and sentient beings are caught up in cyclic existence.

original: de yi las ni 'jigs pa che //🔽zhes gsungs so ;
analyzed: de yi las ni 'jigs pa che // zhes gsungs so ;
translated: His karma is very fearful.

original: / de nyid la dgongs nas /
analyzed: / de nyid la dgongs nas /
translated: With this very point in mind, it is said:

original: pha dang ma ni bsad byas shing //
analyzed: pha dang ma ni bsad byas shing //
translated: Having killed father and mother,🔽and having destroyed the two pure kings,

original: rgyal po gtsang sbra can gnyis dang // yul 'khor 'khor dang bcas bcom na //🔽mi de dag bar 'gyur zhes bshad //
analyzed: rgyal po gtsang sbra can gnyis dang // yul 'khor 'khor dang bcas bcom na // mi de dag bar 'gyur zhes bshad //
translated: and the kingdom with its retinue,

original: ces gsungs so //
analyzed: ces gsungs so //
translated: that man is said to be liberated.

original: de bzhin du dge slong ma sun phyung ba la sogs pa'i gzhung yang 'di yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du dge slong ma sun phyung ba la sogs pa'i gzhung yang 'di yin te /
translated: So too, the texts on the schism of a nun and so on are as follows.

translated: in Jambudvīpa, by nine or more.

original: bshad do // sngon du phas pham 'gyur byas la //
analyzed: bshad do // sngon du phas pham 'gyur byas la //
translated: One who previously committed a defeating offense

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sngon phas pham par 'gyur bar byas pa ni sngon bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i tshe phas pham par 'gyur ba byed pa'i ngang tshul can ni sngon phas pham par 'gyur ba byas pa ste sngon pham pa byung ba zhes bya ba'i tshig
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sngon phas pham par 'gyur bar byas pa ni sngon bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i tshe phas pham par 'gyur ba byed pa'i ngang tshul can ni sngon phas pham par 'gyur ba byas pa ste sngon pham pa byung ba zhes bya ba'i tshig
translated: and so on. One who previously committed a defeating offense is one who previously, at the time of full ordination, had the character to commit a defeating offense. One who previously had a defeating offense is the term for one who previously had a defeating offense.

original: go // de la phas pham par 'gyur ba ni phas pham pa ste /
analyzed: go // de la phas pham par 'gyur ba ni phas pham pa ste /
translated: The offense of a defeating offense is the offense of a defeating act.

original: dge slong gi dngos po dang de'i 'bras bu 'phags pa'i lam las ltung ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dge slong gi dngos po dang de'i 'bras bu 'phags pa'i lam las ltung ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of “falling from the state of a monk and from the result of that, the noble path” is the same.

original: phas pham pa las 'byung ba'i ltung ba ni phas pham par 'gyur ba ste de byed pas de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: phas pham pa las 'byung ba'i ltung ba ni phas pham par 'gyur ba ste de byed pas de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The offense that arises from a defeating act is the offense of a defeating act. The one who commits that is called “one who has the offense of a defeating act.”

original: dge slong rnams la bsnyen par rdzogs pa gsol ba zhes bya ba ni dge slong gi dge 'dun la bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i don du gnyer ba ste /
analyzed: dge slong rnams la bsnyen par rdzogs pa gsol ba zhes bya ba ni dge slong gi dge 'dun la bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i don du gnyer ba ste /
translated: The one who requests full ordination from the monks is the one who seeks full ordination from the saṅgha of monks.

original: dge 'dun las bsnyen par rdzogs par bya'o zhes 'byung bas bsnyen par rdzogs pa ni dge 'dun la rag las pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge 'dun las bsnyen par rdzogs par bya'o zhes 'byung bas bsnyen par rdzogs pa ni dge 'dun la rag las pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said, “One should be fully ordained by the saṅgha,” full ordination depends on the saṅgha.

original: dge slong zhes smos pa ni dge slong ma bsal ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: dge slong zhes smos pa ni dge slong ma bsal ba'i phyir te /
translated: The word “monk” is used to exclude nuns.

original: 'di ltar 'dir dge 'dun gyis bsnan par bya'o zhes 'byung bas dge slong ma rnams kyi bsnyen par rdzogs pa yang dge slong gi dge 'dun la rag las pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dir dge 'dun gyis bsnan par bya'o zhes 'byung bas dge slong ma rnams kyi bsnyen par rdzogs pa yang dge slong gi dge 'dun la rag las pa kho na yin no //
translated: Thus, since it says here that the bhikshus should augment it, the full ordination of bhikshunis depends solely on the Sangha of bhikshus.

original: rab bsgrims te zhes bya ba ni bsam pa thag pa nas te /🔽mya @80a * //
analyzed: rab bsgrims te zhes bya ba ni bsam pa thag pa nas te / mya @80a * //
translated: With full attention means with a firm intention.

original: ngan las 'das pa'i bsam pas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ngan las 'das pa'i bsam pas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: With the intention of nirvana means the meaning of with the intention of nirvana.

original: rab tu bsgrims pa smos pa ni 'jigs skyob kyi bsam pas sdom pa len pa skye ba gang yin pa de bsal ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: rab tu bsgrims pa smos pa ni 'jigs skyob kyi bsam pas sdom pa len pa skye ba gang yin pa de bsal ba'i phyir te /
translated: The phrase with full attention is stated to exclude the arising of vows with the intention of seeking protection from fear.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i bsam pa brtan po med par sdom pa skye ba med do zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i bsam pa brtan po med par sdom pa skye ba med do zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro ;
translated: Because it is said that without a firm intention of nirvana, the arising of vows does not occur.

original: / de la zhes bya ba ni sngon phas pham par 'gyur ba byas pa la'o //
analyzed: / de la zhes bya ba ni sngon phas pham par 'gyur ba byas pa la'o //
translated: In that case means in the case of one who has previously committed a defeating offense.

original: 'chags pa ni skye ba ste don gyi dbang gis na bsnyen par rdzogs par gzung ngo //
analyzed: 'chags pa ni skye ba ste don gyi dbang gis na bsnyen par rdzogs par gzung ngo //
translated: Arising means rebirth, and by the power of the meaning, it is understood that full ordination is accepted.

original: 'di la 'dri ba'i bsam pa ni sngon pham pa byung ba la bcom ldan 'das kyis bsnyen par rdzogs pa dge slong gi dngos po bkag go zhes 'byung ba 'di ni legs par shes na /
analyzed: 'di la 'dri ba'i bsam pa ni sngon pham pa byung ba la bcom ldan 'das kyis bsnyen par rdzogs pa dge slong gi dngos po bkag go zhes 'byung ba 'di ni legs par shes na /
translated: The questioner thinks, “It is well known that the Bhagavān prohibited the full ordination of those who have previously incurred a defeating offense.”

original: 'on kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam grangs 'ga' zhig gis 'di bsnyen par rdzogs par gnang ngo zhes bya ba 'di lta bu yin la /
analyzed: 'on kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam grangs 'ga' zhig gis 'di bsnyen par rdzogs par gnang ngo zhes bya ba 'di lta bu yin la /
translated: However, the Bhagavān has allowed the full ordination of some in certain circumstances.

original: kho bo'i the tshom de sol cig bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: kho bo'i the tshom de sol cig bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: Please resolve my doubt.”

original: 'di la gtan la dbab pa 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'di la gtan la dbab pa 'di yin te /
translated: The conclusion is as follows.

original: dge slong ma thun mong ma yin pa'i pham par 'gyur ba byas pa bslab pa phul nas mtshan gyur pa la dgongs nas de skad gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: dge slong ma thun mong ma yin pa'i pham par 'gyur ba byas pa bslab pa phul nas mtshan gyur pa la dgongs nas de skad gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The Bhagavān said that in consideration of a fully ordained nun who has committed a unique defeating offense who, after relinquishing her training, changes her sex.

original: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Similarly, the text here says,

original: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das kyis sngar pham pa byung ba rab tu dbyung bar mi bya zhing bsnyen par rdzogs par mi bya'o zhes bka' stsal pa gang lags pa /
analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das kyis sngar pham pa byung ba rab tu dbyung bar mi bya zhing bsnyen par rdzogs par mi bya'o zhes bka' stsal pa gang lags pa /
translated: “Bhagavān, you have said that those who have incurred a defeating offense should not be given leave to go forth and should not be fully ordained.”

original: btsun pa dge slong rnams kyis sngar pham pa byung ba zhig rab tu 'byin par bgyid cing bsnyen par rdzogs par bgyid na bsnyen par rdzogs pa zhes kyang bgyi /
analyzed: btsun pa dge slong rnams kyis sngar pham pa byung ba zhig rab tu 'byin par bgyid cing bsnyen par rdzogs par bgyid na bsnyen par rdzogs pa zhes kyang bgyi /
translated: “Venerable ones, if bhikṣus give the going forth and grant ordination to someone who has previously had a defeat, is that ordination?”

original: ltung bar yang mi 'gyur ba lta mchis lags sam /
analyzed: ltung bar yang mi 'gyur ba lta mchis lags sam /
translated: “Is there no offense?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: yod de / 'di ltar dge slong ma zhig gis thun mong ma yin pa'i phas pham par 'gyur ba'i ltung ba spyad la de bslab pa phul nas babs pa dang de mtshan gyur te phor red pa dang rab tu 'byin cing bsnyen par rdzogs par byed na ltung ba med do
analyzed: yod de / 'di ltar dge slong ma zhig gis thun mong ma yin pa'i phas pham par 'gyur ba'i ltung ba spyad la de bslab pa phul nas babs pa dang de mtshan gyur te phor red pa dang rab tu 'byin cing bsnyen par rdzogs par byed na ltung ba med do
translated: “Yes, if a bhikṣuṇī commits a downfall that is a unique defeat, and after she has relinquished her training and her female sex has disappeared, she becomes a man and is given the going forth and granted ordination, there is no offense.”

original: zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: This is what it says.

original: de bzhin du 'dir mdo byed pas kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir mdo byed pas kyang /
translated: Similarly, here the author of the sūtra says,

original: bud med bslab pa phul nas skyes pa nyid du gyur pa ni rab tu 'byung ba dang bsnyen par rdzogs par rung ba nyid do //
analyzed: bud med bslab pa phul nas skyes pa nyid du gyur pa ni rab tu 'byung ba dang bsnyen par rdzogs par rung ba nyid do //
translated: “A woman who has relinquished her training and become a man is suitable for going forth and for higher ordination.”

original: pham par 'gyur ba thun mong ma yin pa lhag par spyad pa can yang ngo zhes bshad do //
analyzed: pham par 'gyur ba thun mong ma yin pa lhag par spyad pa can yang ngo zhes bshad do //
translated: and one who has engaged in the special defeat.

original: bsam pa thag pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la bsam pa thag pa zhes bya ba ni snying thag pa nas te /
analyzed: bsam pa thag pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la bsam pa thag pa zhes bya ba ni snying thag pa nas te /
translated: With a firm resolve, etc. A firm resolve is from the depths of one’s heart.

original: mi lta ba'i @80b sems kyis yin gyi tshig tsam gyis ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mi lta ba'i @80b sems kyis yin gyi tshig tsam gyis ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means that it is with a mind that does not look back, not just with words.

original: dkon mchog gsum ni sangs rgyas dang // chos dang dge 'dun zhes bya ba rin po che dang 'dra bar rnyed dka' ba'i phyir dang / rin thang med pa'i phyir dang / phan pa dpag tu med pa mdzad pa'i phyir dkon mchog go //
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum ni sangs rgyas dang // chos dang dge 'dun zhes bya ba rin po che dang 'dra bar rnyed dka' ba'i phyir dang / rin thang med pa'i phyir dang / phan pa dpag tu med pa mdzad pa'i phyir dkon mchog go //
translated: The Three Jewels are the Buddha, Dharma, and Saṅgha. They are called jewels because they are difficult to obtain like jewels, because they are priceless, and because they perform immeasurable benefits.

original: de phyir spong bar byed pa la ste /
analyzed: de phyir spong bar byed pa la ste /
translated: Therefore, it is in relation to one who abandons them.

original: phyir spong ba ni 'dor ba yin pas bdag la 'dir mi dgos so zhes de skad spong ba'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phyir spong ba ni 'dor ba yin pas bdag la 'dir mi dgos so zhes de skad spong ba'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Abandoning means rejecting. The meaning is that one rejects by saying, “I have no need for this.”

original: med par mi 'gyur ba ni 'bral bar mi 'gyur ba ste nyams par mi 'gyur ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: med par mi 'gyur ba ni 'bral bar mi 'gyur ba ste nyams par mi 'gyur ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Not being nonexistent means not being separated, which is to say, not being lost.

original: lan ni lan gdab pa'o //
analyzed: lan ni lan gdab pa'o //
translated: Reply means response.

original: rjod cig ces bya ba ni smros shig pa'o //
analyzed: rjod cig ces bya ba ni smros shig pa'o //
translated: Say means speak.

original: 'di la pha rol po'i bsam pa ni 'ga' zhig sangs rgyas ma chos sam dge 'dun spong bar byed cing de ltar bsam pa thag pa nas dkon mchog gsum yongs su spong bar byed pa gang yin pa des the tshom med pa kho nar phyir spangs pa la
analyzed: 'di la pha rol po'i bsam pa ni 'ga' zhig sangs rgyas ma chos sam dge 'dun spong bar byed cing de ltar bsam pa thag pa nas dkon mchog gsum yongs su spong bar byed pa gang yin pa des the tshom med pa kho nar phyir spangs pa la
translated: The opponent’s idea here is that someone might reject the Buddha, Dharma, or Saṅgha, and in that way, with such a firm intention, completely reject the Three Jewels.🔽That person will definitely be reborn in the Hell of Unrelenting Pain.

original: yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni de ltar bstan pa la zhugs pa bde bar gshegs pa thams cad kyis bde blag tu go na /
analyzed: yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni de ltar bstan pa la zhugs pa bde bar gshegs pa thams cad kyis bde blag tu go na /
translated: This is how it is taught, and if one enters into this teaching, it is easily understood by all those who have gone to bliss.

original: 'on kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis de phyir spangs par ma gsungs so zhes bya ba kho bo'i sems the tshom gyi 'phyang thag la 'ju ba yun ring po nas bsdogs pa g-yo ba 'di lan legs pa zhig gis rnal du phob shig ces bya ba 'di yin no
analyzed: 'on kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis de phyir spangs par ma gsungs so zhes bya ba kho bo'i sems the tshom gyi 'phyang thag la 'ju ba yun ring po nas bsdogs pa g-yo ba 'di lan legs pa zhig gis rnal du phob shig ces bya ba 'di yin no
translated: This is what I think: “Please settle this long-standing doubt of mine with a good answer.”

original: // 'di la lan ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: // 'di la lan ni 'di yin te /
translated: The answer to this is as follows:

original: rten nam thar pa'i tshul gzhan la dgongs nas de skad du gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: rten nam thar pa'i tshul gzhan la dgongs nas de skad du gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The Bhagavān spoke in that way intending another basis or method of liberation.

original: 'di ltar gzhan du stegs can las rab tu byung ba'i dge slong ma nag mos dge slong ma dag dang lhan cig thab mo byung ba dang / sangs rgyas spong ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhan du stegs can las rab tu byung ba'i dge slong ma nag mos dge slong ma dag dang lhan cig thab mo byung ba dang / sangs rgyas spong ngo //
translated: Thus, in another place, a nun named Kāli who had gone forth from the Sāṃkhya sect had a dispute with the nuns and said, “I abandon the Buddha,

original: chos dang dge 'dun spong ngo ci sh'akya'i bu'i dge slong dag kho na tshul khrims dang ldan pa dang / yon tan dang ldan pa dang / des pa dang dge ba'i chos can yin nam /
analyzed: chos dang dge 'dun spong ngo ci sh'akya'i bu'i dge slong dag kho na tshul khrims dang ldan pa dang / yon tan dang ldan pa dang / des pa dang dge ba'i chos can yin nam /
translated: I abandon the Dharma and Saṅgha. Are only the virtuous, good-quality, gentle, and virtuous-natured monks of the Śākya son’s Saṅgha?

original: dge slong gzhan dag kyang tshul khrims dang ldan pa dang / yon tan dang ldan pa dang / des pa dang dge ba'i chos can dag yod kyis bdag gis de dag gi thad du tshangs par spyad pa spyod de zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: dge slong gzhan dag kyang tshul khrims dang ldan pa dang / yon tan dang ldan pa dang / des pa dang dge ba'i chos can dag yod kyis bdag gis de dag gi thad du tshangs par spyad pa spyod de zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: There are other monks who are endowed with morality, endowed with good qualities, who are gentle and have virtuous natures. I will practice pure conduct with them.

original: de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das kyis chos 'di ni de'i ltung ba dang po ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das kyis chos 'di ni de'i ltung ba dang po ste /
translated: At that time, the Blessed One said, This is your first downfall.🔽It is a downfall that leads to definite separation from this life.

original: nges par 'byung ba yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa bka' stsal pas de la dge 'dun gyi lhag mar 'gyur bar @81a * //
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa bka' stsal pas de la dge 'dun gyi lhag mar 'gyur bar @81a * //
translated: Thus, it is said to be a partial defeat.

original: gsungs so // de bzhin du 'grel pa byed pas kyang rten nam thar pa'i tshul gzhan yod de /
analyzed: gsungs so // de bzhin du 'grel pa byed pas kyang rten nam thar pa'i tshul gzhan yod de /
translated: Similarly, the commentator also says, There is another basis or method of liberation.

original: 'di ni rten nam thar pa'i tshul ma yin no snyam pa'i bsam pa 'dis phyir spang na ni spangs par mi 'gyur ro //🔽de lta bu cung zad yod do zhe'am /
analyzed: 'di ni rten nam thar pa'i tshul ma yin no snyam pa'i bsam pa 'dis phyir spang na ni spangs par mi 'gyur ro // de lta bu cung zad yod do zhe'am /
translated: If one abandons it with the thought, 'This is not the basis or method of liberation,' then it is not abandoned.🔽 Is there anything like that at all?

original: de lta bu cung zad kyang med do zhe'am /
analyzed: de lta bu cung zad kyang med do zhe'am /
translated: Or is there not even the slightest thing like that?

original: de lta bu yod kyang rung med kyang rung ste /🔽re zhig bdag la ni de dgos so zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: de lta bu yod kyang rung med kyang rung ste / re zhig bdag la ni de dgos so zhes bya ba'am /
translated: Whether or not such a self exists,

original: thar pa'i tshul med pa nyid do /
analyzed: thar pa'i tshul med pa nyid do /
translated: it is not necessary for liberation.🔽Whether or not such a method exists, it is not necessary for liberation.

original: tshul de yod kyang rung med kyang rung re zhig bdag la ni de mi dgos so zhes bya ba de lta bu dag tu rnam par mi rtog na ni phyir spangs pa yin no zhes bshad do ;
analyzed: tshul de yod kyang rung med kyang rung re zhig bdag la ni de mi dgos so zhes bya ba de lta bu dag tu rnam par mi rtog na ni phyir spangs pa yin no zhes bshad do ;
translated: If one does not conceive of such a self, one is liberated.

original: / yang na nyams pa'i bsam pa'i dbang du mdzad nas de skad du bshad de /
analyzed: / yang na nyams pa'i bsam pa'i dbang du mdzad nas de skad du bshad de /
translated: Or, this is stated from the perspective of the thought of degeneration.

original: de bzhin du zhu ba'i gzhung kha cig las /
analyzed: de bzhin du zhu ba'i gzhung kha cig las /
translated: Similarly, some texts of questions and answers state:

original: btsun pa dge slong la khyod su yin zhes dris pa las /
analyzed: btsun pa dge slong la khyod su yin zhes dris pa las /
translated: “Venerable monk, when asked, ‘Who are you?’

original: nga dge sbyong ma yin no zhes smras na bslab pa phul ba zhes bgyi'am /
analyzed: nga dge sbyong ma yin no zhes smras na bslab pa phul ba zhes bgyi'am /
translated: if one replies, ‘I am not an ascetic,’ is this called ‘giving up the training’?

original: nye ba 'khor ma yin no //
analyzed: nye ba 'khor ma yin no //
translated: Upali, no.

original: cir 'gyur lags /
analyzed: cir 'gyur lags /
translated: What happens?

original: shes bzhin du brdzun smras pas ltung byed du'o //
analyzed: shes bzhin du brdzun smras pas ltung byed du'o //
translated: One commits a downfall through knowingly lying.

original: de bzhin du dge tshul ma'o zhes bgyi ba dang / dge slong ma'o zhes bgyi ba dang / khyim na gnas pa'o zhes bgyi ba dang / kun du rgyu'o zhes bgyi ba dang / gzhan mu stegs can no zhes bgyi ba dang / klu'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dge tshul ma'o zhes bgyi ba dang / dge slong ma'o zhes bgyi ba dang / khyim na gnas pa'o zhes bgyi ba dang / kun du rgyu'o zhes bgyi ba dang / gzhan mu stegs can no zhes bgyi ba dang / klu'o //
translated: “I am a gandharva,” “I am a kinnara,”

original: gnod sbyin no //🔽dri za'o // mi 'am ci'o //🔽yi dags so //
analyzed: gnod sbyin no // dri za'o // mi 'am ci'o // yi dags so //
translated: “I am a hungry ghost,”

original: sha za'o // grul bum mo zhes bgyis na thams cad du bslab pa phul ba zhes bgyi'am /
analyzed: sha za'o // grul bum mo zhes bgyis na thams cad du bslab pa phul ba zhes bgyi'am /
translated: “I am a flesh-eating ghost,” or “I am a kumbhāṇḍa,” is it the case that in all these cases one has relinquished the training?

original: nye ba 'khor ma yin te /
analyzed: nye ba 'khor ma yin te /
translated: Upaśānta, it is not so.

original: 'on kyang shes bzhin du brdzun smras pas ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes bshad do //
analyzed: 'on kyang shes bzhin du brdzun smras pas ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes bshad do //
translated: However, if one lies with full awareness, one commits a minor offense.

original: de bzhin du rnam par 'byed pa las kyang nyams pa'i bsam pa kho nas spangs pa yin par gsungs pa yin te /🔽'di skad du 'di ltar dge slong dga' bar gyur kyang rung /
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par 'byed pa las kyang nyams pa'i bsam pa kho nas spangs pa yin par gsungs pa yin te / 'di skad du 'di ltar dge slong dga' bar gyur kyang rung /
translated: Similarly, the Exposition declares that one relinquishes the training only with the intention to do so:

original: mi dga' yang rung /🔽babs par 'dod kyang rung /
analyzed: mi dga' yang rung / babs par 'dod kyang rung /
translated: “In this way, whether a monk is pleased or not pleased,🔽whether he desires it or not,

original: dge slong don du mi gnyer ba yang rung /
analyzed: dge slong don du mi gnyer ba yang rung /
translated: whether he is seeking the goal or not,

original: dge sbyong gis gnong zhing ngo tsha nas smod par byed /
analyzed: dge sbyong gis gnong zhing ngo tsha nas smod par byed /
translated: The ascetic feels shame and embarrassment and criticizes himself.

original: rnam par smod par byed cing dge slong gi drung du song ste 'di skad ces /
analyzed: rnam par smod par byed cing dge slong gi drung du song ste 'di skad ces /
translated: He criticizes himself and goes to the monk and says,

original: tshe dang ldan pa dgongs shig / bdag ming 'di zhes bya ba bslab pa 'bul lo zhes smras na zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dgongs shig / bdag ming 'di zhes bya ba bslab pa 'bul lo zhes smras na zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ngo //
translated: “Venerable, please consider this. I, named so-and-so, am returning the training.”

original: nag mos phyir spangs pa bshad ma thag pa yang 'dir sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: nag mos phyir spangs pa bshad ma thag pa yang 'dir sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: The immediately preceding abandonment by a dark one should be applied here.

original: de bzhin du 'grel pa byed pas @81b kyang ;
analyzed: de bzhin du 'grel pa byed pas @81b kyang ;

analyzed: ma byin pa len pa nyid dang / ma @85a * //

analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni dge slong la'o //

analyzed: gsal bar zhes bya ba ni gsal por ro //

original: de la don ni 'di yin te /

analyzed: nye ba 'khor de na ma byin par len pa ni med de /
