original: btsun pa dge slong gis yo byad rin thang tshang ba gnas nas ma spags la mthar yang 'gyur ba lta mchis lags sam /
analyzed: btsun pa dge slong gis yo byad rin thang tshang ba gnas nas ma spags la mthar yang 'gyur ba lta mchis lags sam /
translated: Reverend, can there be defeat for a monk who moves from the place but does not move from the value?”

original: yod de / dper na gnas khang pa na 'dug pa dang bcas te brkus pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: yod de / dper na gnas khang pa na 'dug pa dang bcas te brkus pa lta bu'o //
translated: “Yes, there can. For example, if one steals a house along with the people in it, then there is defeat.”

original: gang du bzhag par 'gyur ba'i gnas nas brkus na'o zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gang du bzhag par 'gyur ba'i gnas nas brkus na'o zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: It is stolen from a place where it is to be placed.

original: de bzhin du mdo byed pas kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin du mdo byed pas kyang /
translated: Similarly, the author of the sutra also explains:

original: gnas dang bcas pa yang ma yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: gnas dang bcas pa yang ma yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: “It is not even with a basis.”

original: sdom brtson rku ba'i sems kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: sdom brtson rku ba'i sems kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: A monk who is diligent in vows, with a thought of stealing,

original: rku ba'i sems kyis zhes bya ba ni brku bar bya sems kyis so //
analyzed: rku ba'i sems kyis zhes bya ba ni brku bar bya sems kyis so //
translated: with a thought of stealing means with a thought of stealing what is not given.

original: ma byin pa zhes bya ba ni byin par ma gyur pa ste gzhan gyi rdzas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ma byin pa zhes bya ba ni byin par ma gyur pa ste gzhan gyi rdzas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: What is not given means not given to oneself, the property of another.

original: spags pa la zhes bya ba ni bskyod pa la'o //
analyzed: spags pa la zhes bya ba ni bskyod pa la'o //
translated: With respect to what is stored means with respect to what is moved.

original: rgyu zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: rgyu zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs so //
translated: Cause means reason.

original: 'di la 'dri'o bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'di la 'dri'o bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The idea of the question is this:

original: gzhan gyi nor gnas nas spags pa'i dge slong kho na phas pham par 'gyur bar rnam par bzhag na ;
analyzed: gzhan gyi nor gnas nas spags pa'i dge slong kho na phas pham par 'gyur bar rnam par bzhag na ;
translated: If a monk is established as having a defeating offense when he moves the property of another from its place,

original: 'on kyang rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis 'di la pham par ma gsungs pa de kho bo la sgyu thabs brjod par gyis shig ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'on kyang rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis 'di la pham par ma gsungs pa de kho bo la sgyu thabs brjod par gyis shig ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: Tell me a trick for that.

original: 'di la don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'di la don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning is this.

original: de ni phyogs gcig gnas nas ma 'phags pa'i rku ba la dgongs nas gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni phyogs gcig gnas nas ma 'phags pa'i rku ba la dgongs nas gsungs pa yin no //
translated: He said that, thinking of a thief who does not move from one place to another.🔽In the same way, here the text is:

original: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong gis yo byad rin thang tshang ba gnas nas gnas su sbed par byed na mthar 'gyur ro zhes bka' stsal pa gang lags pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong gis yo byad rin thang tshang ba gnas nas gnas su sbed par byed na mthar 'gyur ro zhes bka' stsal pa gang lags pa /
translated: “Venerable, the Blessed One said that if a monk hides a valuable belonging of the Saṅgha from one place to another, he incurs a pārājika.

original: dge slong gi yo byad rin thang tshang ba shin tu ring bar 'tshal kyang mthar ma 'gyur ba lta mchis lags sam /
analyzed: dge slong gi yo byad rin thang tshang ba shin tu ring bar 'tshal kyang mthar ma 'gyur ba lta mchis lags sam /
translated: Is it the case that a monk does not incur a pārājika even if he hides a valuable belonging of the Saṅgha, even if it is very far away?”🔽“

original: yod de / dge slong gi yo byad rin thang tshang ba mtha' gcig nas bzung ste shin tu thag ring por drangs kyang mtha' cig shos gnas de nas ma 'phags na nyes pa spom por 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: yod de / dge slong gi yo byad rin thang tshang ba mtha' gcig nas bzung ste shin tu thag ring por drangs kyang mtha' cig shos gnas de nas ma 'phags na nyes pa spom por 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: If a monk takes possession of a requisite of the fully ordained life that is complete in all aspects, and then carries it a great distance, but does not leave the vicinity of the original location, then he has committed a serious offense.

original: 'di la mdo byed pas kyang /
analyzed: 'di la mdo byed pas kyang /
translated: In this regard, the authors of the sutra commentaries explain:

original: phyogs gcig gnas nas ma 'phags pa yang ma yin no //🔽bshal ba la ni ngos @87a * //
analyzed: phyogs gcig gnas nas ma 'phags pa yang ma yin no // bshal ba la ni ngos @87a * //
translated: He has not left the vicinity of the original location.

original: kyi gzhi'i mtshams las ngos cig shos 'das na'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: kyi gzhi'i mtshams las ngos cig shos 'das na'o zhes bshad do //
translated: If he is washing it, then he has left the vicinity of the original location if he moves it beyond the boundary of the area where he is washing it.

original: dge slong tshul khrims ldan pa yis //
analyzed: dge slong tshul khrims ldan pa yis //
translated: If a monk who is endowed with morality

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: and so on.

original: tshul khrims ldan pa ni phas pham par 'gyur ba ma byung ba ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims ldan pa ni phas pham par 'gyur ba ma byung ba ste /
translated: Endowed with morality means that he has not incurred a defeating offense.

original: tshul khrims dang ldan pa smos pa ni tshul khrims 'chal pa la sogs pa bsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ldan pa smos pa ni tshul khrims 'chal pa la sogs pa bsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The mention of being endowed with morality is to exclude those who have violated morality and so on.

original: yan lag lnga ldan zhes bya ba ni ma byin pa nyid la sogs pa yan lag lnga dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: yan lag lnga ldan zhes bya ba ni ma byin pa nyid la sogs pa yan lag lnga dang ldan pa ste /
translated: Possessing five limbs means possessing five limbs such as the act of not giving and so on.

original: yan lag lnga dang bcas par zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yan lag lnga dang bcas par zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that it has five members.

original: ltung ba med par zhes bya ba ni ltung ba yong pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: ltung ba med par zhes bya ba ni ltung ba yong pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: “ Without a downfall” means without a transgression.

original: nyes pa med pa zhes bya ba'i don te 'di la nyes pa med pas so //
analyzed: nyes pa med pa zhes bya ba'i don te 'di la nyes pa med pas so //
translated: The meaning is that there is no fault here.

original: the tshom ni so ma nyi'o //
analyzed: the tshom ni so ma nyi'o //
translated: Doubt is uncertainty.

original: chod ces bya ba ni sol cig pa'o //
analyzed: chod ces bya ba ni sol cig pa'o //
translated: “ Remove” means “resolve.”

original: 'di la don ni gal te dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa dang bcas shing ma nyams pas gzhan gyi nor rdzas ma byin pa nyid la sogs pa yan lag lnga dang ldan par brkus na de'i tshe de la gdon mi za bar phas pham par 'gyur ba 'byung
analyzed: 'di la don ni gal te dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa dang bcas shing ma nyams pas gzhan gyi nor rdzas ma byin pa nyid la sogs pa yan lag lnga dang ldan par brkus na de'i tshe de la gdon mi za bar phas pham par 'gyur ba 'byung
translated: The meaning is this: If a fully ordained monk, without being impaired, steals another’s property with the five members, such as the thought of it as one’s own, then at that time, he would certainly incur a defeating offense.🔽However, the Blessed One did not declare any downfall for such stealing.

original: na / 'on kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis ma byin par len pa de lta bu la ltung ba 'ga' yang ma gsungs pa zhes bya ba ni bdag gi the tshom yun ring po nas sol cig ces bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: na / 'on kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis ma byin par len pa de lta bu la ltung ba 'ga' yang ma gsungs pa zhes bya ba ni bdag gi the tshom yun ring po nas sol cig ces bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: This is my doubt. Please remove it for a long time.

original: 'di la lan ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'di la lan ni 'di yin te /
translated: The answer to this is as follows.

original: de ni las dang po pa dang / smyon pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor bas nyen pa la brten nas gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni las dang po pa dang / smyon pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor bas nyen pa la brten nas gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This was stated in consideration of beginners, the insane, those whose minds are disturbed, and those afflicted by pain.

original: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Similarly, here the text

original: las dang po ba dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor bas nyen pa la ltung ba med do zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: las dang po ba dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor bas nyen pa la ltung ba med do zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: states that there is no offense for beginners, the insane, those whose minds are disturbed, and those afflicted by pain.

original: yang na de ni chos rku ba la brten nas bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: yang na de ni chos rku ba la brten nas bstan pa yin te /
translated: Or this was stated in consideration of stealing Dharma.

original: de bzhin du 'dir ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir ni /
translated: Similarly, here🔽the text states that there is no offense for those who steal Dharma.

original: btsun pa rku ba du zhig mchis lags /
analyzed: btsun pa rku ba du zhig mchis lags /
translated: Venerable, how many kinds of stealing are there?

original: nye ba 'khor drug ste /
analyzed: nye ba 'khor drug ste /
translated: Upāli, there are six:

original: bcom nas rku ba dang / nan gyis rku ba dang / phyir sbyin pa rku ba dang / bzhag pa rku ba dang / gtams pa rku ba dang / chos rku ba'o //
analyzed: bcom nas rku ba dang / nan gyis rku ba dang / phyir sbyin pa rku ba dang / bzhag pa rku ba dang / gtams pa rku ba dang / chos rku ba'o //
translated: stealing by force, stealing by stealth, stealing by fraud, stealing what is left, stealing what is entrusted, and stealing Dharma.

original: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das kyis rku ba drug gsungs pa gang dag lags pa de dag las gang gis mthar 'gyur lags /
analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das kyis rku ba drug gsungs pa gang dag lags pa de dag las gang gis mthar 'gyur lags /
translated: Venerable, from among the six kinds of stealing taught by the Blessed One, which is the worst?

original: nye ba 'khor chos rku ba ma gtogs pa lhag ma rnams kyis mthar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no //🔽mdo byed pas kyang /
analyzed: nye ba 'khor chos rku ba ma gtogs pa lhag ma rnams kyis mthar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no // mdo byed pas kyang /
translated: Upali, the others are defeated except for stealing Dharma.🔽The Sutra Expounder also explains:

original: dpe bri ba la ni nyes pa med pa nyid do zhes bshad do //
analyzed: dpe bri ba la ni nyes pa med pa nyid do zhes bshad do //
translated: There is no fault in copying the example.

original: yang na phas pham par 'gyur ba'i ltung ba med pa la dgongs nas ltung ba med par gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: yang na phas pham par 'gyur ba'i ltung ba med pa la dgongs nas ltung ba med par gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Or, it is stated that there is no offense intending that there is no offense for defeating the opponent.

original: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Similarly, here the text is:

original: btsun pa dge slong gis ma stsal @87b ba blangs pas phas pham par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: btsun pa dge slong gis ma stsal @87b ba blangs pas phas pham par 'gyur zhing /
translated: “Venerable, is there a case where a monk commits an offense entailing defeat by taking what is not given,

original: 'on kyang ma stsal bar blangs na phas pham par 'gyur ba'i ltung bar mi 'gyur ba lta mchis lags sam /
analyzed: 'on kyang ma stsal bar blangs na phas pham par 'gyur ba'i ltung bar mi 'gyur ba lta mchis lags sam /
translated: but it is not an offense entailing defeat for taking what is not given?”

original: nye ba 'khor yod de /
analyzed: nye ba 'khor yod de /
translated: “Upali, there is.

original: gang gis mi rnams kyi yo byad rin thang tshang ba ma byin par blangs pa de ni phas pham par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gis mi rnams kyi yo byad rin thang tshang ba ma byin par blangs pa de ni phas pham par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one takes the property of humans that is not given and is of full value, that is an offense entailing defeat.”

original: gang gis mi ma yin pa rnams kyi yo byad rin thang tshang ba ma byin par blangs pa de la ni phas pham pa'i ltung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gis mi ma yin pa rnams kyi yo byad rin thang tshang ba ma byin par blangs pa de la ni phas pham pa'i ltung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But if one takes the property of a nonhuman without giving its equivalent in value, then there is no offense of a defeating act.

original: 'di la mdo byed pas kyang /
analyzed: 'di la mdo byed pas kyang /
translated: In this regard, the author of the summary of the discipline states:

original: mi'i rgyud kyis yongs su bzung ba'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: mi'i rgyud kyis yongs su bzung ba'o zhes bshad do //
translated: “It is held by a human continuum.”

original: dud 'gro'i mngal na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: dud 'gro'i mngal na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: “In the womb of an animal,” and so on.

original: dud 'gro'i zhes bya ba ni dud 'gro'i skye gnas su gtogs pa phyugs la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dud 'gro'i zhes bya ba ni dud 'gro'i skye gnas su gtogs pa phyugs la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “Animal” means belonging to the animal realm, such as cattle and so on.

original: mngal na gnas pa zhes bya ba ni mngal na 'dug pa'o //
analyzed: mngal na gnas pa zhes bya ba ni mngal na 'dug pa'o //
translated: “In the womb” means in the womb.

original: bu zhes bya ba ni bu chags pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bu zhes bya ba ni bu chags pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Fetus” means the embryo and so on.

original: gsad sems kyis zhes bya ba ni gsod pa'i bsam pas so //
analyzed: gsad sems kyis zhes bya ba ni gsod pa'i bsam pas so //
translated: “With the intention to kill” means with the thought of killing.

original: gsad na zhes bya ba ni bcom na'o //
analyzed: gsad na zhes bya ba ni bcom na'o //
translated: “If one kills” means if one destroys.

original: na zhes bya ba ni don gzhan nye bar bstan pa'i phyir te des na gsad par gyur na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: na zhes bya ba ni don gzhan nye bar bstan pa'i phyir te des na gsad par gyur na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “If” indicates another meaning, so the meaning is “if one kills.”

original: thub pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pas byas pa'i brjod pa mi mnga' ba'i phyir te des so //
analyzed: thub pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pas byas pa'i brjod pa mi mnga' ba'i phyir te des so //
translated: The term sage is because he is not subject to the expressions of affliction.

original: de nyid mkhyen pa yis zhes bya ba ni blang ba dang dor bar bya ba'i de kho na nyid thabs dang bcas pa mkhyen pas de thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de nyid mkhyen pa yis zhes bya ba ni blang ba dang dor bar bya ba'i de kho na nyid thabs dang bcas pa mkhyen pas de thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: By the term knower of reality, it means that he knows the reality of what is to be adopted and what is to be rejected, along with the means. This is synonymous with the term omniscient one.

original: 'di la 'dri ba'i don ni bcom ldan 'das ni kho bo cag la dud 'gro'i 'du shes kyis srog dang bral ba'i bsam pas dud 'gro'i 'gro ba pa gsod cing srog dang yang bral na ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes bstan la /
analyzed: 'di la 'dri ba'i don ni bcom ldan 'das ni kho bo cag la dud 'gro'i 'du shes kyis srog dang bral ba'i bsam pas dud 'gro'i 'gro ba pa gsod cing srog dang yang bral na ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes bstan la /
translated: The meaning of the question here is: The Blessed One has taught that if one kills an animal with the intention of taking its life, thinking I will kill this animal, it becomes a downfall.

original: 'on kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis de la phas pham par gsungs pa de ji lta bu yin pa de kho bo la smros shig ces bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis de la phas pham par gsungs pa de ji lta bu yin pa de kho bo la smros shig ces bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: However, the Blessed One declared it to be a defeating offense for him. Tell me how that is so.

original: 'di la lan ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'di la lan ni 'di yin te /
translated: The answer to this is as follows.

original: dud 'gro'i mngal na mi'i 'gro ba pa'i bu yod pa bsad pa la dgongs nas de skad gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: dud 'gro'i mngal na mi'i 'gro ba pa'i bu yod pa bsad pa la dgongs nas de skad gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The Buddha said this intending that killing a human being in the womb of an animal is a heinous act.

original: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Similarly, the text here is:

original: btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis dud 'gro'i skye gnas su gtogs pa'i bud med kyi mngal na mchis pa'i mi bkums na cir 'gyur lags /
analyzed: btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis dud 'gro'i skye gnas su gtogs pa'i bud med kyi mngal na mchis pa'i mi bkums na cir 'gyur lags /
translated: “Lord, what if a monk kills a human being in the womb of a woman who is an animal?”

original: mthar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: mthar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: “It is a root downfall.”

original: sdom brtson zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: sdom brtson zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The text beginning with “One who is diligent in vows” explains the second root downfall.

original: gsad pa'i sems ldan gyis zhes bya ba ni srog bcad pa'i bsam pas so //
analyzed: gsad pa'i sems ldan gyis zhes bya ba ni srog bcad pa'i bsam pas so //
translated: “One who has the intention to kill” means one who has the thought to end life.

original: mi'i zhes bya ba ni mi'i 'gro bar gtogs pa'o //🔽ltung byed pa zhes bya ba ni gsod par byed pa ste mngal rlugs pa @88a * //
analyzed: mi'i zhes bya ba ni mi'i 'gro bar gtogs pa'o // ltung byed pa zhes bya ba ni gsod par byed pa ste mngal rlugs pa @88a * //
translated: “Human” means belonging to the human realm.

original: la sogs pa'i sbyor bas gsod par byed pa zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: la sogs pa'i sbyor bas gsod par byed pa zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: “A downfall” means killing.

original: gal te zhes bya ba ni ji ste'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba ni ji ste'o //
translated: “If” means “if one kills.”

original: mthu yod ces bya ba ni nus pa yod na'o //
analyzed: mthu yod ces bya ba ni nus pa yod na'o //
translated: “If one has the power” means if one has the ability.

original: 'di la bsdus pa'i don ni dge slong gis mi'i 'gro bar skyes pa'i bud med kyi mngal ltung bar byed na phas pham par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni legs par grags na /
analyzed: 'di la bsdus pa'i don ni dge slong gis mi'i 'gro bar skyes pa'i bud med kyi mngal ltung bar byed na phas pham par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni legs par grags na /
translated: The concise meaning of this is that if a monk causes an abortion in the womb of a woman born as a human, he commits a defeating offense.

original: 'on kyang la lar 'di la phas pham par ma gsungs so zhes pa 'di la gal te khyod la smra ba'i nus pa zhig yod na de kho bo la lan thob shig ces bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang la lar 'di la phas pham par ma gsungs so zhes pa 'di la gal te khyod la smra ba'i nus pa zhig yod na de kho bo la lan thob shig ces bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: If you have the ability to speak, then answer me this: Why is it not said that he commits a defeating offense in some cases?

original: 'di la lan ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'di la lan ni 'di yin te /
translated: The answer to this is as follows.

original: de ni mi'i 'gro ba pa'i bud med kyi mngal na dud 'gro'i skye gnas pa'i bu yod pa bsad pa la brten nas gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni mi'i 'gro ba pa'i bud med kyi mngal na dud 'gro'i skye gnas pa'i bu yod pa bsad pa la brten nas gsungs pa yin no //
translated: That was said in dependence on the killing of a son of an animal living in the womb of a woman born as a human.

original: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Similarly, the text here is:🔽“Lord, what if a monk were to kill a son in the womb of a human woman who belongs to the animal birth-state?

original: btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis mi'i bud med kyi mngal na dud 'gro'i skye gnas su gtogs pa'i bu mchis pa gsod par bgyid na cir 'gyur lags /
analyzed: btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis mi'i bud med kyi mngal na dud 'gro'i skye gnas su gtogs pa'i bu mchis pa gsod par bgyid na cir 'gyur lags /
translated: What is the offense?”

original: ltung byed du'o zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: ltung byed du'o zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: “It is a downfall.”

original: pha ma bsams bzhin bsad pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: pha ma bsams bzhin bsad pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: “Having killed one’s mother or father, or an Arhat” and so on.

original: mnar med pa zhes bya ba ni mnar med pa'i dmyal bar 'gro ba'i mtshams med pa byed pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: mnar med pa zhes bya ba ni mnar med pa'i dmyal bar 'gro ba'i mtshams med pa byed pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: “Avīci” means “without any interval,” that is, one who has committed a heinous act that leads to the Avīci hell.

original: 'di la bde bar snang ba'i bar skabs med pas so zhes bya ba ni bshad ma thag pa skad du'o //
analyzed: 'di la bde bar snang ba'i bar skabs med pas so zhes bya ba ni bshad ma thag pa skad du'o //
translated: “Because there is no interval of pleasure here” means as was just explained.

original: mdun du zhes bya ba ni mngon sum du'o //
analyzed: mdun du zhes bya ba ni mngon sum du'o //
translated: “In front of” means in the presence of.

original: 'di la bsdus pa'i don ni blo sngon du btang ste pha dang ma bsad na gdon mi za bar phas pham pa dang mtshams med par 'gyur na /
analyzed: 'di la bsdus pa'i don ni blo sngon du btang ste pha dang ma bsad na gdon mi za bar phas pham pa dang mtshams med par 'gyur na /
translated: The condensed meaning of this is as follows: If one kills one’s mother or father with the intention of killing them, one will certainly commit a pārājika and a heinous act.

original: 'on kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis phas pham par 'gyur ba yang ma gsungs la mtshams med par yang ma gsungs so zhes bya ba 'di la kho bo la rgyu brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis phas pham par 'gyur ba yang ma gsungs la mtshams med par yang ma gsungs so zhes bya ba 'di la kho bo la rgyu brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: However, the Blessed One did not say that one commits a pārājika or a heinous act. Here, I will state the reason for that.

original: 'di la lan ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'di la lan ni 'di yin te /
translated: The answer to this is as follows.

original: pha ma dud 'gro'i skye gnas su gtogs pa bsad pa la dgongs nas de skad gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: pha ma dud 'gro'i skye gnas su gtogs pa bsad pa la dgongs nas de skad gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The Buddha spoke with this in mind when he said that it is a heinous act to kill one's parents who are animals.

original: de bzhin du 'dir lung ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir lung ni /
translated: Similarly, the scriptures state:

original: btsun pa dge slong gis pha ma bkums la mthar yang mi 'gyur mtshams ma mchis pa'i kha na ma tho bas kyang reg par mi 'gyur ba lta mchis lags sam /
analyzed: btsun pa dge slong gis pha ma bkums la mthar yang mi 'gyur mtshams ma mchis pa'i kha na ma tho bas kyang reg par mi 'gyur ba lta mchis lags sam /
translated: Venerable! Is it possible for a fully ordained monk to kill his parents and not commit an heinous act?

original: yod de / gang gis pha ma dud 'gro'i skye gnas su gtogs pa dag yin na'o //
analyzed: yod de / gang gis pha ma dud 'gro'i skye gnas su gtogs pa dag yin na'o //
translated: Yes, if his parents are animals.

original: de bzhin du mdo byed pas kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin du mdo byed pas kyang /
translated: Similarly, the authors of the sutra commentary explain:

original: mi ma yin pa'i 'gro ba pa gnyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mi ma yin pa'i 'gro ba pa gnyis ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the two types of nonhuman reincarnating beings.

original: de gnyis las mtshams med par mi 'gyur ro zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de gnyis las mtshams med par mi 'gyur ro zhes bshad do //
translated: It is explained that they do not commit heinous acts.

original: yang na skyed @88b par byed pa ma yin pa'i pha ma dag la dgongs nas de skad du bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: yang na skyed @88b par byed pa ma yin pa'i pha ma dag la dgongs nas de skad du bshad pa yin te /
translated: Or, he explained it with this in mind: parents who are not actual producers of a child.

original: de bzhin du 'dir lung ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir lung ni /
translated: Similarly, the scriptures state:

original: btsun pa mas ma bskyed la gzhan gyis ni bskyed na gang zhig bkums pas mthar 'gyur zhing mtshams ma mchis pa'i kha na ma tho bas kyang reg par 'gyur lags /
analyzed: btsun pa mas ma bskyed la gzhan gyis ni bskyed na gang zhig bkums pas mthar 'gyur zhing mtshams ma mchis pa'i kha na ma tho bas kyang reg par 'gyur lags /
translated: If a monk does not kill his mother, but kills another woman, he would not commit the heinous act of killing his mother, nor would he incur the sin of killing an arhat.

original: skyed par byed pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: skyed par byed pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The answer is: “The one who is the mother is the one who gives birth.”

original: de bzhin du mdo byed pas kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin du mdo byed pas kyang /
translated: The Sutra master also says:

original: de ni skyed par byed pa gnyis las te zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de ni skyed par byed pa gnyis las te zhes bshad do //
translated: “It is from two causes that one is born.”

original: yang na zag pa dang bcas pa'i las kyis srid pa dang sred pa la dgongs nas de skad gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: yang na zag pa dang bcas pa'i las kyis srid pa dang sred pa la dgongs nas de skad gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Or, the Buddha spoke with the intention of contaminated karma and craving for existence.

original: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni /🔽btsun pa dge slong gis pha bkums la mthar yang mi 'gyur /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni / btsun pa dge slong gis pha bkums la mthar yang mi 'gyur /
translated: In the same way, the text here says:

original: mtshams ma mchis pa'i kha na ma tho bas reg par yang mi 'gyur ba lta mchis lags sam /
analyzed: mtshams ma mchis pa'i kha na ma tho bas reg par yang mi 'gyur ba lta mchis lags sam /
translated: “Venerable, is it possible for a monk to kill his mother and not commit a heinous act, and not incur the sin of killing an arhat?”

original: yod de / zag pa dang bcas pa'i las kyis srid pa bsad na'o //
analyzed: yod de / zag pa dang bcas pa'i las kyis srid pa bsad na'o //
translated: “Yes, if he kills his mother with contaminated karma and craving for existence.”

original: nye ba 'khor zag pa dang bcas pa'i las kyis srid pa ni mngon par bsgrub pa'i don gyis pha zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nye ba 'khor zag pa dang bcas pa'i las kyis srid pa ni mngon par bsgrub pa'i don gyis pha zhes bya'o //
translated: Upali, father means the one who establishes existence through contaminated action.

original: btsun pa dge slong gis ma bkums la mthar yang mi 'gyur mtshams ma mchis pa'i kha na ma tho bas reg par yang mi 'gyur ba lta mchis lags sam /
analyzed: btsun pa dge slong gis ma bkums la mthar yang mi 'gyur mtshams ma mchis pa'i kha na ma tho bas reg par yang mi 'gyur ba lta mchis lags sam /
translated: Venerable, is there a case where a monk does not commit a root downfall even though he has sexual intercourse with a woman who is not a hermaphrodite and who is not a neuters?

original: yod de / gal te sred pa bsad na'o //
analyzed: yod de / gal te sred pa bsad na'o //
translated: There is, if he kills craving.

original: nye ba 'khor sred pa ni skyed pa'i don gyis ma zhes bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: nye ba 'khor sred pa ni skyed pa'i don gyis ma zhes bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: Upali, mother means the one who gives birth.

original: don 'di ni bshad mod kyi phas pham par 'gyur ba'i skabs kyis yang bshad do //🔽brda phrad mdun du zhes bya ba la sogs pa la brda sprad mdun zhes bya ba ni don go ba'i mngon sum du ste /
analyzed: don 'di ni bshad mod kyi phas pham par 'gyur ba'i skabs kyis yang bshad do // brda phrad mdun du zhes bya ba la sogs pa la brda sprad mdun zhes bya ba ni don go ba'i mngon sum du ste /
translated: This meaning has already been explained, but it is explained again in the context of the defeats.

original: brda phrad pa zhes smos pa ni //
analyzed: brda phrad pa zhes smos pa ni //
translated: In the line in the presence of one who understands the signs, one who understands the signs means one who understands the meaning.

original: brdzun tshig 'du shes gzhan bsgyur bas //
analyzed: brdzun tshig 'du shes gzhan bsgyur bas //
translated: The line lying speech is the transformation of another's perception

original: tshig don mngon par go ba'o //
analyzed: tshig don mngon par go ba'o //
translated: means that the meaning of the words is understood.

original: zhes 'byung ba'i brda mi phrad pa'i drung du ni na smad par bshad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes 'byung ba'i brda mi phrad pa'i drung du ni na smad par bshad pa'i phyir /
translated: and because it is explained that one should not speak in the presence of those who do not understand the meaning of the words.

original: sangs rgyas zhes bya ba ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i don lag mthil du skyu ru ra bzhag pa bzhin gsal bar mkhyen pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas zhes bya ba ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i don lag mthil du skyu ru ra bzhag pa bzhin gsal bar mkhyen pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Buddha means that he clearly knows the meaning of the past, future and present, like a myrobalan fruit in the palm of the hand.

original: dgra bcom pa ni nyon mongs pa'i dgra bcom pa'i phyir dang / 'gro ba mtha' dag gis mchod par 'os pa'i phyir dang / mi skye ba'i chos can gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa ni nyon mongs pa'i dgra bcom pa'i phyir dang / 'gro ba mtha' dag gis mchod par 'os pa'i phyir dang / mi skye ba'i chos can gyi phyir ro //
translated: Arhat means he has conquered the enemy of the afflictions, he is worthy of offerings from all beings, and he is one who has attained the Dharma of non-arising.

original: ston pa ni phan pa dang mi phan pa nye bar ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ston pa ni phan pa dang mi phan pa nye bar ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Teacher means he teaches what is beneficial and what is not beneficial.

original: don du gnyer gyis zhes bya ba ni bcol gyis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: don du gnyer gyis zhes bya ba ni bcol gyis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because of his request means because of his request.

original: des na tshig gi don ni gang gi tshe dge slong gis brda phrad pa'i mdun du nga ni sangs rgyas so //🔽nga ni dgra bcom pa'o //
analyzed: des na tshig gi don ni gang gi tshe dge slong gis brda phrad pa'i mdun du nga ni sangs rgyas so // nga ni dgra bcom pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the words is this: When a monk says in the presence of those who understand the meaning of the words, I am a Buddha,🔽I am an Arhat,

original: nga ni ston pa'o @89a * //
analyzed: nga ni ston pa'o @89a * //
translated: I am a Teacher,

original: zhes smras pa de'i tshe de la gdon mi za bar phas pham par 'gyur na /
analyzed: zhes smras pa de'i tshe de la gdon mi za bar phas pham par 'gyur na /
translated: At that time, if he were to say, “I have attained nirvana,” then he would certainly commit an offense entailing defeat.

original: 'on kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam grangs 'ga' zhig gis des phas pham par 'gyur ba ma yin par gsungs pa de ji lta bu yin pa de kho bo la ji lta ba bzhin du smros shig ces bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam grangs 'ga' zhig gis des phas pham par 'gyur ba ma yin par gsungs pa de ji lta bu yin pa de kho bo la ji lta ba bzhin du smros shig ces bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: However, the Blessed One has said that in some cases, one does not commit an offense entailing defeat.

original: 'di la lan ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'di la lan ni 'di yin te /
translated: The reply to this is as follows:

original: ming mthun pa'i don la brten nas de skad du gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ming mthun pa'i don la brten nas de skad du gsungs pa yin no //
translated: He said this on the basis of a meaning that is similar in name.

original: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: In the same way, the text here states:

original: btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis 'di skad du sangs rgyas yin no zhes smras na cir 'gyur lags /
analyzed: btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis 'di skad du sangs rgyas yin no zhes smras na cir 'gyur lags /
translated: “Reverend, what if a monk were to say, ‘I am a buddha’?”

original: gal te sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams rtogs pa nyid dang / rtogs par byed pa nyid la bsams nas lung ston na ni nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams rtogs pa nyid dang / rtogs par byed pa nyid la bsams nas lung ston na ni nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
translated: If he were to declare this with the thought that he has realized and will realize unwholesome and unskillful qualities, then he would commit an offense entailing suspension.

original: 'on te sangs rgyas kyi chos med pa lung ston par byed na ni mthar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te sangs rgyas kyi chos med pa lung ston par byed na ni mthar 'gyur ro //
translated: But if he were to declare that he has no qualities of a buddha, then he would commit an offense entailing defeat.

original: btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis 'di skad du nga ni ston pa'o zhes smras na cir 'gyur lags /
analyzed: btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis 'di skad du nga ni ston pa'o zhes smras na cir 'gyur lags /
translated: “Reverend, if a monk says, ‘I am the Teacher,’ what is his offense?”

original: gal te 'di snyam du bdag ni 'doms par byed pa'o ;
analyzed: gal te 'di snyam du bdag ni 'doms par byed pa'o ;
translated: “If he says this thinking, ‘I am the one who instructs,’

original: / rjes su ston par byed pa'o zhes bya bar bsams te smras na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: / rjes su ston par byed pa'o zhes bya bar bsams te smras na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
translated: or ‘I am the one who teaches,’ then he commits an offense entailing suspension.

original: 'on te ston pa'i chos lung ston par byed na ni mthar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te ston pa'i chos lung ston par byed na ni mthar 'gyur ro //
translated: But if he is reciting the Dharma of the Teacher, then there is no offense.”

original: btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis 'di skad du nga ni mi slob pa'o zhes smras na cir 'gyur lags /
analyzed: btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis 'di skad du nga ni mi slob pa'o zhes smras na cir 'gyur lags /
translated: “Reverend, if a monk says, ‘I am not a learner,’ what is his offense?”

original: gal te nyon mongs pa spangs par lung ston na mthar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te nyon mongs pa spangs par lung ston na mthar 'gyur ro //
translated: “If he says this thinking, ‘I have abandoned the defilements,’ then he commits an offense entailing suspension.

original: 'on te 'di snyam du bdag ni bzo 'ga' la yang mi slob bo zhes bya bar bsams te smras na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'on te 'di snyam du bdag ni bzo 'ga' la yang mi slob bo zhes bya bar bsams te smras na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: But if he says this thinking, ‘I am not learning any crafts,’ then he commits a serious violation.”

original: de bzhin du mdo byed pas kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin du mdo byed pas kyang /
translated: The author of the Kṣudraka Collection says:

original: bla ma brjod pa'i 'dun pas ming mthun pa'i don brjod na sbom po'i zhes bshad do //
analyzed: bla ma brjod pa'i 'dun pas ming mthun pa'i don brjod na sbom po'i zhes bshad do //
translated: “If, with the intention of expressing respect, one uses the name of a superior, and the meaning is understood, then there is a serious violation.”

original: yang na / de ni las dang po pa dang smyon pa dang sems 'khrugs pa dang tshor bas nyen pa la dgongs nas gsungs pa'am /
analyzed: yang na / de ni las dang po pa dang smyon pa dang sems 'khrugs pa dang tshor bas nyen pa la dgongs nas gsungs pa'am /
translated: Or, it was stated intending that it is a beginner, a madman, one whose mind is disturbed, or one afflicted by feeling.

original: mi ma yin pa'i 'gro ba'i mngon sum du smras pa la dgongs nas gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: mi ma yin pa'i 'gro ba'i mngon sum du smras pa la dgongs nas gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Or, it was stated intending that it is a direct statement to a nonhuman reincarnating being.

original: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Similarly, here the treatise states:

original: btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis mi ma lags pa'i 'du shes kyis mi'i chos bla ma lung ston par bgyid na cir 'gyur lags /
analyzed: btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis mi ma lags pa'i 'du shes kyis mi'i chos bla ma lung ston par bgyid na cir 'gyur lags /
translated: “If a monk describes a superhuman quality to a nonhuman, what is the offense?”

original: nyes pa sbom por ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: nyes pa sbom por ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: “It is a serious offense.”

original: yang na smyon pa dang sems 'khrugs pa'i mngon sum du smras pa la brten pa yin te /
analyzed: yang na smyon pa dang sems 'khrugs pa'i mngon sum du smras pa la brten pa yin te /
translated: Or, it is based on a direct statement to a madman or one whose mind is disturbed.

original: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Similarly, here the treatise states:

original: btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis smyon pa'i drung du mi'i chos bla ma brjod na cir 'gyur lags /
analyzed: btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis smyon pa'i drung du mi'i chos bla ma brjod na cir 'gyur lags /
translated: “If a monk describes a superhuman quality to a madman, what is the offense?”

original: nyes pa sbom por ro //
analyzed: nyes pa sbom por ro //
translated: “It is a serious offense.”

original: @89b sems 'khrugs pa la sogs pa la yang de bzhin du blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: @89b sems 'khrugs pa la sogs pa la yang de bzhin du blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The same should be understood for those with disturbed minds and so on.

original: yang na de ni dbus pa la mtha' 'khob pa'i tshig tu smras pa la brten nas gsungs pa yin par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: yang na de ni dbus pa la mtha' 'khob pa'i tshig tu smras pa la brten nas gsungs pa yin par shes par bya ste /
translated: Or else, it should be understood that this was stated in dependence on the speech of borderland people to those of the central region.

original: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni /🔽btsun pa re zhig dge slong dbus pa zhig gis mtha' 'khob pa'i skad du smra ba la mi'i chos bla ma brjod la /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni / btsun pa re zhig dge slong dbus pa zhig gis mtha' 'khob pa'i skad du smra ba la mi'i chos bla ma brjod la /
translated: In that way, the text here is:

original: dbus pas kyang mtha' 'khob pa'i skad ma 'tshal na cir 'gyur lags /
analyzed: dbus pas kyang mtha' 'khob pa'i skad ma 'tshal na cir 'gyur lags /
translated: “Lord, if a central region monk were to speak to a borderland monk in the language of the borderlands, and the central region monk did not understand the language of the borderlands, what would occur?”

original: nyes pa sbom por ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: nyes pa sbom por ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: “A serious offense would occur.”

original: 'di la mdo'i khungs kyang go rims bzhin du ma bcas pa nyid la yang ngo //
analyzed: 'di la mdo'i khungs kyang go rims bzhin du ma bcas pa nyid la yang ngo //
translated: Here, the source of the sūtra is, respectively, “even if there is no rule” and “even if there is a rule.”

original: tha snyad du rung ba'i 'du shes nyams pa la ni pham par 'gyur ba man chad kyi ltung ba yang mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: tha snyad du rung ba'i 'du shes nyams pa la ni pham par 'gyur ba man chad kyi ltung ba yang mi 'byung ngo //
translated: If the perception of what is conventional is impaired, then even the downfalls of the class of offenses entailing defeat do not occur.

original: mi'i 'gro ba la ni tha snyad du bya ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: mi'i 'gro ba la ni tha snyad du bya ba nyid yin no //
translated: In the human realm, it is conventional to engage in such conduct.

original: rang bzhin nyams pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin nyams pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not a degeneration of the nature.

original: rnam par rig byed la ni don go ba'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: rnam par rig byed la ni don go ba'o zhes bshad do //
translated: It is said that the non-revealing form of the defeat of lying is the understanding of the meaning.

original: yang na sngon pham pa byung ba la sogs pa la dgongs nas gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: yang na sngon pham pa byung ba la sogs pa la dgongs nas gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Or, it is said with the intention of those who have previously experienced defeat, and so on.

original: de bzhin du gzhung ni sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhung ni sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: The text is as explained above.

original: yang na mngon pa'i nga rgyal la brten pa yin te /
analyzed: yang na mngon pa'i nga rgyal la brten pa yin te /
translated: Or, it is based on manifest pride.

original: 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: The text here is:

original: btsun pa dge slong gis bdag nyid la mi'i chos bla ma mchis shing bdog bzhin du brjod na phas pham par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: btsun pa dge slong gis bdag nyid la mi'i chos bla ma mchis shing bdog bzhin du brjod na phas pham par 'gyur zhing /
translated: “Venerable! If a monk says that he has the higher knowledge of a human while he does not have it, he commits a defeating offense.

original: 'on kyang bdag nyid la mi'i chos bla ma mchis shing mi bdog bzhin du brjod na phas pham par 'gyur ba'i ltung bar mi 'gyur ba lta mchis lags sam /
analyzed: 'on kyang bdag nyid la mi'i chos bla ma mchis shing mi bdog bzhin du brjod na phas pham par 'gyur ba'i ltung bar mi 'gyur ba lta mchis lags sam /
translated: But is it the case that if he says that he has the higher knowledge of a human while he does not have it, he does not commit a defeating offense?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: ” The Bhagavān said:

original: yod de / g-yos shes pa lung ston na phas pham par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yod de / g-yos shes pa lung ston na phas pham par 'gyur ro //
translated: “Yes, if he says that he knows the higher knowledge of a human, he commits a defeating offense.

original: mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyis kun shes pa lung ston na de la phas pham par 'gyur ba'i ltung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyis kun shes pa lung ston na de la phas pham par 'gyur ba'i ltung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: If one claims to be omniscient out of manifest pride, then there is no offense entailing expulsion.

original: khyod 'bras thob ces de skad dris zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: khyod 'bras thob ces de skad dris zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The passage beginning with “If one is asked, ‘Have you attained the result?’”

original: khyod ces bya ba ni khyod kyis so //
analyzed: khyod ces bya ba ni khyod kyis so //
translated: “You” means “by you.”

original: 'bras bu ni rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa 'phags pa'i lam gyi 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu ni rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa 'phags pa'i lam gyi 'bras bu ste /
translated: “Result” refers to the result of the ārya path, such as stream entry.

original: dge slong tshul ni dri med lam //
analyzed: dge slong tshul ni dri med lam //
translated: The path of the monk is stainless.

original: 'bras bu 'dus byas 'dus ma byas //🔽zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu 'dus byas 'dus ma byas // zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The result is conditioned and unconditioned.

original: de skad ces bya ba ni smras ma thag pa'i skad du'o //
analyzed: de skad ces bya ba ni smras ma thag pa'i skad du'o //
translated: “Thus” refers to the words just spoken.

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni de ltar yin no zhes bya ba ste khas len pa'i don to //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni de ltar yin no zhes bya ba ste khas len pa'i don to //

original: smras na zhes bya ba ni brjod na'o //
analyzed: smras na zhes bya ba ni brjod na'o //

original: don bzhin zhes bya ba ni don gyi rjes su 'brangs nas te don ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: don bzhin zhes bya ba ni don gyi rjes su 'brangs nas te don ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

original: 'di la don 'dir la la zhig la @90a * //
analyzed: 'di la don 'dir la la zhig la @90a * //
translated: In this regard, someone asks another,

analyzed: 'ga' zhig gis khyod kyis 'bras bu thob bam zhes dris la /

original: des kyang 'di skad du de bzhin no zhes khas blangs na /
analyzed: des kyang 'di skad du de bzhin no zhes khas blangs na /
translated: And the other replies, “Yes, I have.”

original: 'on kyang de la phas pham par ma gsungs so zhes bya ba de kho bo la nges par gsal bar smos shig ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang de la phas pham par ma gsungs so zhes bya ba de kho bo la nges par gsal bar smos shig ces bya ba yin no //
translated: But the Buddha did not declare that to be a defeat.

original: 'di la lan ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'di la lan ni 'di yin te /

original: de yang ming mthun pa'i don brjod pa'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa yin par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de yang ming mthun pa'i don brjod pa'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa yin par blta bar bya ste /

analyzed: lung las 'byung ba gzhan nyid la brten nas yang bkod do //
translated: It is also stated in the scriptures in dependence on another meaning.

original: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Similarly, here the text🔽says,

original: btsun pa dge slong la khyim bdag cig gis khyod kyis 'bras bu thob bam zhes dris pa dang / des kyang lo ma dang 'bras bu dang me tog dang / 'bras bu ma smin pa dag cig blangs nas des 'di skad du de bzhin no zhes smras na cir 'gyur lags /
analyzed: btsun pa dge slong la khyim bdag cig gis khyod kyis 'bras bu thob bam zhes dris pa dang / des kyang lo ma dang 'bras bu dang me tog dang / 'bras bu ma smin pa dag cig blangs nas des 'di skad du de bzhin no zhes smras na cir 'gyur lags /
translated: A householder asked a monk, “Have you attained the fruit?” He took some leaves, fruit, flowers, and unripe fruit and said, “It’s like this.” What is the offense?

analyzed: nyes pa sbom por ro zhes bya ba yin no //

analyzed: yang na de ni las dang po pa la sogs pa la dgongs nas gsungs pa yin no //

original: brda phrad pa'i mi'i mdun du zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: brda phrad pa'i mi'i mdun du zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In the presence of a person who understands, and so on.

original: brda phrad pa'i zhes bya ba'i rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: brda phrad pa'i zhes bya ba'i rtogs pa'o //

original: mi'i zhes bya ba ni skyes pa ste mi'i 'gro ba pa'i zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mi'i zhes bya ba ni skyes pa ste mi'i 'gro ba pa'i zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

original: skyes pa smos pa ni nye bar mtshon par zad de bud med kyi yul la yang de dang 'dra bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: skyes pa smos pa ni nye bar mtshon par zad de bud med kyi yul la yang de dang 'dra bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: The mention of a male is merely an illustration, so it should be understood that the same applies to a female.

original: mdun du zhes bya ba'i don ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: mdun du zhes bya ba'i don ni bshad zin to //
translated: The meaning of in the presence of has been explained.

original: 'bras bu rnam pa bzhi ni 'bras bu bzhi po rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / lan cig phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi 'bras bu rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu rnam pa bzhi ni 'bras bu bzhi po rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / lan cig phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi 'bras bu rnam pa bzhi'o //

analyzed: de nyid gzigs pas zhes bya ba ni don dam pa gzigs pa ste /
translated: The phrase “one who sees reality” refers to one who sees the ultimate.

analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

original: ma yin zhes bya ba ni dgag pa'i'o //
analyzed: ma yin zhes bya ba ni dgag pa'i'o //
translated: The phrase “it is not” is a negation.

original: 'di la 'dri ba'i don ni gang gi tshe rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu bzhi mi'i 'gro bar gtogs pa brda phrad pa'i mdun du ltung ston pa de'i tshe de la gdon mi za bar phas pham pa'i ltung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de
analyzed: 'di la 'dri ba'i don ni gang gi tshe rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu bzhi mi'i 'gro bar gtogs pa brda phrad pa'i mdun du ltung ston pa de'i tshe de la gdon mi za bar phas pham pa'i ltung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de
translated: The point of this question is that when the four results of stream enterer and so on are obtained by a human being who belongs to the class of beings who understand language, then at that time, without a doubt, there is a downfall that is a defeating offense.

original: tsam ni shin tu nges la /
analyzed: tsam ni shin tu nges la /
translated: This much is quite certain.

original: 'on kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam grangs 'ga' zhig gis de la phas pham par 'gyur bar ma gsungs so zhes bya ba'i rgyu de bdag la smros shig ces bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam grangs 'ga' zhig gis de la phas pham par 'gyur bar ma gsungs so zhes bya ba'i rgyu de bdag la smros shig ces bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: But the Bhagavat has not declared that this is a defeating offense in some cases.

original: 'di la yang ming mthun pa'i don brjod pa la brten nas gsungs pa yin par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di la yang ming mthun pa'i don brjod pa la brten nas gsungs pa yin par shes par bya ste /
translated: You should understand that this is said in reference to the meaning of the similar name.

original: skabs bzhin du gsungs pa'i gzhung las bsams nas @90b yang bkod pa yin no //
analyzed: skabs bzhin du gsungs pa'i gzhung las bsams nas @90b yang bkod pa yin no //
translated: It is also set forth in consideration of the text that is spoken in accordance with the context.

original: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: In the same way, here the text is:

original: btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis 'di skad du bdag gis rim gror ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'o //🔽bya skyibs ngogs su ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis 'di skad du bdag gis rim gror ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'o // bya skyibs ngogs su ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: “Lord, if a bhikṣu says, ‘I attained the result of stream enterer through service,🔽the result of once-returner on the slope of Vulture Peak,

original: bya rgod kyi phung po la ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: bya rgod kyi phung po la ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: the result of non-returner at the Heap of Vultures,

original: 'od ma'i tshal du ni 'bras bu mchog dgra bcom pa'o zhes smra na cir 'gyur lags /
analyzed: 'od ma'i tshal du ni 'bras bu mchog dgra bcom pa'o zhes smra na cir 'gyur lags /
translated: and the supreme result of arhatship in Bamboo Grove,’ what is the offense?”

original: gal te 'di snyam du bdag gir 'dir lung mnos kha ton byas te bdag gis le lo ma byas so zhes bya ba las bsams nas smras na ni nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te 'di snyam du bdag gir 'dir lung mnos kha ton byas te bdag gis le lo ma byas so zhes bya ba las bsams nas smras na ni nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
translated: If one says this thinking, “I received the prophecy here, I recited it, I did not do it lazily,” then there is a serious offense.

original: 'on te dge sbyong gi tshul gyi 'bras bu dag lung ston na ni /
analyzed: 'on te dge sbyong gi tshul gyi 'bras bu dag lung ston na ni /
translated: But if one prophesies the fruits of the ascetic’s way of life,

original: mthar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: mthar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: then there is a downfall.

original: dge slong 'bras gcig smra byas las //
analyzed: dge slong 'bras gcig smra byas las //
translated: If a monk says he has one fruit,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /🔽'bras gcig ces bya ba ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa'i nang nas brjod par 'dod pa'i 'bras bu gang yang rung ba zhig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la / 'bras gcig ces bya ba ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa'i nang nas brjod par 'dod pa'i 'bras bu gang yang rung ba zhig go //
translated: and so on.🔽One fruit means any fruit that is desired to be expressed among the fruits of stream entry and so on.

original: 'bras bu gzhan zhes bya ba ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu las lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la sogs pa gzhan de brjod par mi 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu gzhan zhes bya ba ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu las lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la sogs pa gzhan de brjod par mi 'dod pa'o //
translated: Another fruit means the other fruits of once-returner and so on, which are not desired to be expressed from the fruit of stream entry.

original: 'di la don ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa smra bar 'dod pa'i dge slong gis gal te 'bras bu gzhan lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am /
analyzed: 'di la don ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa smra bar 'dod pa'i dge slong gis gal te 'bras bu gzhan lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am /
translated: Here, the meaning is that if a monk who wishes to declare the fruit of stream entry declares another fruit,

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am /
translated: the fruit of once-returner,🔽the fruit of non-returner, or the state of an arhat, why is it not said that he commits a defeating offense?

original: dgra bcom pa nyid cig lung ston na ci'i phyir de la phas pham par 'gyur bar ma gsungs zhes bya bar bsnyad par bya ba la khyod kyis kho bo la 'brel ba brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid cig lung ston na ci'i phyir de la phas pham par 'gyur bar ma gsungs zhes bya bar bsnyad par bya ba la khyod kyis kho bo la 'brel ba brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: You must explain the connection to me.

original: 'di la lan ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'di la lan ni 'di yin te /
translated: The answer is this:

original: de ni mngon par 'dod pa ma yin pa'i 'bras bu brjod pa la brten nas gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni mngon par 'dod pa ma yin pa'i 'bras bu brjod pa la brten nas gsungs pa yin no //
translated: That is stated in dependence on declaring a fruit that is not actually desired.

original: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Similarly, here the text states:

original: btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu lung bstan to snyam pa las lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu lung bstan tam /
analyzed: btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu lung bstan to snyam pa las lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu lung bstan tam /
translated: “Venerable, if a monk declares the fruit of stream entry, thinking ‘I will declare the fruit of stream entry,’ but declares the fruit of once-returner,

analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu lung bstan to snyam pa las phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu lung bstan tam /
translated: If one thinks, “I will prophesy the result of once-returner,” but prophesy the result of non-returner,

analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu lung bstan to snyam pa las dgra bcom pa nyid kyi 'bras bu lung bstan na cir 'gyur lags /
translated: or if one thinks, “I will prophesy the result of non-returner,” but prophesy the result of arhatship, what happens?

original: nyes pa sbom por ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: nyes pa sbom por ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: It is said, “There is a serious fault.”

original: de bzhin du 'di la mdo byed pas kyang nor na yang ngo zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'di la mdo byed pas kyang nor na yang ngo zhes bshad do //
translated: In this way, the author of the sutra also explains that there is a fault if one errs.

original: 'dul ba dri ba'i tshig le'ur byas pa le'u dang po'i gtan la dbab pa'o /
analyzed: 'dul ba dri ba'i tshig le'ur byas pa le'u dang po'i gtan la dbab pa'o /
translated: This concludes the first chapter on the Vinaya questions in the Vinaya Verses.

original: // / @91a * //  yan lag bcu ldan 'byin byed pa //
analyzed: // / @91a * //  yan lag bcu ldan 'byin byed pa //
translated: The one with ten branches, the expeller,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: and so on.

original: 'byin byed pa zhes bya ba ni khu chu 'byin par byed pa ste /
analyzed: 'byin byed pa zhes bya ba ni khu chu 'byin par byed pa ste /
translated: Here, “expeller” means the expeller of semen.

analyzed: dang po'i gnas nas spos pa'i zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means “moved from the first place.”

original: gyi nar yang 'byung ba yod pa de'i phyir yan lag bcu ldan zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: gyi nar yang 'byung ba yod pa de'i phyir yan lag bcu ldan zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Since it is also possible to have emission without the ten branches, “with ten branches” is stated.

original: gang la yang yan lag bcu yod pa de ni yan lag bcu ldan pa ste /
analyzed: gang la yang yan lag bcu yod pa de ni yan lag bcu ldan pa ste /
translated: That which has ten limbs is one possessing ten limbs.

original: rgyu bcu dang ldan par khu chu 'byin pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rgyu bcu dang ldan par khu chu 'byin pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means that which has ten causes and emits semen.

original: yan lag bcu po de dag ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yan lag bcu po de dag ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Those ten limbs are as follows:

original: phyung ba dang / dbyung bar 'dun pa dang / rang gi khu chu dang / dang po'i gnas dang / pho mtshan dang / de la brtsal ba dang / de la reg pa dang / de gzhan gyi rgyud du gtogs pas kyang rung ba dang /
analyzed: phyung ba dang / dbyung bar 'dun pa dang / rang gi khu chu dang / dang po'i gnas dang / pho mtshan dang / de la brtsal ba dang / de la reg pa dang / de gzhan gyi rgyud du gtogs pas kyang rung ba dang /
translated: emission, the intention to emit, one's own semen, the initial stage, the male organ, seeking that, touching that, the suitability of that belonging to another's continuum,

original: sems can du bgrang ba nyid dang / sems can du bgrang ba'i rnam par gnas pa nyid do //
analyzed: sems can du bgrang ba nyid dang / sems can du bgrang ba'i rnam par gnas pa nyid do //
translated: the state of being counted as a sentient being and the state of abiding in the aspect of being counted as a sentient being.

original: dge 'dun lhag ma byed pa ni gang la ltung ba phyir bcos pa'i phyir lhag ma nyi shu la sogs pa'i dge 'dun yod pa de ni lhag ma ste /
analyzed: dge 'dun lhag ma byed pa ni gang la ltung ba phyir bcos pa'i phyir lhag ma nyi shu la sogs pa'i dge 'dun yod pa de ni lhag ma ste /
translated: The saṅgha is the remainder because the remainder of downfalls is restored by the saṅgha.

original: ltung ba de ni dge 'dun la rag lus pa /
analyzed: ltung ba de ni dge 'dun la rag lus pa /
translated: That downfall depends on the saṅgha.

original: dge 'dun kha na las pa dge 'dun la brten pas te /
analyzed: dge 'dun kha na las pa dge 'dun la brten pas te /
translated: It is a downfall of the saṅgha because it is based on the saṅgha.

original: dge 'dun gyi ltung ba las ldang bar 'gyur gyi gang zag las ni ma yin no zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi ltung ba las ldang bar 'gyur gyi gang zag las ni ma yin no zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is said, “One is absolved of the offense against the community, not of the offense against an individual.”

original: de byed pa'i ngang tshul can ni dge 'dun lhag ma byed pa ste /
analyzed: de byed pa'i ngang tshul can ni dge 'dun lhag ma byed pa ste /
translated: One who is disposed to commit that offense is one who commits a serious offense against the community.

original: dge 'dun lhag ma'i ltung ba byung ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dge 'dun lhag ma'i ltung ba byung ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase “one who has committed a serious offense against the community” means one who has incurred a serious offense against the community.

original: bde bar gshegs pa ni nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad bag chags dang bcas te bral ba dang / dngos po ma lus pa'i de kho na nyid legs par rtogs pa'o //🔽gzhan dag na re phyir mi ldog bar ma lus par gshegs pa'am /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa ni nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad bag chags dang bcas te bral ba dang / dngos po ma lus pa'i de kho na nyid legs par rtogs pa'o // gzhan dag na re phyir mi ldog bar ma lus par gshegs pa'am /
translated: The Well-Gone One is so called because he has gone well to the end of all the afflictions and secondary afflictions along with their traces, and because he has well understood the reality of all things.🔽Others say that he is the Well-Gone One because he has gone to the end of the stage of nonregression,

original: de kho na nyid bstan pa'i khyad par ma lus par mkhyen pa'i phyir bkra shis pa yin no zhes zer te /
analyzed: de kho na nyid bstan pa'i khyad par ma lus par mkhyen pa'i phyir bkra shis pa yin no zhes zer te /
translated: or because he has gone to the end of the knowledge of the special teaching of reality.

original: don du na de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
analyzed: don du na de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
translated: In fact, he is the Tathāgata.

original: ma gsungs pa zhes bya ba ni bka' ma stsal pa'o //
analyzed: ma gsungs pa zhes bya ba ni bka' ma stsal pa'o //
translated: The phrase “has not been taught” means has not been proclaimed.

original: ji ltar zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gang gis so //
analyzed: ji ltar zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gang gis so //
translated: The phrase “in what way” means by what mode.

original: rgyu zhes bya ba ni byed rgyu'o //
analyzed: rgyu zhes bya ba ni byed rgyu'o //
translated: The cause is the active cause.

original: 'di la gzhan gyis bsam pa ni gang gi tshe dge slong gis phyung ba la sogs pa yan lag bcu dang ldan par rang gi khu chu 'byin pa de'i tshe de la dge 'dun gyi lhag ma'i ltung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yang go the tshom yang
analyzed: 'di la gzhan gyis bsam pa ni gang gi tshe dge slong gis phyung ba la sogs pa yan lag bcu dang ldan par rang gi khu chu 'byin pa de'i tshe de la dge 'dun gyi lhag ma'i ltung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yang go the tshom yang
translated: The opponent thinks this: “When a monk emits his own semen with the ten members such as emission and so on, then at that time, he would incur the offense of a saṃghabheda offense.

original: med na / 'on kyang de la dge 'dun gyi lhag ma'i ltung bar ma gsungs so zhes bya ba 'di la khyod kyis kho bo la rgyu cung zad cig gdon mi za bar @91b brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: med na / 'on kyang de la dge 'dun gyi lhag ma'i ltung bar ma gsungs so zhes bya ba 'di la khyod kyis kho bo la rgyu cung zad cig gdon mi za bar @91b brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: But even though this is so, you must definitely tell me the reason why it is said that he does not incur a saṃghabheda offense.”

original: 'di la lan ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'di la lan ni 'di yin te /
translated: The reply to this is as follows.

original: de ni shugs btang ba la dgongs nas gsungs pa yin par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de ni shugs btang ba la dgongs nas gsungs pa yin par shes par bya ste /
translated: It should be understood that this was stated with regard to the emission of semen through the force of desire.

original: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: The text is as follows:

original: shugs btang nas khu chu byung na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: shugs btang nas khu chu byung na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: If semen is emitted through the force of desire, then there is a grave offense.

original: de bzhin du mdo byed pas kyang shugs kyi gnas skabs su btang ba rdzogs par ma byas pa nyid do zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de bzhin du mdo byed pas kyang shugs kyi gnas skabs su btang ba rdzogs par ma byas pa nyid do zhes bshad do //
translated: The case of the monk who had a dream is not completed because it is a case of indirect action.

original: yang na mtshan gyur pa la brten nas de skad gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: yang na mtshan gyur pa la brten nas de skad gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Or it was said in that way based on a change in gender.

original: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Similarly, the text here is:
