analyzed: yod de / mtshan gyur na'o //
translated: “Yes, if his gender changes.”

original: btsun pa dge slong ma thun mong ma lags pa'i ltung ba'i ris lnga byung ba 'chags par yang mi bgyid /
analyzed: btsun pa dge slong ma thun mong ma lags pa'i ltung ba'i ris lnga byung ba 'chags par yang mi bgyid /
translated: Venerable, if a nun does not confess a downfall belonging to one of the five classes of downfalls that are unique to a nun,

original: phyir 'chos par yang mi bgyid la /
analyzed: phyir 'chos par yang mi bgyid la /
translated: and does not make amends for it,

original: langs pa zhes kyang bgyi ltung ba ma mchis par yang 'gyur ba lta mchis lags sam /
analyzed: langs pa zhes kyang bgyi ltung ba ma mchis par yang 'gyur ba lta mchis lags sam /
translated: is it the case that she is said to have risen from the downfall, and is she said to be without a downfall?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: yod de / mtshan gyur na'o //
analyzed: yod de / mtshan gyur na'o //
translated: “Yes, if her gender changes.”

original: de bzhin du mdo byed pas kyang zhing ma yin pa nyid la ni nyams so zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de bzhin du mdo byed pas kyang zhing ma yin pa nyid la ni nyams so zhes bshad do //
translated: In the same way, the author of the sūtra-commentary explains that “if the field is not a suitable one, the downfall is not a downfall.”

original: yang na las dang po pa la sogs pa la brten nas de skad gsungs pa yin te snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: yang na las dang po pa la sogs pa la brten nas de skad gsungs pa yin te snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Or else, it is said in this way based on a beginner and so on, as before.

original: gang zag gcig la spo ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gang zag gcig la spo ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In regard to the statement, “transference to one person and so on,”

original: gang zag ni sems can te dge slong zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gang zag ni sems can te dge slong zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: person refers to a sentient being, which is to say a fully ordained monk.

original: gcig la zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun gyi lhag ma byung ba la'o //
analyzed: gcig la zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun gyi lhag ma byung ba la'o //
translated: One refers to the occurrence of a partial defeat of the Saṅgha.

original: spo ba ni dge 'dun gyi lhag ma byung ba bcabs pa'i nyes pa gzhom pa'i phyir ji ltar bcas @93b pa bzhin chad pa'i las spyad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spo ba ni dge 'dun gyi lhag ma byung ba bcabs pa'i nyes pa gzhom pa'i phyir ji ltar bcas @93b pa bzhin chad pa'i las spyad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Transference is the performance of a penalty action in accordance with the rule in order to overcome the fault of concealing the occurrence of a partial defeat of the Saṅgha.

original: spyad pa nyid ni spo ba spyad pa ste bcabs pa bzhin chad pa'i las spyad la da dung mgu bar bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyad pa nyid ni spo ba spyad pa ste bcabs pa bzhin chad pa'i las spyad la da dung mgu bar bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The performance of transference is the performance of transference, because the penalty action is performed in accordance with the rule of concealment, but it is not yet pleasing.

original: mgu bar bya ba ni spo ba spyad pa la dge slong rnams kyis sems mgu bar bya ba'i phyir na zhag drug tu mgu bar bya ba sbyin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mgu bar bya ba ni spo ba spyad pa la dge slong rnams kyis sems mgu bar bya ba'i phyir na zhag drug tu mgu bar bya ba sbyin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Pleasing is the giving of a six-day pleasing period in order to please the minds of the monks in regard to the performance of transference, because it is not yet pleasing.

original: spyad pa nyid ni mgu bar bya ba spyad pa ste mgu bar bya ba spyad zin pas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: spyad pa nyid ni mgu bar bya ba spyad pa ste mgu bar bya ba spyad zin pas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The one who is to be transferred is the one who has already engaged in the practice of pleasing.

original: de la mgu ba ni yid la 'thad cing yid 'bab ste sems rangs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de la mgu ba ni yid la 'thad cing yid 'bab ste sems rangs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Pleasing is being agreeable, pleasing, and satisfying the mind.

original: bzhi po dag srid pa zhes bya bar sbyar te bzhi po spo ba dang / spo ba spyad pa dang / mgu bar bya dang / mgu bar bya ba spyad pa'i mtshan nyid kyi tshig bzhi po dag go //
analyzed: bzhi po dag srid pa zhes bya bar sbyar te bzhi po spo ba dang / spo ba spyad pa dang / mgu bar bya dang / mgu bar bya ba spyad pa'i mtshan nyid kyi tshig bzhi po dag go //
translated: The four are applied to the term “existence.” The four terms are the characteristics of the one who is to be transferred, the one who is to engage in the practice of being transferred, the one who is to please, and the one who is to engage in the practice of pleasing.

original: gang gis zhes bya ba ni rgyu gang gis so //
analyzed: gang gis zhes bya ba ni rgyu gang gis so //
translated: By what means is it done?

original: sred pa ni btub pa'o //
analyzed: sred pa ni btub pa'o //
translated: It is done by means of craving.

original: 'di la gzhan gyis bsams pa ni dge 'dun gyi lhag ma'i ltung ba byung ba'i gang zag gcig kho na spo ba pa'am /
analyzed: 'di la gzhan gyis bsams pa ni dge 'dun gyi lhag ma'i ltung ba byung ba'i gang zag gcig kho na spo ba pa'am /
translated: Here, another thinks: “The person who has committed a partial defeat of the Saṅgha is the only one who is to be transferred,

original: spo ba spyad pa'am /
analyzed: spo ba spyad pa'am /
translated: the one who is to engage in the practice of being transferred,🔽the one who is to please, and the one who is to engage in the practice of pleasing.”

original: mgu bar bya ba spyad pa zhig tu 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de tsam zhig ni tshig rnams tha dad par gyur pa'i phyir shin tu mngon na 'on kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis ltung ba byung ba gcig kho na la bzhi srid par gsungs pa de ji lta🔽bu yin pa smros shig ces bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: mgu bar bya ba spyad pa zhig tu 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de tsam zhig ni tshig rnams tha dad par gyur pa'i phyir shin tu mngon na 'on kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis ltung ba byung ba gcig kho na la bzhi srid par gsungs pa de ji lta bu yin pa smros shig ces bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: This is the question: The Bhagavān said that one who commits a downfall has four possibilities.🔽What are they?

original: 'di la lan ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'di la lan ni 'di yin te /
translated: The answer is:

original: de ni srid pa'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni srid pa'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa yin no //
translated: He said that from the perspective of possibility.

original: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Similarly, here the text says:

original: btsun pa gang zag de nyid spo ba yang lags /
analyzed: btsun pa gang zag de nyid spo ba yang lags /
translated: “Venerable, is it the case that one who is to be expelled is also one who has engaged in the act of being expelled,

original: de nyid spo ba spyad pa yang lags /🔽de nyid mgu ba pa yang lags /
analyzed: de nyid spo ba spyad pa yang lags / de nyid mgu ba pa yang lags /
translated: one who is to be satisfied is also one who has engaged in the act of satisfying,🔽and one who is to be expelled is also one who is to be satisfied?”🔽“Yes, it is. It is the case that one who is to be expelled is also one who has engaged in the act of being expelled,🔽one who is to be satisfied is also one who has engaged in the act of satisfying,

original: de nyid mgu bar bgyi ba spyad pa yang lags pa lta mchis lags sam /
analyzed: de nyid mgu bar bgyi ba spyad pa yang lags pa lta mchis lags sam /
translated: and one who is to be expelled is also one who is to be satisfied.

original: yod de gang zag spo ba bya ba spyad pa zhig tu dge 'dun gyi lhag ma'i ltung ba 'chab pa med pa byung la /
analyzed: yod de gang zag spo ba bya ba spyad pa zhig tu dge 'dun gyi lhag ma'i ltung ba 'chab pa med pa byung la /
translated: For example, it is possible that a monk who is to be expelled commits a saṃgha dispute offense and conceals it.

original: de dge 'dun gyi drung du song nas mgu bar bya ba gsol te /
analyzed: de dge 'dun gyi drung du song nas mgu bar bya ba gsol te /
translated: He went to the Saṅgha and requested probation.🔽He mostly practiced probation, but one Saṅgha-disparaging offense he concealed for one day, and two he concealed for two days.🔽When he went to the Saṅgha and requested penance, the Saṅgha gave him penance.

original: de mgu bar bya ba phal cher spyad nas dge 'dun gyi lhag ma'i ltung ba gcig zhag gcig bcabs pa dang / gnyis pa zhag gnyis bcabs pa dang gnyis shig byung ba dang / de dag dge 'dun gyi drung du song ste spo ba gsol ba las de la dge 'dun gyis spo ba byin na de ltung ba gcig gi ni spo ba spyad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de mgu bar bya ba phal cher spyad nas dge 'dun gyi lhag ma'i ltung ba gcig zhag gcig bcabs pa dang / gnyis pa zhag gnyis bcabs pa dang gnyis shig byung ba dang / de dag dge 'dun gyi drung du song ste spo ba gsol ba las de la dge 'dun gyis spo ba byin na de ltung ba gcig gi ni spo ba spyad pa ma yin no //
translated: In that case, he did not practice penance for one offense,

original: gnyis pa'i ni spo ba spyad pa yin no //
analyzed: gnyis pa'i ni spo ba spyad pa yin no //
translated: but he did practice penance for two.

original: gsum pa'i ni mgu bar bya ba spyad pa yin no //
analyzed: gsum pa'i ni mgu bar bya ba spyad pa yin no //
translated: For the third he practiced probation,

original: bzhi pa'i ni mgu bar bya ba spyad pa yin no //
analyzed: bzhi pa'i ni mgu bar bya ba spyad pa yin no //
translated: and for the fourth he practiced probation.

original: ji srid 'tsho bar zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /🔽ji srid @94a * //
analyzed: ji srid 'tsho bar zhes bya ba la sogs pa la / ji srid @94a * //
translated: As long as one lives, etc.

original: 'tsho'i bar ni ji srid 'tsho ba mthar thug pa'i bar ro //
analyzed: 'tsho'i bar ni ji srid 'tsho ba mthar thug pa'i bar ro //
translated: As long as one lives means until the end of one’s life.

original: rang gi gos ni bdag nyid kyi gos dag gi'o //
analyzed: rang gi gos ni bdag nyid kyi gos dag gi'o //
translated: One’s own robes means one’s own robes.

original: rab tu mang po ni bcu la sogs pa dpag tu med pa dag go //🔽ma bsngos shing zhes bya ba ni mkhan po la sogs pa'i ming gis sngags sngon du 'gro ba'i bdag gir ma byas shing ngo //
analyzed: rab tu mang po ni bcu la sogs pa dpag tu med pa dag go // ma bsngos shing zhes bya ba ni mkhan po la sogs pa'i ming gis sngags sngon du 'gro ba'i bdag gir ma byas shing ngo //
translated: Many means many, such as ten, and so on, up to immeasurable.🔽Not assigned means not made one’s own with a mantra preceded by the name of the preceptor and so on.

original: byin gyis ma brlabs par zhes bya ba ni sngon du 'gro ba kho na'i bdag gir ma byas par ro //
analyzed: byin gyis ma brlabs par zhes bya ba ni sngon du 'gro ba kho na'i bdag gir ma byas par ro //
translated: Not consecrated means not made one’s own with a mantra alone, without the preliminary.

original: yang zhes bya ba ni 'on kyang ngo //
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba ni 'on kyang ngo //
translated: Also means but.

original: dri ma med par zhes bya ba ni spangs pa'i ltung ba'i dri ma dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: dri ma med par zhes bya ba ni spangs pa'i ltung ba'i dri ma dang bral ba'o //
translated: Stainless means free from the stain of downfalls that are abandoned.

original: 'di la 'dri ba'i don ni gang gi tshe byin gyis ma brlabs shing ma bsngos pa'i gos gcig kyang zhag bcu 'das par 'chang na de'i tshod la bcom ldan 'das kyis zhag bcu pa'i spang bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs na 'on kyang yang 'di la ltung ba med
analyzed: 'di la 'dri ba'i don ni gang gi tshe byin gyis ma brlabs shing ma bsngos pa'i gos gcig kyang zhag bcu 'das par 'chang na de'i tshod la bcom ldan 'das kyis zhag bcu pa'i spang bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs na 'on kyang yang 'di la ltung ba med
translated: The point of the question is this: When one keeps a robe for more than ten days that is not consecrated and not assigned, the Blessed One has said that it becomes an offense entailing relinquishment. But is there no offense in this case?

original: pa kho nar gsungs so zhes bya ba 'di la kho bo la rgyu brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: pa kho nar gsungs so zhes bya ba 'di la kho bo la rgyu brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: This is what I will say.

original: 'di la lan ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'di la lan ni 'di yin te /
translated: The answer to this is as follows:

original: rim gyis byin gyis rlob pa la dgongs nas de skad gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: rim gyis byin gyis rlob pa la dgongs nas de skad gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The Buddha spoke with the intention of gradual consecration.

original: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Similarly, here is the text:

original: btsun pa dge slong gis gos byin gyis ma brlabs shing ma bsngos pa brgyad dam dgu ji srid 'tsho'i bar du bcangs la ltung bar yang mi 'gyur ba lta mchis lags sam /
analyzed: btsun pa dge slong gis gos byin gyis ma brlabs shing ma bsngos pa brgyad dam dgu ji srid 'tsho'i bar du bcangs la ltung bar yang mi 'gyur ba lta mchis lags sam /
translated: “Lord, is it the case that a fully ordained monk may keep eight or nine unblessed and unrenounced robes for as long as he lives without it being a downfall?”

original: nye ba 'khor yod de /
analyzed: nye ba 'khor yod de /
translated: “Upāli, it is.”

original: 'di ltar dge slong gis nyin re nyin re zhing chos gos kyi sngags byung la gzhan byin gyis brlabs na'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar dge slong gis nyin re nyin re zhing chos gos kyi sngags byung la gzhan byin gyis brlabs na'o //
translated: “In this way, if a fully ordained monk recites the mantra of the robe every day and blesses the others.”

original: yang de zhag bcu tshun chad cig tu shi ba la dgongs nas gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: yang de zhag bcu tshun chad cig tu shi ba la dgongs nas gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Again, he spoke with the intention of ten days.

original: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Similarly, here is the text:

original: btsun pa dge slong gis gos lhag pa bcangs la ltung bar yang mi 'gyur ba lta mchis lags sam /
analyzed: btsun pa dge slong gis gos lhag pa bcangs la ltung bar yang mi 'gyur ba lta mchis lags sam /
translated: “Lord, is it the case that a fully ordained monk may keep an extra robe without it being a downfall?”

original: nye ba 'khor yod de /
analyzed: nye ba 'khor yod de /
translated: Upali, there is.

original: zhag bcu tshun chad cig tu shi bar gyur na'o //
analyzed: zhag bcu tshun chad cig tu shi bar gyur na'o //
translated: If one dies within ten days.

original: yang na rung ba ma yin pa'i gos 'chang ba la dgongs nas de skad du gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: yang na rung ba ma yin pa'i gos 'chang ba la dgongs nas de skad du gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Or it is stated with the intention of improper cloth.

original: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Similarly, here the text is:

original: btsun pa dge slong gis gos lhag pa zhag bcu las 'das par bcangs la spang ba'i ltung bar yang mi 'gyur ba lta mchis lags sam /
analyzed: btsun pa dge slong gis gos lhag pa zhag bcu las 'das par bcangs la spang ba'i ltung bar yang mi 'gyur ba lta mchis lags sam /
translated: “Venerable, is there a case where a monk keeps extra cloth for more than ten days and it is not a downfall of relinquishment?”

original: nye ba 'khor yod de /
analyzed: nye ba 'khor yod de /
translated: Upali, there is.

original: 'di ltar gos kyi spun rung la rgyu rung ba ma yin pa dang / rgyu rung la spun rung ba ma yin pa dang / gnyis @94b ka rung ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar gos kyi spun rung la rgyu rung ba ma yin pa dang / rgyu rung la spun rung ba ma yin pa dang / gnyis @94b ka rung ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is like this: the cloth is suitable but the material is not suitable, the material is suitable but the cloth is not suitable, or both are not suitable.

original: rung ba ma yin pa ni rnga bal dang / rang gi spu dang / ri dags kyi bal dang bsres pa dang / ma btags pa ste /
analyzed: rung ba ma yin pa ni rnga bal dang / rang gi spu dang / ri dags kyi bal dang bsres pa dang / ma btags pa ste /
translated: The unsuitable is a mixture of silk, one’s own hair, and animal fur, or it is not woven.

original: gos de lta bu zhag bcu las 'das par 'chang na nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gos de lta bu zhag bcu las 'das par 'chang na nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: If one keeps such cloth for more than ten days, it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: de bzhin du mdo byed pas kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin du mdo byed pas kyang /
translated: Similarly, the author of the sutra also says:

original: rab tu byung ba'i rdzas dag la ni rung ba nyid dang zhes bshad do //
analyzed: rab tu byung ba'i rdzas dag la ni rung ba nyid dang zhes bshad do //
translated: But they are suitable for those who have gone forth.

original: 'og ma dag la yang lugs ni 'di yin no //
analyzed: 'og ma dag la yang lugs ni 'di yin no //
translated: This is the rule for the lower vows.

original: yang na gzhan gyi ched du 'chang ba'i dbang du mdzad nas de skad du gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: yang na gzhan gyi ched du 'chang ba'i dbang du mdzad nas de skad du gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Or it is stated from the perspective of keeping them for the sake of others.

original: de bzhin du lhung zed 'chang ba'i skabs nas rab tu 'byung bar 'dod ba'i ched du 'chang na ltung ba med do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du lhung zed 'chang ba'i skabs nas rab tu 'byung bar 'dod ba'i ched du 'chang na ltung ba med do zhes gsungs so //
translated: Similarly, the chapter on keeping a begging bowl states: “There is no offense if you keep it for the sake of going forth.”

original: lhung bzed la de skad du gsungs mod kyi 'on kyang gos la yang rung ngo zhes bya bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: lhung bzed la de skad du gsungs mod kyi 'on kyang gos la yang rung ngo zhes bya bar shes par bya'o //
translated: Although this is stated in the context of a begging bowl, it should be understood that it is also suitable for robes.

original: de bzhin mdo byed pas 'dir spyir rab tu byung ba'i don du nges par byas pa yang de nyid do zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de bzhin mdo byed pas 'dir spyir rab tu byung ba'i don du nges par byas pa yang de nyid do zhes bshad do //
translated: The author of the commentary explains that this is also the case here in the Compendium of Determinations, where it is stated in general that “it is for the sake of going forth.”

original: 'grel pa byed pas kyang 'di la ni lhung bzed la rab tu byung bar 'dod pa'i ched du 'chang na ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa de'i bshad pa yin no zhes rjes su bzlas so //
analyzed: 'grel pa byed pas kyang 'di la ni lhung bzed la rab tu byung bar 'dod pa'i ched du 'chang na ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa de'i bshad pa yin no zhes rjes su bzlas so //
translated: This is the explanation of that.

original: yang na las dang po pa la sogs pa'am sngon pham pa byung ba la sogs pa la brten nas de skad du gsungs pa yin no zhes bya bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: yang na las dang po pa la sogs pa'am sngon pham pa byung ba la sogs pa la brten nas de skad du gsungs pa yin no zhes bya bar shes par bya'o //
translated: Or it should be understood that this was stated in dependence on a beginner and so on or in dependence on one who has previously incurred a defeating offense and so on.

original: dri ba dang lan 'di ni lhung bzed du gtogs pa la yang rung bas ma bshad kyang thams cad bdag nyid kyis brtag par bya'o //🔽tha dad mtshams ni spangs pa'i gnas //
analyzed: dri ba dang lan 'di ni lhung bzed du gtogs pa la yang rung bas ma bshad kyang thams cad bdag nyid kyis brtag par bya'o // tha dad mtshams ni spangs pa'i gnas //
translated: Since this question and answer also applies to what is contained in a begging bowl, it should be understood by all through their own efforts, even though it is not explained.🔽The boundary of a single residence

original: gcig na gnas pa'i dge slong la //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gcig na gnas pa'i dge slong la // zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: is the boundary of a single monastery.🔽The boundary of a single residence

original: gnas gcig na zhes bya ba ni gnas khang la sogs pa 'dug gnas gcig pa ste /
analyzed: gnas gcig na zhes bya ba ni gnas khang la sogs pa 'dug gnas gcig pa ste /
translated: is the boundary of a single dwelling.

original: gnas gcig smos pas ni 'dug gnas gnyis dang / gsum dang / bzhi la sogs pa bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: gnas gcig smos pas ni 'dug gnas gnyis dang / gsum dang / bzhi la sogs pa bkag pa yin no //
translated: By mentioning one place, two, three, four, and so on, places of residence are prohibited.

original: gnas pa zhes bya ba ni 'dug pa'o //
analyzed: gnas pa zhes bya ba ni 'dug pa'o //
translated: The term dwelling means staying.

original: gcig yin yang bkad pa la sogs pa gnas chen po la nang na chu la sogs pas mtshams tha dad pa nyid kyang srid na de ci la rnam par bzhag pa nyid yin nam zhe na /🔽tha dad mtshams ni spangs pa yin //
analyzed: gcig yin yang bkad pa la sogs pa gnas chen po la nang na chu la sogs pas mtshams tha dad pa nyid kyang srid na de ci la rnam par bzhag pa nyid yin nam zhe na / tha dad mtshams ni spangs pa yin //
translated: Even if it is one place, it is possible that in a large place, such as a monastery, there are different boundaries due to water, etc. So how is it determined?

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said, Except for the boundary.🔽It means free from the boundary.

original: chu la sogs pas mtshams tha dad pa dang bral ba'i yin te mtshams gcig pa'i zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: chu la sogs pas mtshams tha dad pa dang bral ba'i yin te mtshams gcig pa'i zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means having one boundary.

original: 'bral ba'i dri mas zhes bya ba ni 'bral ba'i spang ba'i ltung bas so //
analyzed: 'bral ba'i dri mas zhes bya ba ni 'bral ba'i spang ba'i ltung bas so //
translated: It is said, with the stain of separation,

original: dri ma dang 'dra @95a * //🔽bas dri ma ste /🔽ltung ba'i dri ma zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dri ma dang 'dra @95a * // bas dri ma ste / ltung ba'i dri ma zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is like a stain,🔽it means the stain of a downfall.

original: dri ma dang bcas pa'i zhes bya ba ni nyes pa dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: dri ma dang bcas pa'i zhes bya ba ni nyes pa dang bcas pa ste /
translated: It is said, with a stain,

original: ltung ba'i dri mas nye bar gos zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽'di la 'dri ba'i don ni rang 'khrungs dang bcos mas mtshams bcad pa med pa'i gnas chen po yang rung /🔽chung ngu yang rung /
analyzed: ltung ba'i dri mas nye bar gos zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // 'di la 'dri ba'i don ni rang 'khrungs dang bcos mas mtshams bcad pa med pa'i gnas chen po yang rung / chung ngu yang rung /
translated: The meaning of the term “defiled by the stain of a downfall” is the same.

original: gcig na gnas pa'i dge slong la gdon mi za bar 'bral ba'i spang ba'i ltung byed 'byung mi srid do zhes bya ba 'di ni mngon na /
analyzed: gcig na gnas pa'i dge slong la gdon mi za bar 'bral ba'i spang ba'i ltung byed 'byung mi srid do zhes bya ba 'di ni mngon na /
translated: The point of the question is this: “If it is impossible for a monk who lives in a large or small monastery that is not divided by a natural or man-made boundary to commit the offense of separation,

original: 'on kyang ci rnam grangs 'ga' zhig gis gnas de lta bu la gnas pa la 'bral ba'i spang ba'i ltung ba 'byung bar 'gyur ram zhes bya ba ni kho bo la brjod par bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang ci rnam grangs 'ga' zhig gis gnas de lta bu la gnas pa la 'bral ba'i spang ba'i ltung ba 'byung bar 'gyur ram zhes bya ba ni kho bo la brjod par bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: then why is it said that there are some circumstances in which a monk who lives in such a monastery may commit the offense of separation?”

original: 'di la lan ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'di la lan ni 'di yin te /
translated: The answer is this:

original: mu stegs can gyi gnas kyi dbang du mdzad nas de skad du gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: mu stegs can gyi gnas kyi dbang du mdzad nas de skad du gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The Buddha spoke in this way with reference to the dwelling places of non-Buddhists.

original: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: The text here is as follows:

original: btsun pa dge slong dgab pa gcig pa'i gnas gcig na mchis shing de nyid du de'i chos gos de dang 'bral bar 'gyur ba lta mchis lags sam /
analyzed: btsun pa dge slong dgab pa gcig pa'i gnas gcig na mchis shing de nyid du de'i chos gos de dang 'bral bar 'gyur ba lta mchis lags sam /
translated: Venerable, is it possible for a fully ordained monk to be in one place and his Dharma robes to be separated from him in that very place?

original: nye ba 'khor yod de /
analyzed: nye ba 'khor yod de /
translated: Upāli, it is possible.

original: 'di ltar gnas te mu stegs can gyi dge sbyong dang / rgyu ba pa dang / kun du rgyu sna tshogs pa'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar gnas te mu stegs can gyi dge sbyong dang / rgyu ba pa dang / kun du rgyu sna tshogs pa'am /
translated: It is like this: if a monk is staying in a place where there are tīrthika ascetics, wanderers, or various types of mendicants,

original: spun ni nor bgos pa rnams kyi yin na'o zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: spun ni nor bgos pa rnams kyi yin na'o zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: or if the brothers have divided the wealth.

original: mdo byed pas kyang 'dir /
analyzed: mdo byed pas kyang 'dir /
translated: The author of the sūtra also explains here:

original: nor las dang lta ba las tha dad pa ma yin pa'i yang ngo zhes bshad do //
analyzed: nor las dang lta ba las tha dad pa ma yin pa'i yang ngo zhes bshad do //
translated: It is also not separate from wealth and view.

original: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung gzhan ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung gzhan ni /
translated: Similarly, here in another text,

original: dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang mu stegs can rnams dang nyer spyod kyis gcig pa na gnas pa rnams las gang zhig sgo gang la gnas pa la ni ltung ba med do zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang mu stegs can rnams dang nyer spyod kyis gcig pa na gnas pa rnams las gang zhig sgo gang la gnas pa la ni ltung ba med do zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: If the Saṅgha's temple is used in common with the tīrthikas, there is no offense for those who stay at which door they are staying at.

original: de'i phyir 'dis ni tha dad pa nyid yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dis ni tha dad pa nyid yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is explained that this is a separate case.

original: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung gzhan ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung gzhan ni /
translated: So too, here, another text states:

original: btsun pa dge slong mtshams kyi nang mchis la chos gos kyang mtshams kyi nang na bzhag na chos gos de dang 'bral bar 'gyur ba lta mchis lags sam /🔽nye ba 'khor yod de /
analyzed: btsun pa dge slong mtshams kyi nang mchis la chos gos kyang mtshams kyi nang na bzhag na chos gos de dang 'bral bar 'gyur ba lta mchis lags sam / nye ba 'khor yod de /
translated: “Venerable! If a monk enters the boundary and also places his robe inside the boundary, can he be separated from his robe?”

original: mtshams bcad pa byas la chos gos dang mi 'bral ba'i sdom pa ma byas na'o zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: mtshams bcad pa byas la chos gos dang mi 'bral ba'i sdom pa ma byas na'o zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: “Upāli! Yes, if he enters the boundary but does not take the vow not to be separated from his robe.”

original: de bzhin du mdo byed pas kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin du mdo byed pas kyang /
translated: So too, the author of the Abhisaṃchayikā says:

original: der gnang ba byas na ni chos gos ngag dang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bshad do //
analyzed: der gnang ba byas na ni chos gos ngag dang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bshad do //
translated: “If he takes permission, he will not be separated from his robe.”

original: yang na gnas gcig gam mtshams gcig na gnas pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bur 'dri ba rnam pa @95b gnyis bya la lan yang bshad ma thag pa de lta bu'i gzhung rnam pa gnyis brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: yang na gnas gcig gam mtshams gcig na gnas pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bur 'dri ba rnam pa @95b gnyis bya la lan yang bshad ma thag pa de lta bu'i gzhung rnam pa gnyis brjod par bya'o //
translated: Or, as in the case of the question, “Is it the case that one who dwells in one place or one boundary . . . ?” there are two types of questions and two types of answers, as just explained.

original: yang na las dang po pa la sogs pa'am sngon ltung ba byung ba la sogs pa la dgongs nas de skad du gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: yang na las dang po pa la sogs pa'am sngon ltung ba byung ba la sogs pa la dgongs nas de skad du gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Or it is stated with the thought of beginners and so on, or those who have previously incurred a downfall and so on.

original: snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin no //
translated: It is as before.🔽The sutra states that there is no offense for a fully ordained

original: zla ba pa'i gos dge slong gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ci'i phyir ltung ba med par gsungs zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: zla ba pa'i gos dge slong gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ci'i phyir ltung ba med par gsungs zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: monk to wear moon cloth and so on.

original: zla ba'i gos ni zla ba 'das pa'i gos so //
analyzed: zla ba'i gos ni zla ba 'das pa'i gos so //
translated: Moon cloth is cloth that has passed the month.

original: ma spangs pa zhes pa ni ma btang ba'o //
analyzed: ma spangs pa zhes pa ni ma btang ba'o //
translated: Not discarded means not relinquished.

original: ltung ba med pa ni kha na ma thob med pa'o zhes gsungs zhes bya ba ni de skad du gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: ltung ba med pa ni kha na ma thob med pa'o zhes gsungs zhes bya ba ni de skad du gsungs pa'o //
translated: There is no offense means there is no fault.

original: gsal bar smros zhes bya ba ni gsal por shes pa'o //
analyzed: gsal bar smros zhes bya ba ni gsal por shes pa'o //
translated: Clearly state means clearly understand.

original: 'di la gzhan gyi bsam pa ni zla ba'i spangs pa ni zla ba 'das pa kho nas byung ngo zhes bya ba de ni kho bo cag la nges pa kho na yin na /
analyzed: 'di la gzhan gyi bsam pa ni zla ba'i spangs pa ni zla ba 'das pa kho nas byung ngo zhes bya ba de ni kho bo cag la nges pa kho na yin na /
translated: Here the opponent thinks: It is certain for us that the relinquishment of moon cloth occurs only through the passing of the month.

original: 'on kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam pa gzhan gyis ji srid 'tsho'i bar du 'chang pa'i dge slong la ltung ba med pa kho nar gsungs so zhes bya ba 'di la ci ste 'di skad du gsungs zhes bya ba'i rgyu kho bo la brjod par bya'o zhes bya🔽ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam pa gzhan gyis ji srid 'tsho'i bar du 'chang pa'i dge slong la ltung ba med pa kho nar gsungs so zhes bya ba 'di la ci ste 'di skad du gsungs zhes bya ba'i rgyu kho bo la brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: What is the reason for saying this?

original: 'di la lan ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'di la lan ni 'di yin te /
translated: The answer is this:

original: zla ba gcig tshun chad du shi ba la brten nas de skad du gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zla ba gcig tshun chad du shi ba la brten nas de skad du gsungs pa yin no //
translated: He said that based on death within one month.

original: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Similarly, here the text is:

original: btsun pa dge slong gis ji srid 'tsho'i bar du bzhag la ltung bar yang mi 'gyur ba lta mchis lags sam /
analyzed: btsun pa dge slong gis ji srid 'tsho'i bar du bzhag la ltung bar yang mi 'gyur ba lta mchis lags sam /
translated: “Venerable, is it the case that a monk can keep it for life and not incur a downfall?”

original: nye ba 'khor yod de /
analyzed: nye ba 'khor yod de /
translated: Upāli said, “Yes.”

original: zla ba gcig tshun chad du shi na'o zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: zla ba gcig tshun chad du shi na'o zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: “If he dies within one month.”

original: yang na chos gos rung ba ma yin pa la dgongs na de skad du gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: yang na chos gos rung ba ma yin pa la dgongs na de skad du gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Or, he said that if it is a non-suitable robe.

original: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Similarly, here the text is:🔽“Venerable, is it the case that a monk can keep it for life and not incur a downfall?”

original: btsun pa dge slong gis chos gos dgung zla ba gcig phan chad du bzhag la spang ba'i ltung byed du yang mi 'gyur ba lta mchis lags sam /
analyzed: btsun pa dge slong gis chos gos dgung zla ba gcig phan chad du bzhag la spang ba'i ltung byed du yang mi 'gyur ba lta mchis lags sam /
translated: Venerable, is there a case where a monk does not commit an offense entailing relinquishment for keeping a Dharma robe for more than one day?

original: nye ba 'khor yod de /
analyzed: nye ba 'khor yod de /
translated: “Upāli, there is.

original: 'di ltar chos gos de spun rung la rgyu rung ba ma yin pa dang zhes bya ba yin te snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar chos gos de spun rung la rgyu rung ba ma yin pa dang zhes bya ba yin te snga ma bzhin no //
translated: It is when the robe is not suitable for a fellow monk and is not suitable as a material for a robe, as in the previous cases.

original: yang na sra brkyang bting ba la dgongs nas de skad du gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: yang na sra brkyang bting ba la dgongs nas de skad du gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Or it is when the robe is mentioned with the intention that the robe-making season is in progress.

original: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: The text here is similar:

original: btsun pa dge slong gis chos gos dgung zla drug tu bzhag la ltung bar yang mi 'gyur ba lta mchis lags sam /
analyzed: btsun pa dge slong gis chos gos dgung zla drug tu bzhag la ltung bar yang mi 'gyur ba lta mchis lags sam /
translated: Venerable, is there a case where a monk does not commit an offense for keeping a Dharma robe for six months?

original: nye ba 'khor yod de /
analyzed: nye ba 'khor yod de /
translated: “Upāli, there is.

original: chos gos rnyed nas zhag sum cu lon pa dang sra brkyang bting bar gyur na'o zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: chos gos rnyed nas zhag sum cu lon pa dang sra brkyang bting bar gyur na'o zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: It is when a monk has obtained a robe and thirty days have passed since the end of the robe season.”

original: mdo byed pas kyang /
analyzed: mdo byed pas kyang /
translated: The author of the Kṣudraka Collection also says:

original: 'di gsum ni sra brkyang bting ba la mi 'byung ngo zhes bshad do //
analyzed: 'di gsum ni sra brkyang bting ba la mi 'byung ngo zhes bshad do //
translated: These three do not occur during the robe-making season.

original: yang na sngon pham pa byung ba la @96a * //
analyzed: yang na sngon pham pa byung ba la @96a * //
translated: Or else, it is a case of a former defeat.🔽

original: sogs pa'i dbang du mdzad nas de skad du gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: sogs pa'i dbang du mdzad nas de skad du gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Or else, this is stated from the perspective of those who have previously incurred a root downfall and so on.

original: snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin no //
translated: This is similar to the previous explanation.

original: sdom brtson can ni pha ma las zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: sdom brtson can ni pha ma las zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Those who are diligent in vows should obtain robes from their parents and so on.

original: pha ma las zhes bya ba ni pha dang ma dag las so //
analyzed: pha ma las zhes bya ba ni pha dang ma dag las so //
translated: From their parents means from one's father and mother.

original: rung ba ni btags pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rung ba ni btags pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Suitable means designated and so on.

original: dpag bsam gyi gos la sogs pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dpag bsam gyi gos la sogs pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means not from wish fulfilling garments and so on.

original: rung ba zhes bya ba smos pa ni rung ba ma yin pa bkag go //
analyzed: rung ba zhes bya ba smos pa ni rung ba ma yin pa bkag go //
translated: The term suitable excludes unsuitable.

original: blang byas na zhes bya ba ni rang gis byas na'o //
analyzed: blang byas na zhes bya ba ni rang gis byas na'o //
translated: If they obtain it by themselves means if they obtain it themselves.

original: spangs pa'i nyes pa yis zhes bya ba ni spang ba'i ltung bas so //
analyzed: spangs pa'i nyes pa yis zhes bya ba ni spang ba'i ltung bas so //
translated: By the fault of abandoning means by the downfall of abandoning.

original: dri ma can du gyur pa zhes bya ba ni ma rung bar ro //
analyzed: dri ma can du gyur pa zhes bya ba ni ma rung bar ro //
translated: Become stained means become unsuitable.

original: 'di la don ni dge slong gis pha ma las chos gos rung ba blangs pa ni nyes pa med pa kho na'o zhes bya ba de ni kho bo la gsal ba snyam byed na /
analyzed: 'di la don ni dge slong gis pha ma las chos gos rung ba blangs pa ni nyes pa med pa kho na'o zhes bya ba de ni kho bo la gsal ba snyam byed na /
translated: The meaning of this is that it is only a fault for a monk to accept proper Dharma robes from his parents.

original: 'on kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam grangs 'ga' zhig gis de la spang ba'i ltung byed du gsungs so zhes bya ba de lta bu yin zhes bya ba 'di la khyod kyis cung zad cig brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'di yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam grangs 'ga' zhig gis de la spang ba'i ltung byed du gsungs so zhes bya ba de lta bu yin zhes bya ba 'di la khyod kyis cung zad cig brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'di yin no //
translated: But you should say something about this, since the Bhagavān has said that this is a downfall that requires confession in some cases.

original: 'di la lan ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'di la lan ni 'di yin te /
translated: The answer to this is as follows.

original: dge 'dun la bsngos pa dang rang gir byed pa'i dbang du mdzad nas de skad du gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: dge 'dun la bsngos pa dang rang gir byed pa'i dbang du mdzad nas de skad du gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This was said with regard to dedicating to the saṅgha and making it one’s own.

original: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Similarly, here the text says:

original: btsun pa dge slong gis pha ma las chos gos blangs la spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ba lta mchis lags sam ;
analyzed: btsun pa dge slong gis pha ma las chos gos blangs la spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ba lta mchis lags sam ;
translated: “Venerable, is it the case that a monk accepts Dharma robes from his parents and it becomes a downfall that requires confession?”

original: nye ba 'khor yod de /
analyzed: nye ba 'khor yod de /
translated: “Upāli, it is.”🔽“Venerable, how is it?”

original: 'di ltar chos gos pha mas dge 'dun la bsngos pa yin la nges shes bzhin du gang zag bdag nyid kyis sgyur bar byed na chos gos grub na spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar chos gos pha mas dge 'dun la bsngos pa yin la nges shes bzhin du gang zag bdag nyid kyis sgyur bar byed na chos gos grub na spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Thus, the upper and lower robes are dedicated to the Saṅgha, and if a monk exchanges them for himself with the definite understanding that they are to be given to him, then if the robes are completed, it is a downfall that requires relinquishment.🔽In this regard, the Questions of Upāli states:

original: 'di la zhu ba las byung ba gzhung gzhan yang bcom ldan 'das kyis nye du ma yin pa las chos gos len na spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes bka' stsal pa gang lags pa /
analyzed: 'di la zhu ba las byung ba gzhung gzhan yang bcom ldan 'das kyis nye du ma yin pa las chos gos len na spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes bka' stsal pa gang lags pa /
translated: “The Blessed One said that if a monk receives Dharma robes from someone who is not a relative, it becomes a downfall that requires relinquishment.

original: dge slong gis dge slong ma las chos gos blangs la de yang spang ba'i ltung bar 'gyur ba lta mchis lags sam /
analyzed: dge slong gis dge slong ma las chos gos blangs la de yang spang ba'i ltung bar 'gyur ba lta mchis lags sam /
translated: Is it the case that a monk receives Dharma robes from a nun and that becomes a downfall that requires relinquishment?”

original: nye ba 'khor yod de /
analyzed: nye ba 'khor yod de /
translated: Upāli, it is possible.

original: gal te des dge 'dun la spags pa yin la /
analyzed: gal te des dge 'dun la spags pa yin la /
translated: If a nun dedicates the robes to the Saṅgha,

original: dge slong gis bdag nyid la sbyor bar byed na'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: dge slong gis bdag nyid la sbyor bar byed na'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: but a monk exchanges them for himself.”

original: 'di la mdo byed pas kyang gzhan gyis gang zag gzhan nam /
analyzed: 'di la mdo byed pas kyang gzhan gyis gang zag gzhan nam /
translated: In this regard, the author of the root text also states:🔽“If a monk receives Dharma robes from a nun,

original: dge 'dun la bsngos pa'i rnyed pa shes bzhin du bdag nyid la bsgyur te thob na'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: dge 'dun la bsngos pa'i rnyed pa shes bzhin du bdag nyid la bsgyur te thob na'o zhes bshad do //
translated: If one knowingly diverts to oneself the property dedicated to the Sangha, one commits an offense.

original: zhag bdun pa'i sman dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhag bdun pa'i sman dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Medicines for seven days and so on.

original: byin gyis brlabs pa dus zhag bdun gyi @96b mthar thug par 'chang ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: byin gyis brlabs pa dus zhag bdun gyi @96b mthar thug par 'chang ba'i phyir te /
translated: One may keep medicines for seven days at most, because they are consecrated.

original: mar sar dang 'bru mar la sogs pa'i sman ni zhag bdun pa'i sman zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mar sar dang 'bru mar la sogs pa'i sman ni zhag bdun pa'i sman zhes bya'o //
translated: Medicines for seven days are medicines such as butter, oil, and so on.

original: sman dag bcangs na zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: sman dag bcangs na zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: If one keeps medicines,

original: bcangs na zhes bya ba ni bzhag na'o //
analyzed: bcangs na zhes bya ba ni bzhag na'o //
translated: keeping means storing.

original: ltung ba med par gsungs pa zhes bya ba ni sdom brtson zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: ltung ba med par gsungs pa zhes bya ba ni sdom brtson zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: It is said that there is no offense if one is diligent.

original: 'bod de smra bar gyis zhes bya ba ni bsgrims te smros shig pa'o //
analyzed: 'bod de smra bar gyis zhes bya ba ni bsgrims te smros shig pa'o //
translated: One should speak with urgency means one should speak with intensity.

original: 'di la tshig le'ur byas pa'i don ni zhag bdun pa'i sman ni zhag bdun 'das pa kho nas spang ba'i ltung byed kyi ltung ba 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de ni kho bo cag la nges na /
analyzed: 'di la tshig le'ur byas pa'i don ni zhag bdun pa'i sman ni zhag bdun 'das pa kho nas spang ba'i ltung byed kyi ltung ba 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de ni kho bo cag la nges na /
translated: The offense of a partial defeat occurs only after seven days have passed for medicine that is to be kept for seven days.🔽But why did the Blessed One say that there is no offense for keeping medicine for seven days for as long as one lives?

original: 'on kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis zhag bdun pa'i sman ji srid 'tsho'i bar du bcangs pa la ltung ba med pa kho nar gsungs so zhes bya ba de ci'i phyir de skad du bka' stsal pa snying nas soms la kho bo la smros shig ces bya ba 'di
analyzed: 'on kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis zhag bdun pa'i sman ji srid 'tsho'i bar du bcangs pa la ltung ba med pa kho nar gsungs so zhes bya ba de ci'i phyir de skad du bka' stsal pa snying nas soms la kho bo la smros shig ces bya ba 'di
translated: Think about this from the heart and tell me.

original: yin no // 'di la lan ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: yin no // 'di la lan ni 'di yin te /
translated: The answer is this:

original: zhag bdun tshun chad du shi ba la dgongs nas de skad du gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhag bdun tshun chad du shi ba la dgongs nas de skad du gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The Blessed One said this with the intention that death would occur within seven days.

original: nye ba 'khor yod de /

analyzed: yang na rung ba ma yin pa'i sman 'chang ba la dgongs nas de skad du gsungs pa yin te /

analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni /

analyzed: btsun pa dgung bdun pa'i sman dgung bdun las 'das par bcangs la spang ba'i ltung byed du mi 'gyur ba lta mchis lags sam /

original: nye ba 'khor yod de /
analyzed: nye ba 'khor yod de /

analyzed: yang na las dang po pa'am sngon pham pa byung ba la dgongs nas de skad du gsungs pa yin te /

analyzed: shes bzhin du ni brdzun gyi tshig ces bya ba la sogs pa la /

analyzed: shes bzhin du phyin ci log pa'i 'du shes nyams su myong ba ste ched du bsams nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

analyzed: brdzun ni don log pa'o //

analyzed: shes bzhin du smos pas ni blo sngon du btang ba'i brdzun gyi tshig bsal to //

analyzed: shin tu sreg ces bya ba ni shin tu sdug bsngal bskyed pas so //

analyzed: min zhes ltung byed bkag pa smos pas nyes byas su brjod pa ni gnang ba yin te /
translated: The prohibition of a downfall is stated with the words “it is not,” and the permission is stated with the words “it is a wrong doing.”

original: 'og ma dag la yang de bzhin kho nar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'og ma dag la yang de bzhin kho nar shes par bya'o //

analyzed: gsal por smros zhes bya ba ni nges par smros shig pa'o //

original: 'di la lan ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'di la lan ni 'di yin te /

analyzed: de ni smyos pa la sogs pa'i mdun du smras pa'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa yin no //

analyzed: btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis smyon pa'i drung du brdzun smras na cir 'gyur lags /
translated: “Lord, what if a monk lies in the presence of a mad person?”

original: nyes byas su'o //
analyzed: nyes byas su'o //

translated: Similarly, if one lies to a disturbed mind, to one in pain, to a fool, to a deaf person, to one asleep, to one intoxicated or crazed, to one possessed, or to one of another type of being, what does the Vinaya say?

analyzed: nyes byas so zhes bya ba yin no //

analyzed: mi'i 'gro ba ni tha snyad du bya ba nyid yin no zhes bshad do //

analyzed: yang na dbus pas dbus pa la mtha' 'khob pa'i skad du smras pa la dgongs nas gsungs pa yin te /

analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni /

original: dge slong gis dge slong la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: dge slong gis dge slong la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /

analyzed: gsal bar lan thob shig ces bya ba ni nges bar smros shig pa'o //
translated: “Clearly give an answer” means “speak decisively.”

original: 'di la don ni gang gi tshe dge slong gis khros nas dge slong la rdeg pa de'i tshe de la the tshom med par ltung byed kyi ltung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de ni shes pa nyid na /

analyzed: 'on kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis nyes byas su gsungs so zhes bya ba de brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba 'di yin no //

original: 'di la lan ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'di la lan ni 'di yin te /

analyzed: de ni 'dren thor la sogs pa la dgongs nas gsungs pa yin no //
translated: That statement was made with reference to a monk who is a novice and so on.

original: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Similarly, the text here

analyzed: btsun pa dge slong gis dge slong la brgyab pa ltung byed du yang mi 'gyur ba la lta mchis lags sam /

original: nye ba 'khor yod de /🔽'dren thor gyi bsam pa'am /
analyzed: nye ba 'khor yod de / 'dren thor gyi bsam pa'am /
translated: “Upāli, it is possible.”🔽“If he strikes with the intention to kill,

analyzed: gsad pa'i bsam pas rdeg na'o zhes bya ba yin no //

analyzed: yang na gzhan gyi don du rdeg pa la dgongs nas de skad du gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Or, that statement was made with reference to striking for the sake of others.

original: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni /

analyzed: btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis gzhan gyi slad du dge slong la brgyab na cir 'gyur lags /

original: nyes byas su'o zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: nyes byas su'o zhes bya ba yin no //

original: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Likewise, here the text is:

analyzed: btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis dge slong la gzhan gyis rdeg tu stsol na cir 'gyur lags / nyes byas su'o zhes bya @102a * //

original: ba yin no //
analyzed: ba yin no //
translated: “It becomes a wrong doing.”

original: yang na dge slong smyon pa'i dbang du mdzad nas de skad du gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: yang na dge slong smyon pa'i dbang du mdzad nas de skad du gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Or, it is stated with the intention of a monk who is insane.

original: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni /🔽btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis dge slong smyon pa la brgyab na cir 'gyur lags /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni / btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis dge slong smyon pa la brgyab na cir 'gyur lags /
translated: Likewise, here the text is:🔽“Lord, what if a monk strikes a monk who is insane?”

original: nyes byas su'o //
analyzed: nyes byas su'o //
translated: “It becomes a wrong doing.”

original: de bzhin du dge slong sems 'khrugs pa dang tshor bas nyen pa dang glen pa dang 'on pa dang gnyid kyis log pa dang myos pa dang snyoms par zhugs pa dang 'gro ba gzhan du gnas pa la brgyab na cir 'gyur lags /
analyzed: de bzhin du dge slong sems 'khrugs pa dang tshor bas nyen pa dang glen pa dang 'on pa dang gnyid kyis log pa dang myos pa dang snyoms par zhugs pa dang 'gro ba gzhan du gnas pa la brgyab na cir 'gyur lags /
translated: So too, if one strikes a monk with a mind disturbed by affliction, or one who is afflicted by feeling, or one who is stupid, deaf, asleep, intoxicated, or absorbed in meditative equipoise, or one who is situated in another realm, what occurs?

original: nyes byas su'o zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: nyes byas su'o zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: It is a wrong action.

original: yang na sngon pham pa byung ba la sogs pa la dgongs nas de skad du gsungs pa yin te snga ma bzhin no ;
analyzed: yang na sngon pham pa byung ba la sogs pa la dgongs nas de skad du gsungs pa yin te snga ma bzhin no ;
translated: Or it is said that the Buddha spoke with the intention of a former defeat, and so on, as before.

original: / sdom brtson me la reg byed pa //
analyzed: / sdom brtson me la reg byed pa //
translated: The one who strives in vows touches fire.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni thams cad mkhyen pas me la reg pa ci'i phyir nyes byas kyi ltung bar gsungs pa nges par kho bo la smros shig ces bya bar sbyar te /🔽de la me la reg pa byed pa zhes bya ba ni me len par byed pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni thams cad mkhyen pas me la reg pa ci'i phyir nyes byas kyi ltung bar gsungs pa nges par kho bo la smros shig ces bya bar sbyar te / de la me la reg pa byed pa zhes bya ba ni me len par byed pa'o //
translated: One should apply: “The Omniscient One definitely said to me, ‘Why is touching fire a wrong action downfall?’”🔽Touching fire is taking hold of fire.

original: reg par byed pa zhes smos pa ni reg pa yang bsdu ste /
analyzed: reg par byed pa zhes smos pa ni reg pa yang bsdu ste /
translated: The term “touching” includes contact.

original: yang dge slong gang mi na bar 'dod nas bdag nyid kyi phyir me la reg gam reg tu 'jug na zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dge slong gang mi na bar 'dod nas bdag nyid kyi phyir me la reg gam reg tu 'jug na zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Also, because it is said, “Any bhikṣu who, not being sick, desiring to heat himself, touches fire or causes it to be touched,”

original: kun mkhyen ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i don blang bar bya ba dang / dor bar bya ba'i mtshan nyid thabs dang bcas pa thams cad lag mthil du skyu ru ra bzhag pa bzhin du yongs su mkhyen pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun mkhyen ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i don blang bar bya ba dang / dor bar bya ba'i mtshan nyid thabs dang bcas pa thams cad lag mthil du skyu ru ra bzhag pa bzhin du yongs su mkhyen pa'i phyir ro //
translated: omniscience is the complete understanding of all the characteristics of the means of accepting and rejecting the past, future, and present, as if placing a myrobalan fruit in the palm of the hand.

original: thugs rje dang ldan pa'i zhes bya ba ni thugs rje chen po dang ldan pas so //
analyzed: thugs rje dang ldan pa'i zhes bya ba ni thugs rje chen po dang ldan pas so //
translated: Endowed with compassion means endowed with great compassion.

original: 'di la don ni gang gi tshe dge slong gis me la reg gam reg tu 'jug pa de'i tshe la ltung byed kyi ltung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de ni nges pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: 'di la don ni gang gi tshe dge slong gis me la reg gam reg tu 'jug pa de'i tshe la ltung byed kyi ltung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de ni nges pa nyid yin na /
translated: Here, the meaning is that when a bhikṣu touches fire or causes it to be touched, at that time it is certain that it becomes a pāyattika offense.

original: 'on kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis de la nyes byas su gsungs so zhes bya ba de ji lta bu yin pa kho bo la smros shig ces bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis de la nyes byas su gsungs so zhes bya ba de ji lta bu yin pa kho bo la smros shig ces bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: But tell me, why did the Bhagavat declare that to be a misdeed?

original: de la lan ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la lan ni 'di yin te /
translated: The answer is this:

original: de ni gzhan gyi don du reg pa la dgongs nas gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni gzhan gyi don du reg pa la dgongs nas gsungs pa yin no //
translated: He declared that with reference to contact for the sake of another.

original: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: In the same way, here the text is this:

original: btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis gzhan du zhugs pa la reg na cir 'gyur lags /
analyzed: btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis gzhan du zhugs pa la reg na cir 'gyur lags /
translated: “If a bhikṣu touches another in a certain way, what is the offense?”

original: nyes byas su'o zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: nyes byas su'o zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: “It is a misdeed.”

original: de bzhin du mdo las kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin du mdo las kyang /
translated: In the same way, a sūtra says,

original: 'di skad du yang dge slong gang min bar bde bar 'dod nas bdag gi phyir me la reg gam reg tu 'jug na ltung byed do zhes 'byung ste bdag cis smos pa'i phyir gzhan gyi ched du ni nyes @102b byas su'o zhes bya bar mngon no //
analyzed: 'di skad du yang dge slong gang min bar bde bar 'dod nas bdag gi phyir me la reg gam reg tu 'jug na ltung byed do zhes 'byung ste bdag cis smos pa'i phyir gzhan gyi ched du ni nyes @102b byas su'o zhes bya bar mngon no //
translated: “If a bhikṣu, desiring pleasure, touches fire for his own sake, or causes it to be touched, he commits a downfall.” Since it mentions “his own,” it is clear that it is a misdeed for the sake of another.

original: de bzhin du mdo byed pas kyang /🔽rang gi don nyid gtso cher yod pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du mdo byed pas kyang / rang gi don nyid gtso cher yod pa'o //
translated: In the same way, the author of the sūtra says,

original: zhes bshad do //
analyzed: zhes bshad do //
translated: “One’s own purpose is more important.”

original: yang na pho nya la reg tu 'jug pa'i dbang du mdzad nas de skad du gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: yang na pho nya la reg tu 'jug pa'i dbang du mdzad nas de skad du gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Or it is stated from the perspective of the messenger touching.

original: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Similarly, the text here is:

original: btsun pa dge slong gis pho nya la zhugs la reg tu stsol na cir 'gyur lags /
analyzed: btsun pa dge slong gis pho nya la zhugs la reg tu stsol na cir 'gyur lags /
translated: “If a monk sends a messenger to a woman and has her touch him, what is the offense?”

original: nyes byas su'o zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: nyes byas su'o zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: “It is a wrong doing.”

original: de bzhin du yi ge dang lag brda dang gzhan la snyad 'dogs pa dang / brgyud pas reg tu stsol na cir 'gyur lags /
analyzed: de bzhin du yi ge dang lag brda dang gzhan la snyad 'dogs pa dang / brgyud pas reg tu stsol na cir 'gyur lags /
translated: “Similarly, if he sends a messenger to a woman by means of a letter, sign language, or slander, and has her touch him, what is the offense?”

original: nyes byas su'o zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: nyes byas su'o zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: “It is a wrong doing.”

original: 'di la mdo byed pas bshad pa yang snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di la mdo byed pas bshad pa yang snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Here the author of the text explains it as before.

original: dge slong nub gnyis las lhag par zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dge slong nub gnyis las lhag par bsnyen par rdzogs pa dang bral ba dang nyal bar byed pa ji ltar nyes byas kyi ltung ba byed par gsungs zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: dge slong nub gnyis las lhag par zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dge slong nub gnyis las lhag par bsnyen par rdzogs pa dang bral ba dang nyal bar byed pa ji ltar nyes byas kyi ltung ba byed par gsungs zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: “If a monk sleeps more than two nights in the same bed as a fully ordained monk, what is the offense?” and so on. It is said that he commits the offense of wrong doing.

original: ci bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang / lhan cig rtag tu khyim na nyal ba la ltung ba rnam par gzhag gam zhe na /
analyzed: ci bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang / lhan cig rtag tu khyim na nyal ba la ltung ba rnam par gzhag gam zhe na /
translated: Is there a downfall for always sleeping in the home of a householder together with someone who is not fully ordained?

original: nub gnyis las lhag par zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: nub gnyis las lhag par zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The text says, “More than two nights.”

original: nub gnyis kyi 'og tu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nub gnyis kyi 'og tu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is, “After two nights.”

original: su dang lhan cig ce na /
analyzed: su dang lhan cig ce na /
translated: With whom?

original: bsnyen par rdzogs pa dang bral ba zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: bsnyen par rdzogs pa dang bral ba zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The text says, “With someone who is not fully ordained.”

original: bsnyen par rdzogs pa dang bral ba bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang dge sbyong la sogs pa dang lhan cig ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bsnyen par rdzogs pa dang bral ba bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang dge sbyong la sogs pa dang lhan cig ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is, “With someone who is not fully ordained, or with a renunciate, and so on.”

original: de la rdzogs pa ni bkra shis pa ste /
analyzed: de la rdzogs pa ni bkra shis pa ste /
translated: Here, “fully ordained” means auspicious.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is, “nirvana.”

original: de ni sdug bsngal thams cad med pa'i phyir dang / gcig tu zhi ba'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir rdzogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgrar brjod de /
analyzed: de ni sdug bsngal thams cad med pa'i phyir dang / gcig tu zhi ba'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir rdzogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgrar brjod de /
translated: Because it is the absence of all suffering and because it has the characteristic of complete peace, it is called “fully ordained.”🔽The Verses of Sāṅkhya say:

original: dri ma thams cad bcom nas ni //
analyzed: dri ma thams cad bcom nas ni //
translated: Having destroyed all stains,

original: mya ngan las 'das rdzogs pa thob //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das rdzogs pa thob //
translated: attain the fully ordained nirvana.

original: sdug bsngal tha mar byed pa ste //
analyzed: sdug bsngal tha mar byed pa ste //
translated: and it brings suffering to an end.

original: thams cad phun sum tshogs par 'gyur //
analyzed: thams cad phun sum tshogs par 'gyur //
translated: All will be perfect for them.

original: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because this is stated.

original: dge slong nyid rdzogs pa dang nye bar bsnyen pa'i ngo bor 'dug pa'i phyir bsnyen par rdzogs par brjod par bya bar shes par bya ste /
analyzed: dge slong nyid rdzogs pa dang nye bar bsnyen pa'i ngo bor 'dug pa'i phyir bsnyen par rdzogs par brjod par bya bar shes par bya ste /
translated: One should understand that one who is fully ordained is called “one who has completed the approach” because he is situated in the nature of a full upasaka.

original: nga'i dge slong tshul khrims dri ma med pa de la mtho ris ni ras yug gis chod pa tsam la thar pa ni yol bas chod pa tsam mo zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nga'i dge slong tshul khrims dri ma med pa de la mtho ris ni ras yug gis chod pa tsam la thar pa ni yol bas chod pa tsam mo zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said, “My bhikṣus, the higher realms are blocked by a mere cloth for one whose morality is stainless, and liberation is blocked by a mere curtain.”

original: de dang bral ba ste bsnyen par rdzogs pa med pa dang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de dang bral ba ste bsnyen par rdzogs pa med pa dang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “Free from that” means “without full ordination.”

original: nyal ba ni nyal te gnyid kyis log pa'i mtshan nyid de /🔽nyal na @103a * //
analyzed: nyal ba ni nyal te gnyid kyis log pa'i mtshan nyid de / nyal na @103a * //
translated: “Sleeping” means lying down, which is characterized by sleep.🔽“When lying down” means “when one has fallen asleep,”

original: zhes bya ba ni gnyid kyis log na'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gnyid kyis log na'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is said, “When one is lying down,🔽one should not do this.”

original: byed pa zhes bya ba ni lhag par spyod pa'o //
analyzed: byed pa zhes bya ba ni lhag par spyod pa'o //
translated: “This” refers to the superior conduct.

original: nyes byas ltung ba byed par zhes bya ba ni nyes byas kyi ltung ba dang ldan par ro //
analyzed: nyes byas ltung ba byed par zhes bya ba ni nyes byas kyi ltung ba dang ldan par ro //
translated: “Having committed a downfall of a wrong action” means having a downfall of a wrong action.

original: 'di la bsdus pa'i don ni dge slong gang zag bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dge sbyong la sogs pa dang lhan cig khyim gcig tu nub gnyis nyal nas nub gsum pa la de nyid dang lhan cig nyal na de'i phyir de la ltung byed kyi ltung bar 'gyur
analyzed: 'di la bsdus pa'i don ni dge slong gang zag bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dge sbyong la sogs pa dang lhan cig khyim gcig tu nub gnyis nyal nas nub gsum pa la de nyid dang lhan cig nyal na de'i phyir de la ltung byed kyi ltung bar 'gyur
translated: The condensed meaning of this is: “If a monk sleeps two nights in the same room as a non-fully-ordained person, such as a male novice, and on the third night sleeps with him, he commits an offense entailing confession.”

original: ro zhes bya ba de ni shin tu grags na /
analyzed: ro zhes bya ba de ni shin tu grags na /
translated: This is very well known.

original: 'on kyang dge slong bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang lhan cig nyal na de la ltung byed du 'gyur bar ma gsungs kyi nyes byas so zhes bya ba de brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang dge slong bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang lhan cig nyal na de la ltung byed du 'gyur bar ma gsungs kyi nyes byas so zhes bya ba de brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: However, it should be stated that if a monk sleeps with a non-fully-ordained person, he commits an offense entailing confession, not an offense of wrong conduct.

original: 'di la lan ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'di la lan ni 'di yin te /
translated: The answer to this is:

original: de ni gnas ma bskor ba'am ma g-yogs pa'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni gnas ma bskor ba'am ma g-yogs pa'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa yin no //
translated: That was stated with reference to an unroofed or uncovered place.

original: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Similarly, here the text states:

original: btsun pa dge slong gang zag bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang lhan cig tu sdum par nub gnyis lhag par mchis nyal bar bgyid la ltung byed du yang mi 'gyur ba lta mchis lags sam /
analyzed: btsun pa dge slong gang zag bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang lhan cig tu sdum par nub gnyis lhag par mchis nyal bar bgyid la ltung byed du yang mi 'gyur ba lta mchis lags sam /
translated: Is there a case where a monk, a reverend, does not commit an offense when he sleeps more than two nights in the same room with a person who is not fully ordained?

original: nye ba 'khor yod de /
analyzed: nye ba 'khor yod de /
translated: Upāli, there is.

original: 'di ltar gnas de kun nas g-yogs la ma bskor ba'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar gnas de kun nas g-yogs la ma bskor ba'am /
translated: It is like this: if the place is completely covered but not enclosed,

original: phyed bskor ba yin pa'am /
analyzed: phyed bskor ba yin pa'am /
translated: or half enclosed,

original: kun nas bskor la ma g-yogs pa'am /
analyzed: kun nas bskor la ma g-yogs pa'am /
translated: or completely enclosed but not covered,

original: phyed g-yogs pa yin la gnas de lta bur nyal bar byed na nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: phyed g-yogs pa yin la gnas de lta bur nyal bar byed na nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: or half covered, and if one sleeps in such a place, it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: mdo byed pas kyang 'di la phal cher g-yogs pa dang bskor ba ni gnas kyi mtha' yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: mdo byed pas kyang 'di la phal cher g-yogs pa dang bskor ba ni gnas kyi mtha' yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: The author of the summary also explains, Here, mostly covered and enclosed is the limit for a place.

original: yang na ri'i phug la sogs par nyal bar byed pa la dgongs nas de skad du gsungs pa yin te de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa re zhig dge slong ri phug gam shing gi bu ga dag gam rtsig pa'i bu ga dag tu gang zag bsnyen

analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni /

analyzed: btsun pa dge slong gis sar pa sar pa la kha dog ngan pa bgyi ba gsum po gang yang rung ba zhig gis kha dog ngan par ma bgyis par 'tshal la ltung byed du yang mi 'gyur ba lta mchis lags sam /

analyzed: nye ba 'khor yod de ;

analyzed: rnga bal dang gnag gi spu dang ri dags kyi bal dang bsres pa dang thags su ma btags pa'i gos gyon na cir 'gyur zhe na /

analyzed: nyes byas su 'gyur ba'o //

analyzed: mdo byed pas kyang 'di la rab tu byung ba'i rdzas dag la ni rung ba nyid dang zhes bshad do //

analyzed: yang na sngar ltung ba byung ba la sogs pa'i dbang du mdzad nas de skad du gsungs pa yin te snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Or, it is stated in this way from the perspective of those who have previously incurred a downfall and so on, as before.

original: sdom brtson rin chen la reg na //
analyzed: sdom brtson rin chen la reg na //

analyzed: rin chen la reg na zhes bya ba la rin po che ni nor bu dang mu tig dang bee d'urya dang shang ka shi la dang byi ru dang dngul dang gser dang rdo'i snying po dang spug dang dmar po dang g-yas dus 'khyil ba la sogs pa bde ba sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If he touches jewels, a jewel is a gem, pearl, lapis lazuli, conch shell, crystal, coral, silver, gold, emerald, ruby, sapphire, and so on, which are called jewels because they are the basis for the attainment of happiness.

analyzed: mdza' bo zhes bya ba ni mdza' bo zhes brjod pas 'bod pa yin no //

original: brtan po zhes bya ba ni brtan pa'o //
analyzed: brtan po zhes bya ba ni brtan pa'o //

original: 'di la lan ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'di la lan ni 'di yin te /

analyzed: bud med rin po che dang / khyim bdag dang / blon po dang / glang po che dang / rta rin po che la dgongs nas de skad du gsungs pa yin te /

original: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni /

analyzed: btsun pa dge slong gis rang gi sug pas rin po che la bzung na ltung byed du yang mi 'gyur ba lta mchis lags sam /

original: nye ba 'khor yod de /
analyzed: nye ba 'khor yod de /
translated: “Upāli, it is.”🔽“Lord, what is the reason for that?”

analyzed: bud med rin po che la sogs pa rin po che lnga la bzung nas gzhi ji lta ba bzhin 'gyur ro //
translated: If he grasps the precious woman and so on, the five precious things, he commits an offense similar to the offense entailing suspension.

analyzed: 'on te nor bu rin po che'am 'khor lo rin po che la bzung na ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no //

analyzed: 'di la gzhi ni ji lta ba bzhin gyi don ni 'di yin te /

analyzed: kun du chags pa'i sems kyis bud med rin po che la reg na dge 'dun gyi lhag ma'o //

analyzed: gal te ma yin na nyes byas so //

analyzed: khyim bdag dang blon po rin po che dag la 'dod chags dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems kyis reg na sbom po'o //

original: gal te ma yin na ltung ba med do //
analyzed: gal te ma yin na ltung ba med do //
translated: If he does not, there is no offense.

analyzed: glang po che dang rta rin po che dag la kun du chags pa'i sems kyis reg na nyes byas so //
translated: If he touches the precious elephant or the precious horse with a mind of lust, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: gal te ma yin na ltung ba med do //
analyzed: gal te ma yin na ltung ba med do //
translated: If he does not, there is no offense.

analyzed: rin po che dang der smos pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /

analyzed: rin po che ni 'di skad bshad pa'i ngo bo'o //

original: der smos pa ni rin po cher smos pa ste /
analyzed: der smos pa ni rin po cher smos pa ste /

analyzed: rol mo'i 'tshog chad pa wang dang 'od ma dang ba la ri dang ma h'a ti dang su gho sha la sogs pa rtsed mo bya ba'i cha byad dang / g-yul ngo'i cha byad ral gri dang ral gri kyog po dang ral gri so gcig pa dang mdung thung dang 'phang mdung dang lcags kyo la sogs pa dang lcags mda' dang mda' phyed lcags la sogs pa mtshon cha'o //
translated: Musical instruments are cymbals, flutes, conches, and drums. Weapons are swords, curved knives, single-edged swords, short spears, javelins, iron hooks, and so on, and arrows, half-arrows, and so on.

original: de bzhin du mdo byed pas kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin du mdo byed pas kyang /
translated: Similarly, the author of the Abhidharmakośa says,

analyzed: nor bu dang / mu tig dang / bee d'urya dang shang ka shi la dang bye ru dang dngul dang gser dang rdo'i snying po dang sbug dang dmar po dang g-yas su 'khyil pa la sogs pa'i rin po che'o //

analyzed: de dag kyang rin po che bzhin du bde ba bsgrub pa'i phyir rin po che dang 'dra bas rin po cher smos pa zhes bya'o //

analyzed: kho bo zhes bya ba ni @106a * //

analyzed: 'di la lan ni lha'i rin po che dang rin po cher smos pa la dgongs nas de skad du gsungs pa yin no //

analyzed: nye ba 'khor yod de /

analyzed: nye ba 'khor yod de / lha'i gnas sam / klu'i gnas sam /
