analyzed: de ni dbang pos lha ma yin rnams 'jug tu mi ster ba bzhin du phur pas 'debs par byed pa 'gog par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is like the king of the gods who blocks the asuras from entering.

original: ro langs mi ldang bar bya ba la ji skad du sgor gtan pa'i rten btsugs na zhes bya @108b ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ro langs mi ldang bar bya ba la ji skad du sgor gtan pa'i rten btsugs na zhes bya @108b ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is like the text that says, “When the bolt is placed in the door, the zombie does not rise.”

original: gtan pa'i rten de gang na yod pa zhig ce na /
analyzed: gtan pa'i rten de gang na yod pa zhig ce na /
translated: Where is that bolt?

original: btsun mo'i gnas yod la zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: btsun mo'i gnas yod la zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The text says, “In the place where the queen’s quarters are.”

original: btsun mo'i gnas ni rgyal po'i btsun mo gnas pa'i gnas so //
analyzed: btsun mo'i gnas ni rgyal po'i btsun mo gnas pa'i gnas so //
translated: The queen’s quarters are the place where the king’s queen lives.

original: de na yod cing de dang 'brel pa ni btsun mo'i gnas yod de /
analyzed: de na yod cing de dang 'brel pa ni btsun mo'i gnas yod de /
translated: The bolt is there and is connected to that place.

original: rgyal po'i btsun mo gnas pa'i gnas ni nyen chen po'i gnas su gyur pa nyid kyi phyir ltung byed du 'gyur la /
analyzed: rgyal po'i btsun mo gnas pa'i gnas ni nyen chen po'i gnas su gyur pa nyid kyi phyir ltung byed du 'gyur la /
translated: Because the place where the king’s queen resides is a place of great danger, there is a downfall.

original: de las gzhan pa dang 'brel pa'i gtan pa'i rten la gtugs pa la ni nyes byas su gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa dang 'brel pa'i gtan pa'i rten la gtugs pa la ni nyes byas su gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But if one enters the dwelling of a prostitute or a woman of the king’s harem, it is said that there is an offense.

original: gtugs na ni zhes bya ba ni zhugs na'o //
analyzed: gtugs na ni zhes bya ba ni zhugs na'o //
translated: “If one enters” means if one goes inside.

original: 'di la ni don ni gang gi tshe dge slong gis mtshan mo rin po che dang rin po cher smos pa dag ma bsdus par rgyal po'i btsun mo'i gnas kyi gtan pa'i rten tsam du yang zhugs na de'i tshe de la ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes bya
analyzed: 'di la ni don ni gang gi tshe dge slong gis mtshan mo rin po che dang rin po cher smos pa dag ma bsdus par rgyal po'i btsun mo'i gnas kyi gtan pa'i rten tsam du yang zhugs na de'i tshe de la ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes bya
translated: The meaning of this passage is that if a monk enters the dwelling of the king’s queen, even just to rest, without taking any precious jewels or objects considered precious, then at that time there is a downfall.

original: ba de ni kho bos shes na 'on kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis kha cig las de la ltung ba med pa kho nar gsungs so zhes bya ba de ji lta bu yin par brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: ba de ni kho bos shes na 'on kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis kha cig las de la ltung ba med pa kho nar gsungs so zhes bya ba de ji lta bu yin par brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: This is what I understand, but it must be explained how the Bhagavān said that there is no downfall in some cases.

original: 'di la lan ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'di la lan ni 'di yin te /
translated: The answer to this is as follows.

original: de ni btsun mo'i gnas stong par zhugs pa'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni btsun mo'i gnas stong par zhugs pa'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is stated from the perspective of entering the empty palace of the queen.

original: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Similarly, here the text is:

original: btsun pa dge slong gis dgung la sang skya rengs ma shar bar rin po che'am rin po cher smos pa dag ma bsdus par dag pa'i mtha'i gtan pa'i rten pa la gtugs la ltung bar yang mi 'gyur ba lta mchis lags sam /
analyzed: btsun pa dge slong gis dgung la sang skya rengs ma shar bar rin po che'am rin po cher smos pa dag ma bsdus par dag pa'i mtha'i gtan pa'i rten pa la gtugs la ltung bar yang mi 'gyur ba lta mchis lags sam /
translated: “Venerable, is there a case where a monk, without storing precious things or what is considered precious before dawn, does not commit an offense by relying on the edge of the pure lands?”

original: nye ba 'khor yod de /
analyzed: nye ba 'khor yod de /
translated: “Upāli, there is.

original: 'di ltar dge slong gis btsun mo'i gnas stong par zhugs na zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar dge slong gis btsun mo'i gnas stong par zhugs na zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: It is like this: if a monk enters the empty palace of the queen.”

original: de la don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows.

original: 'di la dag pa ma 'dres pa gzhan dag thun mong ma yin pa rgyal po dang nye ba yod pas na dag pa'i mtha' yin no //
analyzed: 'di la dag pa ma 'dres pa gzhan dag thun mong ma yin pa rgyal po dang nye ba yod pas na dag pa'i mtha' yin no //
translated: Since the pure lands are not shared with others, they are not common, and since they are near the king, they are the edge of the pure lands.

original: yang na de ni de lta bu'i rkyen gyis 'jug pa la brten nas gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: yang na de ni de lta bu'i rkyen gyis 'jug pa la brten nas gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Or it is stated in dependence on the entry there by such conditions.

original: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Similarly, here the text is:🔽“Is there a case where a monk, without storing precious things or what is considered precious before dawn, does not commit an offense by relying on the edge of the pure lands?”🔽“Upāli, there is.

original: rgyal pos bos sam btsun mo'am rgyal bu'am /
analyzed: rgyal pos bos sam btsun mo'am rgyal bu'am /
translated: It is like this: if a monk enters the empty palace of the queen.”

original: khrom gyi ru 'am grong mi 'am ljongs kyi mis bos na ltung ba med do zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: khrom gyi ru 'am grong mi 'am ljongs kyi mis bos na ltung ba med do zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: There is no offense if the monk is summoned by the king, the king’s men, the people of the town, or the people of the country.

original: yang na las dang po pa la sogs pa la dgongs nas de skad du gsungs pa yin te snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: yang na las dang po pa la sogs pa la dgongs nas de skad du gsungs pa yin te snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Or, the statement is made with reference to beginners, etc., as before.

original: grong nas dge slong ma la ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni grong na gnas pa'i dge slong ma la zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: grong nas dge slong ma la ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni grong na gnas pa'i dge slong ma la zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: “A monk who lives in a town” and so on means that the monk who lives in a town is connected with the nun who lives in a town.

original: de na gnas zhes bya ba ni grong na gnas pa'o //🔽de su zhig ce na sdom brtson zhes bya ba smos te dge slong zhes bya @109a * //
analyzed: de na gnas zhes bya ba ni grong na gnas pa'o // de su zhig ce na sdom brtson zhes bya ba smos te dge slong zhes bya @109a * //
translated: “Lives there” means lives in a town.🔽Who is that? The text says “the one who is diligent,” that is, a monk.

original: ba'i don to //
analyzed: ba'i don to //
translated: What is the meaning of “monk”?

original: ci gzhan len du 'jug pa yang yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: ci gzhan len du 'jug pa yang yin nam zhe na /
translated: Is it also to be taken by another?

original: bdag gis zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: bdag gis zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The text says “by himself.”

original: bdag gnyid kyis yin gyi gzhan gyis ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig go //
analyzed: bdag gnyid kyis yin gyi gzhan gyis ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig go //
translated: The meaning of the text is that it is by himself, not by another.

original: grong na gnas pas ci zhig byas she na /
analyzed: grong na gnas pas ci zhig byas she na /
translated: What is done by the one who lives in a town?

original: blangs na zhes bya ba smos te /🔽kun du blangs na'o //
analyzed: blangs na zhes bya ba smos te / kun du blangs na'o //
translated: The text says “if he takes.”

original: ci zhig blangs she na /
analyzed: ci zhig blangs she na /
translated: What is taken?

original: kha zas zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: kha zas zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Food is mentioned.

original: bca' bar bya ba'i bdag nyid kyi kha zas so //
analyzed: bca' bar bya ba'i bdag nyid kyi kha zas so //
translated: Food is of the nature of that which is chewed.

original: nyes med ces bya ba ni nyes pa med par ro //
analyzed: nyes med ces bya ba ni nyes pa med par ro //
translated: Without fault means without transgression.

original: ci thams cad kyi thams cad du nyes pa med par gsungs sam zhe na /
analyzed: ci thams cad kyi thams cad du nyes pa med par gsungs sam zhe na /
translated: Is it said that there is no fault in all cases?

original: so sor bshags bya'i zhes bya ba ni smos te /
analyzed: so sor bshags bya'i zhes bya ba ni smos te /
translated: It is said that there is no fault in confessing.

original: so sor bshags dgos pa ni so sor bshags par bya ba'o //
analyzed: so sor bshags dgos pa ni so sor bshags par bya ba'o //
translated: That which must be confessed is to be confessed.

original: de ste so sor bshags par bya ba'i nyes pa dang mi ldan par gsungs kyi thams cad du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ste so sor bshags par bya ba'i nyes pa dang mi ldan par gsungs kyi thams cad du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is said that there is no fault in possessing the fault that must be confessed, but not in all cases.

original: de la so sor bshags par bya ba ni rab tu bsgrags ba tsam gyis ltung ba bzlog pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de la so sor bshags par bya ba ni rab tu bsgrags ba tsam gyis ltung ba bzlog pa'i phyir te /
translated: There, that which must be confessed is for the sake of averting a downfall merely by proclaiming it.

original: de smra ba'i rnam par brjod pa las so sor bshags pa nyid du brjod kyi bshags pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de smra ba'i rnam par brjod pa las so sor bshags pa nyid du brjod kyi bshags pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is called confession because it is expressed in the verbal expression of that. But it is not confession.

original: gzhan dag na re ji ltar bshags pa ltung byed kyi ltung ba gcig cig gi mdun du bshags par bya ba ltar 'di yang de dang 'dra'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re ji ltar bshags pa ltung byed kyi ltung ba gcig cig gi mdun du bshags par bya ba ltar 'di yang de dang 'dra'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: Just as one confesses a single downfall of a one day penance in the presence of a monk, so too it is like that here.

original: 'di la 'dri ba'i bsam pa ni gang gi cho dge slong grong na gnas pas dge slong ma grong na gnas pa zhig las bca' bar bya ba dang bza' bar bya ba blangs te 'chos sam zos na de'i tse de la so sor bshags par bya ba'i ltung
analyzed: 'di la 'dri ba'i bsam pa ni gang gi cho dge slong grong na gnas pas dge slong ma grong na gnas pa zhig las bca' bar bya ba dang bza' bar bya ba blangs te 'chos sam zos na de'i tse de la so sor bshags par bya ba'i ltung
translated: The thought of the questioner is: If a monk living in a village accepts food to eat or food to chew, such as roasted grain flour and so on, from a nun living in that village and then eats it, he commits an offense of wrongdoing.

original: bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de ni shes na /
analyzed: bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de ni shes na /
translated: If that is known,

original: 'on kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis de la nyes byas kyi ltung ba kho nar gsungs so zhes bya ba de ji lta bu yin zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis de la nyes byas kyi ltung ba kho nar gsungs so zhes bya ba de ji lta bu yin zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: why did the Bhagavan say that it is only an offense of wrong conduct?

original: 'di la lan 'di yin te ;
analyzed: 'di la lan 'di yin te ;
translated: The answer to that is:

original: kha zas rung ba ma yin pa len pa la dgongs nas de skad du gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: kha zas rung ba ma yin pa len pa la dgongs nas de skad du gsungs pa yin no //
translated: That was stated intending that it is unacceptable food.

original: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Similarly, here the treatise is:

original: btsun pa dge slong gis dge slong ma nye du ma lags pa shul po che na mchis pa la bsod snyoms blangs te 'tshal la so sor bshags par bgyi ba'i ltung bar yang mi 'gyur ba lta mchis lags sam /
analyzed: btsun pa dge slong gis dge slong ma nye du ma lags pa shul po che na mchis pa la bsod snyoms blangs te 'tshal la so sor bshags par bgyi ba'i ltung bar yang mi 'gyur ba lta mchis lags sam /
translated: Venerable, is there a case where a monk who has received almsfood from a non-relative nun who is staying in a remote place, and then eats it, does not commit an offense requiring confession?

original: nye ba 'khor yod de /
analyzed: nye ba 'khor yod de /
translated: Upāli, there is.

original: kha zas rung bam yin pa blangs nas za bar byed na na'o zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: kha zas rung bam yin pa blangs nas za bar byed na na'o zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: If he receives and eats food that is not suitable, then there is.

original: yang na dge slong ma smyon pa la sogs pa la dgongs nas de skad du gsungs pa yin te /🔽de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: yang na dge slong ma smyon pa la sogs pa la dgongs nas de skad du gsungs pa yin te / de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Or it was stated with that intention regarding a mad nun, and so on.

original: btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis dge slong ma @109b smyon ma shul po che na mchis pa la bsod snyoms rang gi sug par blangs te 'tshal na cir 'gyur lags /
analyzed: btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis dge slong ma @109b smyon ma shul po che na mchis pa la bsod snyoms rang gi sug par blangs te 'tshal na cir 'gyur lags /
translated: Similarly, here the text says, Venerable, is there a case where a monk who has received almsfood from a mad nun who is staying in a remote place, and then eats it, commits an offense?

original: nyes byas su'o zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: nyes byas su'o zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: It is said, There is, it is a minor offense.

original: sems 'khrugs ma la sogs pas kyang de bzhin du brjod par bya ste snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: sems 'khrugs ma la sogs pas kyang de bzhin du brjod par bya ste snga ma bzhin no //
translated: It should be stated similarly for those with disturbed minds, and so on, as before.

original: yang na sngon pham pa byung ba la sogs pa la nyes byas su 'gyur ba yin te snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: yang na sngon pham pa byung ba la sogs pa la nyes byas su 'gyur ba yin te snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Or else, it is a misdeed for one who has previously incurred a defeat, and so on.

original: 'dul ba dri ba'i tshig le'ur byas pa le'u gnyis pa'i gtan la dbab pa'o /
analyzed: 'dul ba dri ba'i tshig le'ur byas pa le'u gnyis pa'i gtan la dbab pa'o /
translated: This concludes the definitive statements on the second chapter of the Verses on the Topics of the Vinaya.

original: // / dge slong so sor thar ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dge slong gis so sor thar pa'i mdo 'don pa lnga char yang ma bton par ji ltar des gso sbyong byas par 'gyur ba dris smros shig ces bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: // / dge slong so sor thar ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dge slong gis so sor thar pa'i mdo 'don pa lnga char yang ma bton par ji ltar des gso sbyong byas par 'gyur ba dris smros shig ces bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The questioner asks, “When a monk does not recite the five parts of the Sūtra on the Foundation of the Training, how does he perform the poṣadha?”

original: de la so sor thar pa'i mdo 'don pa ni gleng gzhi dang pham par 'gyur ba dang / dge 'dun lhag ma dang / ma nges pa dang / ril gyis 'don pa'i mtshan nyid dag go //
analyzed: de la so sor thar pa'i mdo 'don pa ni gleng gzhi dang pham par 'gyur ba dang / dge 'dun lhag ma dang / ma nges pa dang / ril gyis 'don pa'i mtshan nyid dag go //
translated: The five parts of the Sūtra on the Foundation of the Training are the introduction, the defeats, the partially concordant with the defeats, the undetermined offenses, and the recitation of the entire text.

original: de dag ma bton par zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun gyi nang du ma brjod par ro //
analyzed: de dag ma bton par zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun gyi nang du ma brjod par ro //
translated: “Not reciting them” means not reciting them in the midst of the saṅgha.

original: de dag gang dag 'brel pa zhe na /
analyzed: de dag gang dag 'brel pa zhe na /
translated: What are they related to?

original: so sor thar pa'i zhes smos so ;
analyzed: so sor thar pa'i zhes smos so ;
translated: The text says “the Sūtra on the Foundation of the Training.”

original: / so sor thar pa ni des dang por sdig pa las thar pa'i phyir de de'i yin no //
analyzed: / so sor thar pa ni des dang por sdig pa las thar pa'i phyir de de'i yin no //
translated: Liberation is so called because one is liberated from evil through it.

original: de yis zhes bya ba ni dge slong gis so //
analyzed: de yis zhes bya ba ni dge slong gis so //
translated: By it means by the monk.

original: gso sbyong ni tshul khrims gso ba'i phyir dang sdig pa rnam par sbyong ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: gso sbyong ni tshul khrims gso ba'i phyir dang sdig pa rnam par sbyong ba'i phyir te /
translated: Purification is so called because it purifies morality and purifies evil.🔽Thus it is said:

original: 'di ltar / dge ba mtha' dag yang dag gso byed cing //
analyzed: 'di ltar / dge ba mtha' dag yang dag gso byed cing //
translated: It completely purifies all that is virtuous

original: sdig pa mtha' dag yang dag 'dir sbyong ba //
analyzed: sdig pa mtha' dag yang dag 'dir sbyong ba //
translated: and completely purifies all that is evil.

original: de gso phyir dang sdig pa rnam sbyong phyir //
analyzed: de gso phyir dang sdig pa rnam sbyong phyir //
translated: Because it purifies and because it purifies evil,

original: de bzhin gshegs pas gso sbyong zhes gsungs so //🔽zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas gso sbyong zhes gsungs so // zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: the Tathagata has taught it to be purification.

original: 'di la don ni gang gi cho dge slong gis so sor thar pa'i mdo bton pa lnga po dag las so sor thar pa'i mdo 'don pa 'ga' tsam bton na yang de'i tshe des gso sbyong byas par gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba ni shes na /
analyzed: 'di la don ni gang gi cho dge slong gis so sor thar pa'i mdo bton pa lnga po dag las so sor thar pa'i mdo 'don pa 'ga' tsam bton na yang de'i tshe des gso sbyong byas par gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba ni shes na /
translated: The meaning of this is that if a monk recites even a single verse from the five Pratimoksa Sutras, then at that time he has performed purification.

original: 'on kyang 'ga' yang ma bton la gso sbyong yang byas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de ji lta bu yin pa brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'ga' yang ma bton la gso sbyong yang byas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de ji lta bu yin pa brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: How is this?

original: 'di la gtan la dbab pa'i rgyu ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'di la gtan la dbab pa'i rgyu ni 'di yin te /
translated: This is the basis for the conclusion:

original: dgag dbye la brten nas de skad du gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: dgag dbye la brten nas de skad du gsungs pa yin te /
translated: It is said that this is the case when the lifting of restrictions is based on that.

original: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: In the same way, the text here is:

original: btsun pa dge slong gis so sor thar ba'i mdo 'don pa lnga po dag las so sor thar pa'i mdo 'don pa gang yang rung pa ma bton la gso sbyong yang bgyis par 'gyur ba lta mchis lags sam /
analyzed: btsun pa dge slong gis so sor thar ba'i mdo 'don pa lnga po dag las so sor thar pa'i mdo 'don pa gang yang rung pa ma bton la gso sbyong yang bgyis par 'gyur ba lta mchis lags sam /
translated: “Lord, is it the case that when a monk does not recite any of the five types of sutras of the pratimoksha, the purification and restoration is still performed?”

original: nye ba 'khor yod de /
analyzed: nye ba 'khor yod de /
translated: “Upagupta, it is.”

original: dgag dbye'i tshe dag dbye byed na'o //
analyzed: dgag dbye'i tshe dag dbye byed na'o //
translated: “When the lifting of restrictions is performed.”

original: de bzhin du mdo byed pas @110a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du mdo byed pas @110a * //
translated: In the same way, the author of the sutra explains:

original: kyang dgag dbye byas na 'di ma grub pa nyid ma yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: kyang dgag dbye byas na 'di ma grub pa nyid ma yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: “If the lifting of restrictions is performed, this is not a failure.”

original: so sor thar ba'i mdo mi 'don cir zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: so sor thar ba'i mdo mi 'don cir zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: As for the question, “What if the sutra of the pratimoksha is not recited?” and so on,

original: so sor thar ba zhes bya ba dang / gso sbyong zhes bya ba'i don de ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: so sor thar ba zhes bya ba dang / gso sbyong zhes bya ba'i don de ni bshad zin to //
translated: The meaning of the terms “individual liberation” and “purification and vow” has already been explained.

original: de mi 'don cing zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun gyi nang du mi brjod pa'o //
analyzed: de mi 'don cing zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun gyi nang du mi brjod pa'o //
translated: “Not reciting” means not reciting in the midst of the Saṅgha.

original: de bas na 'di ni mthun pa'i gso sbyong bsal to //
analyzed: de bas na 'di ni mthun pa'i gso sbyong bsal to //
translated: Therefore, this is an exception to the purification and vow that is in accordance with the rules.

original: byin gyis brlabs pa ni rgyud dag pa'o //
analyzed: byin gyis brlabs pa ni rgyud dag pa'o //
translated: “Empowered” means having a pure continuum.

original: de ltar na 'o na gzhan nye na byin gyis rlob par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar na 'o na gzhan nye na byin gyis rlob par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then it would be empowered by another.

original: gzhan gyi drung du byin mi rlob //🔽ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi drung du byin mi rlob // ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: “One does not empower another.”

original: gzhan gyi drung du zhes bya ba ni dge slong tshul khrims dang lta ba dang ldan pa'i mdun du ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyi drung du zhes bya ba ni dge slong tshul khrims dang lta ba dang ldan pa'i mdun du ste /
translated: “In the presence of another” means in the presence of a fully ordained monk who has pure ethics and views.

original: gso sbyong byin gyis mi rlob pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: gso sbyong byin gyis mi rlob pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: “One does not empower the purification and vow” is to be supplied.

original: de bas na 'dis ni gso sbyong byin gyis brlab pa bkag go //
analyzed: de bas na 'dis ni gso sbyong byin gyis brlab pa bkag go //
translated: Therefore, this prohibits the empowerment of the purification and vow.

original: 'dir zhes bya ba ni gso sbyong byas pa yin la'o //
analyzed: 'dir zhes bya ba ni gso sbyong byas pa yin la'o //
translated: “Here” means in the midst of those who have performed the purification and vow.

original: 'di la tshig gi don ni gang gi tshe dge slong gis so sor thar pa'i mdo 'don pas kyang gso sbyong mi byed la /
analyzed: 'di la tshig gi don ni gang gi tshe dge slong gis so sor thar pa'i mdo 'don pas kyang gso sbyong mi byed la /
translated: The meaning of the words is this: When a monk does not perform the poṣadha through reciting the Sūtra on Individual Liberation,

original: dge slong gzhan gyi drung du yang byin gyis mi rlob na de'i tshe ma byas pa yin no zhes bya ba de ni kho bo la nges na /
analyzed: dge slong gzhan gyi drung du yang byin gyis mi rlob na de'i tshe ma byas pa yin no zhes bya ba de ni kho bo la nges na /
translated: and does not authorize it in the presence of another monk, then at that time it is not performed.

original: 'on kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis des gso sbyong byas par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa de ji lta bu yin pa brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis des gso sbyong byas par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa de ji lta bu yin pa brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: This is certain for me, but I must explain why the Bhagavān said, “He has performed the poṣadha.”

original: 'di la gtan la dbab pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'di la gtan la dbab pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The conclusion here is this:

original: sems bskyed pa'i byin gyis brlab pa la dgongs nas de skad du gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa'i byin gyis brlab pa la dgongs nas de skad du gsungs pa yin te /
translated: He said that with the intention that the authorization is generated by the mind.

original: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Similarly, here the text is this:

original: btsun pa dge slong gis tshig tu yang ma smras pa la gso sbyong yang bgyis par 'gyur ba lta mchis lags sam /
analyzed: btsun pa dge slong gis tshig tu yang ma smras pa la gso sbyong yang bgyis par 'gyur ba lta mchis lags sam /
translated: “Venerable, can a monk who does not speak the words perform the poṣadha?”

original: nye ba 'khor yod do //
analyzed: nye ba 'khor yod do //
translated: “Upa-Ghoṣa, there is.”

original: sems kyis na'o zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: sems kyis na'o zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: “By the mind.”

original: 'di la gzhung gzhan yang ;
analyzed: 'di la gzhung gzhan yang ;
translated: There is another text:

original: btsun pa dge slong gis gso sbyong lnga po dag las gso sbyong gang yang rung ba zhig nyams su myong bar mi bgyis pa gso sbyong bgyis par yang 'gyur la /
analyzed: btsun pa dge slong gis gso sbyong lnga po dag las gso sbyong gang yang rung ba zhig nyams su myong bar mi bgyis pa gso sbyong bgyis par yang 'gyur la /
translated: “Venerable, is there any way that a fully ordained monk does not experience any of the five poṣadhas, but still does the poṣadha,

original: ltung ba yang ma mchis par 'gyur ba lta mchis lags sam /
analyzed: ltung ba yang ma mchis par 'gyur ba lta mchis lags sam /
translated: and does not commit a downfall?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān said,

original: yod de / gso sbyong byin gyis brlabs na'o zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: yod de / gso sbyong byin gyis brlabs na'o zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: “Yes, if he consecrates the poṣadha.”

original: de bzhin du 'di la gzhung gzhan ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'di la gzhung gzhan ni /
translated: Similarly, there is another text:

original: dge slong dag lnga po 'di dag ni sems bskyed pas 'grub par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: dge slong dag lnga po 'di dag ni sems bskyed pas 'grub par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: “Monks, these five are accomplished by generating the mind:

original: gso sbyong dang / dgag dbye dang / gos byin gyis brlab pa dang / gos bsngo ba dang / gang zag mgron du bos pa'o zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gso sbyong dang / dgag dbye dang / gos byin gyis brlab pa dang / gos bsngo ba dang / gang zag mgron du bos pa'o zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: poṣadha, the lifting of restrictions, consecrating robes, dedicating robes, and inviting individuals.”

original: @110b dge 'dun rnyed pa dge slong ni //
analyzed: @110b dge 'dun rnyed pa dge slong ni //
translated: A monk who has obtained the Saṅgha’s permission

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: and so on.

original: dge 'dun la 'byung ba ni dge 'dun gyi'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun la 'byung ba ni dge 'dun gyi'o //
translated: That which arises in the Saṅgha is the Saṅgha’s.

original: rnyed pa ni gos kyi rnyed pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnyed pa ni gos kyi rnyed pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Gain refers to gain of robes and so on.

original: gcig pus zhes bya ba ni grogs med par ro //
analyzed: gcig pus zhes bya ba ni grogs med par ro //
translated: Alone means without a companion.

original: blangs nas zhes bya ba ni rang gir byas na'o //
analyzed: blangs nas zhes bya ba ni rang gir byas na'o //
translated: Having taken possession of it means having made it one’s own.

original: nyes med ces bya ba ni ltung ba med pa nyid du'o //
analyzed: nyes med ces bya ba ni ltung ba med pa nyid du'o //
translated: Without fault means without downfall.

original: gsal bar nges par smros zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: gsal bar nges par smros zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: This should be stated clearly and decisively.

original: 'di la don ni dge 'dun la bsngos pa'i rnyed pa dge slong gis rang gir byas na spang ba'i ltung ba 'byung ngo zhes bya ba ni nges pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: 'di la don ni dge 'dun la bsngos pa'i rnyed pa dge slong gis rang gir byas na spang ba'i ltung ba 'byung ngo zhes bya ba ni nges pa kho na yin no //
translated: The meaning here is that if a monk makes his own gain that is dedicated to the saṅgha, he incurs a downfall. This is certain.

original: 'on kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis ltung ba med pa nyid du gsungs so zhes bya ba de ji lta bu yin pa nges par brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis ltung ba med pa nyid du gsungs so zhes bya ba de ji lta bu yin pa nges par brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: However, the Blessed One said that there is no downfall. How is that? This should be stated clearly and decisively.

original: 'di la lan ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'di la lan ni 'di yin te /
translated: The answer to this is as follows.

original: gcig pu gnas pas rnyed pa rang gir byas pa'i dbang du mdzad nas de skad du gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gcig pu gnas pas rnyed pa rang gir byas pa'i dbang du mdzad nas de skad du gsungs pa yin no //
translated: That statement was made with reference to a monk who lives alone and makes his own gain.

original: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Similarly, here is the text:

original: btsun pa dge slong gcig pus dge 'dun gyi rnyed pa rang gir bgyis la ltung bar yang mi 'gyur ba lta mchis lags sam /
analyzed: btsun pa dge slong gcig pus dge 'dun gyi rnyed pa rang gir bgyis la ltung bar yang mi 'gyur ba lta mchis lags sam /
translated: Is there a case where a single monk, Venerable, appropriates the property of the Saṅgha for himself and does not incur an offense?

original: nye ba 'khor yod de /
analyzed: nye ba 'khor yod de /
translated: Upāli, there is.

original: 'di ltar dge slong gcig pu zhig gnas la /
analyzed: 'di ltar dge slong gcig pu zhig gnas la /
translated: It is like this: a single monk is staying in a place,

original: der yang mi dag gis dge 'dun gyi ched du gos phul na'o zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: der yang mi dag gis dge 'dun gyi ched du gos phul na'o zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: and people offer cloth for the Saṅgha there.

original: de bzhin du 'di la gzhung gzhan ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'di la gzhung gzhan ni /
translated: In this regard, there is another text:

original: btsun pa dge slong gcig pu gnas na mchis la der yang mi dag gis dge 'dun la gos bgor btub pa dge 'dun mngon du gyur pa la bgo bar bgyi ba zhig phul na des ji ltar byin gyis brlab par bgyi lags /

translated: Venerable, if a single monk is staying in a place, and people offer cloth for the Saṅgha there, which is suitable for the Saṅgha to distribute to the Saṅgha that has gathered, how should he consecrate it?

original: nye ba 'khor dge slong des gos byung ba las /
analyzed: nye ba 'khor dge slong des gos byung ba las /
translated: Upāli, that monk, having obtained the cloth,

original: gnas 'di na ni bdag gcig pu gnas pa dge 'dun gyis gos byung ba 'di ni bgor btub pa dge 'dun mngon du gyur pa las bgo par bya ba yin pas /
analyzed: gnas 'di na ni bdag gcig pu gnas pa dge 'dun gyis gos byung ba 'di ni bgor btub pa dge 'dun mngon du gyur pa las bgo par bya ba yin pas /
translated: should think, 'I am staying alone in this place. This cloth that has arisen for the Saṅgha is suitable for the Saṅgha to distribute to the Saṅgha that has gathered.

original: gos 'di bdag gi skal ba yin te bcos legs bya'o //
analyzed: gos 'di bdag gi skal ba yin te bcos legs bya'o //
translated: This robe is my share, and I will make it well.

original: sba bar bya'o //🔽bdag gis byin gyis brlab po //
analyzed: sba bar bya'o // bdag gis byin gyis brlab po //
translated: I will keep it.🔽I will consecrate it.

original: bdag gis gos 'di bcos legs bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gis gos 'di bcos legs bya'o //
translated: I will make this robe well.

original: bdag gir byin gyis brlab po zhes sems bskyed par bya zhing tshig tu yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gir byin gyis brlab po zhes sems bskyed par bya zhing tshig tu yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: I will consecrate it as mine.

original: 'on te de ltar ma byas na dge slong de gcig bus gos de rang gir mi bya ste /
analyzed: 'on te de ltar ma byas na dge slong de gcig bus gos de rang gir mi bya ste /
translated: If he does not do it in this way, that monk should not make that robe his own.

original: gal te rang gir byed na nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gal te rang gir byed na nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: If he makes it his own, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: de bzhin du mdo byed pas kyang dbang ba gcig nyid kyis shin tu mang po thob pa la ni mi dbang ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba med do zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de bzhin du mdo byed pas kyang dbang ba gcig nyid kyis shin tu mang po thob pa la ni mi dbang ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba med do zhes bshad do //
translated: In the same way, the author of the sutra explains that if one obtains many robes through a single allowance, there is no reason for them not to be allowed.

original: 'grel pa byed pas kyang @111a * //
analyzed: 'grel pa byed pas kyang @111a * //
translated: The author of the commentary also says:

original: 'di la 'di ltar ded dpon zhig gis dge 'dun gyi ched du rnyed pa rab tu mang po gtsug lag khang du bskur ba dang gtsug lag khang de na dge slong gcig pu zhig gnas pa mi rung ngo snyam nas len par mi byed pa dang /
analyzed: 'di la 'di ltar ded dpon zhig gis dge 'dun gyi ched du rnyed pa rab tu mang po gtsug lag khang du bskur ba dang gtsug lag khang de na dge slong gcig pu zhig gnas pa mi rung ngo snyam nas len par mi byed pa dang /
translated: A caravan leader sent much wealth to a monastery for the sake of the saṅgha, but a single monk living in that monastery did not accept it, thinking, “It is not proper.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de ni de na gang gnas pa de dbang ngo zhes rjes su gnang ngo zhes bshad do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de ni de na gang gnas pa de dbang ngo zhes rjes su gnang ngo zhes bshad do //
translated: The Bhagavān allowed, “Whoever lives there has control over it.”

original: sdom brtson can gyis dge 'dun gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: sdom brtson can gyis dge 'dun gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Those who are diligent in vows should not use the saṅgha’s property and so on.

original: rung ba ni kha na ma tho ba med pa ste /
analyzed: rung ba ni kha na ma tho ba med pa ste /
translated: Proper means without offense.

translated: Therefore, I am victorious.

original: zhes pa 'byung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: zhes pa 'byung ba'i phyir te /
translated: This is stated.

original: 'di la don ni spyir mchod rten la phul ba'i rdzas blangs na gdon mi za bar ltung bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: 'di la don ni spyir mchod rten la phul ba'i rdzas blangs na gdon mi za bar ltung bar 'gyur na /
translated: Here, the meaning is this: If one takes substances offered to a stūpa, one will certainly fall.

original: 'on kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis de la ltung ba med pa kho nar gsungs so zhes bya ba de ji lta bu yin zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis de la ltung ba med pa kho nar gsungs so zhes bya ba de ji lta bu yin zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: However, the Blessed One said that there is no downfall in that case. How is that?

original: 'di la lan ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'di la lan ni 'di yin te /
translated: The answer is this:

original: nyan thos kyi mchod rten la bsngos pa'i dbang du mdzad nas de skad du gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi mchod rten la bsngos pa'i dbang du mdzad nas de skad du gsungs pa yin no //
translated: That was stated with reference to substances dedicated to a śrāvaka stūpa.

original: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Similarly, here the text states:

original: dbyar gyi nang rol dag tu mchod rten dang mchod rten la 'du ba'i rnyed pa bgos la ltung bar mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: dbyar gyi nang rol dag tu mchod rten dang mchod rten la 'du ba'i rnyed pa bgos la ltung bar mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: If one distributes the gains dedicated to the stūpa and the stūpa community during the rainy season retreat, there is no downfall.

original: rung bar yang 'gyur ba lta mchis lags sam /
analyzed: rung bar yang 'gyur ba lta mchis lags sam /
translated: Is it possible to make it suitable?

original: nye ba 'khor yod de /
analyzed: nye ba 'khor yod de /
translated: Upagupta, it is possible.

original: nyan thas kyi mchod rten la bsngos pa yin la shi ba'i yo byad yin par bsams nas bgos na'o zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: nyan thas kyi mchod rten la bsngos pa yin la shi ba'i yo byad yin par bsams nas bgos na'o zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: If one thinks that it is an object of the deceased and distributes it, thinking it was dedicated to a stupa of a sravaka.

original: de bzhin du mdo byed pas kyang nyan thos kyi mchod rten la phul ba ni tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams dbang ba nyid yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de bzhin du mdo byed pas kyang nyan thos kyi mchod rten la phul ba ni tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams dbang ba nyid yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: Similarly, the author of the sutra also explains that what is offered to a stupa of a sravaka belongs to those who practice pure conduct.

original: yang na dri ba dang lan 'di ni don gyi dbang gis gzhan du yang sbyar bar rung bas /
analyzed: yang na dri ba dang lan 'di ni don gyi dbang gis gzhan du yang sbyar bar rung bas /
translated: Moreover, this question and answer can be applied elsewhere by the power of the meaning.

original: nyan thos kyi la bsngos pa'i rdzas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi la bsngos pa'i rdzas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Thus, it says, “A substance dedicated to a sravaka,” and so on.

original: nyan thos kyi mchod rten la bsngos pa'i rdzas sngom can gyis blangs na ji ltar thub pas ltung ba dang bcas par gsungs pa sngom brtson can smros shig ces bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi mchod rten la bsngos pa'i rdzas sngom can gyis blangs na ji ltar thub pas ltung ba dang bcas par gsungs pa sngom brtson can smros shig ces bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: If an ascetic takes a substance dedicated to a stupa of a sravaka, how does the Muni declare it to be a downfall?

original: bsngos pa ni nges par btang ba ste byin pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bsngos pa ni nges par btang ba ste byin pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The term “dedicate” means to give up, which is to say, to give.

original: de ci zhig ce na /
analyzed: de ci zhig ce na /
translated: What is it?

original: rdzas zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rdzas zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The term “substance” is stated.

original: gos dang rgyan la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gos dang rgyan la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is clothing, ornaments, and so on.

original: gang la bsngos pa zhe na mchod rten la'o //
analyzed: gang la bsngos pa zhe na mchod rten la'o //
translated: To what is it dedicated? To a stupa.

original: mchod rten la ste de'i don ni bshad @112a * //
analyzed: mchod rten la ste de'i don ni bshad @112a * //
translated: The meaning of “stupa” has already been explained.

original: zin to // 'og nas mchod rten las zhes 'chad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: zin to // 'og nas mchod rten las zhes 'chad par 'gyur te /
translated: Later, it will be explained as “from a stupa.”

original: des na don gyi dbang gis rnam par dbye ba sgyur la mchod rten la zhes bdun par bya'o //
analyzed: des na don gyi dbang gis rnam par dbye ba sgyur la mchod rten la zhes bdun par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, by the power of the meaning, the analysis is changed to “to a stupa,” which is in the seventh case.

original: mchod rten la zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod rten la yang yod pas gang dang 'brel pa'i mchod rten la zhe na /
analyzed: mchod rten la zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod rten la yang yod pas gang dang 'brel pa'i mchod rten la zhe na /
translated: The term “to a stupa” also exists for a stupa of a tathāgata. Therefore, to which stupa is it related?

original: nyan thos kyi la zhes smos so //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi la zhes smos so //
translated: The term “to a śrāvaka” is stated.

original: kun shes pa'i 'bras bu sgrogs pas na nyan thos de dgra bcom pa la sogs pa la zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: kun shes pa'i 'bras bu sgrogs pas na nyan thos de dgra bcom pa la sogs pa la zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: A śrāvaka is one who proclaims the fruit of complete understanding. Therefore, it means “to an arhat and so on.”

original: rdzas gang las blangs na zhe na /
analyzed: rdzas gang las blangs na zhe na /
translated: From what substance is it taken?

original: mchod rten las zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: mchod rten las zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The term “from a stupa” is stated.

original: sdom brtson zhes bya ba ni bod pa'o //
analyzed: sdom brtson zhes bya ba ni bod pa'o //
translated: The one called “one who is diligent in the vows” is a Tibetan.

original: des na don gyis nyan thos kyi mchod rten la phul ba'i rdzas ni bcom ldan 'das kyis tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams kho na la 'os pa nyid yin no zhes bka' stsal pa ltung ba med pa nyid du gsungs na /
analyzed: des na don gyis nyan thos kyi mchod rten la phul ba'i rdzas ni bcom ldan 'das kyis tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams kho na la 'os pa nyid yin no zhes bka' stsal pa ltung ba med pa nyid du gsungs na /
translated: Therefore, the Blessed One said that it is not a downfall to offer things to a śrāvaka stūpa, since the Blessed One said that the things offered to a śrāvaka stūpa are suitable only for those who practice pure conduct.

original: 'on kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam pa 'ga' zhig de ltung ba dang bcas pa nyid du gsungs so zhes bya ba de ji lta bu yin pa de kho bo la smros shig ces bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam pa 'ga' zhig de ltung ba dang bcas pa nyid du gsungs so zhes bya ba de ji lta bu yin pa de kho bo la smros shig ces bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: However, the Blessed One said that in some cases it is a downfall. Tell me what that is.

original: 'di la lan ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'di la lan ni 'di yin te /
translated: The answer to this is as follows.

original: 'phags pa ba ra dva dza bsod snyoms len la sogs pa bzhugs pa'i nyan thos kyi mchod rten gyi dkor blangs pa la dgongs nas de skad du gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'phags pa ba ra dva dza bsod snyoms len la sogs pa bzhugs pa'i nyan thos kyi mchod rten gyi dkor blangs pa la dgongs nas de skad du gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The Blessed One said that in order to take the wealth of a śrāvaka stūpa where āryas such as the brāhmaṇa Bāvarī and the one who takes alms live.

original: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Similarly, here is the text:

original: dbyar gyi nang dag tu mchod rten dang mchod rten la 'du ba'i rnyed pa bgos na ltung bar yang mi 'gyur ba lta mchis lags sam /
analyzed: dbyar gyi nang dag tu mchod rten dang mchod rten la 'du ba'i rnyed pa bgos na ltung bar yang mi 'gyur ba lta mchis lags sam /
translated: Is there any case where, in the course of the summer, it is not a transgression to distribute the offerings to the stupa and the offerings to the community?

original: nye ba 'khor yod de /
analyzed: nye ba 'khor yod de /
translated: Upali, there is such a case.

original: nyan thos kyi mchod rten la bsngos pa yin la shi ba'i yo byad yin par bsams nas bgos na'o zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi mchod rten la bsngos pa yin la shi ba'i yo byad yin par bsams nas bgos na'o zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: It is when the offerings are made to the stupa of a Sravaka, and one thinks that they are the property of the deceased.

original: 'dis ni 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bu la sogs pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i mchod rten la phul ba'i rdzas ni shi ba'i yo byad yin par bsams nas bgo bar bya ba nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dis ni 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bu la sogs pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i mchod rten la phul ba'i rdzas ni shi ba'i yo byad yin par bsams nas bgo bar bya ba nyid yin gyi /
translated: This means that the property offered to the stupa of the noble Sariputra and others who have attained Nirvana is to be distributed, because it is the property of the deceased.

original: 'phags pa ba ra dva dza bsod snyoms len la sogs pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'phags pa ba ra dva dza bsod snyoms len la sogs pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: But it is not the property of the noble Varadatta and others who have attained Nirvana.

original: de na bstan pa yongs su bsrung ba'i phyir 'khor dgra bcom pa lnga brgya da rung klu'i rgyal po ru ru'i gnas na bzhugs zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de na bstan pa yongs su bsrung ba'i phyir 'khor dgra bcom pa lnga brgya da rung klu'i rgyal po ru ru'i gnas na bzhugs zhes brjod do //
translated: It is said that five hundred Arhats who were his disciples remained in the abode of the Naga king Ruru in order to protect the teaching.

original: spo ba spyod gnyis gnas gcig na //
analyzed: spo ba spyod gnyis gnas gcig na //
translated: If two monks who engage in shifting and using are in one place,🔽if they are in one place, that is, if they stay in one place for one day, why is there no fault?

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni spo ba spyod pa dang ldan pa gnyis gnas gcig na ste gnas par byed cing zhag tu gnas pas gnas par byed na ci'i phyir nyes pa med pa de nyid @112b ces bya ba kho bo la te por smros shig ces🔽bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni spo ba spyod pa dang ldan pa gnyis gnas gcig na ste gnas par byed cing zhag tu gnas pas gnas par byed na ci'i phyir nyes pa med pa de nyid @112b ces bya ba kho bo la te por smros shig ces🔽bya bar sbyar te /
translated: This is what is meant by the phrase “tell me that very reason.”
